Headline: Master Thesis OMEXOM - Development of a smart city offer in the South of Sweden
Subject: Energy and Sustainable Development
Description:
Development of a smart city offer in the South of Sweden

Dynamic urban lighting equipment and new E-mobility infrastructures are needed to help make cities attractive, safe and modern while respecting the environment in the context of the energy transition. Omexom innovates for the benefit of cities and their users to develop intelligent solutions for responsible lighting and harmonious urban mobility. Our teams support municipalities in their projects to realize the promise of smart cities.

From energy-saving technologies like LEDS to fully adaptable automated lighting systems, new solutions become available on the market that we need to implement in Omexom Service South.

Sweden, in its journey to a fossil-free country, has also to multiply the foothold of its Electrical Vehicle charging infrastructure. Omexom is currently part of the roll-out of hundreds of EV charging stations in the country and will be in charge for the period 2023-2026 to accompany the development of E-mobility for different operators in the South.

What will be the challenges raised by transport electrification in the South of Sweden? What are the challenges and constraints to keeping the balance of the electrical networks?

The student will work with the Business Unit manager and Project managers to assure a deep understanding of the lighting and EV infrastructures solutions. Visits on-site will help the student’s work. A collaboration with the local Distribution Network Operator (E.on) will bring technical elements to the study. The student will benefit also from the complementary views of local municipalities.

The master thesis must:
• Identify the challenges and opportunities of smart cities with new E-Mobility infrastructures and dynamic lighting
• Analyse the new technical solutions in the market
• Identify the critical technical points and their impact on the electrical network
• Identify the potentialities of developing simultaneous solutions in EV infrastructures and dynamic lighting for the benefit of the municipalities

You will be based in Malmö starting from January – February 2023. Further, the master thesis can lead to possible recruitment and career in the Omexom network and VINCI Energies group.

Omexom is a brand of VINCI Energies

At Omexom we have a deep conviction – energy will be at the heart of tomorrow. With today’s global energy sector undergoing constant change, Omexom works with its clients to achieve the energy transition.

Omexom’s solution targets those who produce, transform and transport electricity, including local authorities. Omexom thus helps energy producers, grid operators and territories fulfil their missions whilst simultaneously navigating the evolving landscape. Omexom’s expertise in the field of electrical grids allows us to anticipate the impact of renewable energies. We then work to develop storage solutions, make more sustainable infrastructures and meet new consumption trends. Omexom offers an entire range of engineering, construction and maintenance services to its customers. For further info check our website: https://www.omexom.se/

Headline: Master Thesis OMEOXM - Adapting high voltage substations to the increased electrical infrastructure requirements through a sustainable delivery process
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Adapting high voltage substations to the increased electrical infrastructure requirements through a sustainable delivery process

In the next decade, Swedish society will continue to experience major changes to go through the needed energy transition. Increased decarbonation and electrification of our livelihood will lead to high demands on the power grid and energy infrastructures.

As a consequence, electrical networks have to adapt rapidly to four different aspects:

1. Increase the capacity of electricity produced and transported up to the end user,
2. Absorb the irregularity of renewable energy sources,
3. Strengthen the grid resilience and stability to offer an extremely high level of service,
4. Modernise the existing infrastructure using sustainable technologies and green delivery processes.

Omexom Infratek intends to play a key role to support our customers (distribution network operators, transmission system operators and municipalities) to succeed in their adaptation to the energy transition and reach a satisfying outcome on those four aspects.

This will be achieved by integrating a number of innovative solutions and sustainable technologies, benefitting from the Omexom network in Europe.

Omexom Substation South, based in Eksjö, is a leading actor to design, build and renovate primary substations up to 130 kV for customers like E.on, Ellevio and Vattenfall Eldistribution, main distribution operators in Sweden.

The student will work with the Business Unit manager and Project managers to assure a deep understanding of the high-voltage substations design and construction process. Visits on-site will help the student’s work. A collaboration with the Distribution Network Operators will bring technical elements to the study.

The master thesis must:
• Identify the ongoing challenges and opportunities of the primary substations market in Sweden, in the context of the energy transition
• Analyse the new technical solutions in the market
• Capture the essence of smart and innovative solutions coming from Omexom's global network in Europe
• Modify our project delivery and maintenance operations towards sustainable development (carbon footprint assessment and reduction, biodiversity protection…)
• Follow spearhead projects to test green technology on distribution and substation projects
• Analyse the impact on the project eco-system (contractor, supplier, subcontractors)

You will be mainly based in Eksjö starting from January – February 2023, with the possibility of working remotely one to two days per week. Further, the master thesis can lead to possible recruitment and career in the Omexom network and VINCI Energies group.

Omexom is a brand of VINCI Energies

At Omexom we have a deep conviction – energy will be at the heart of tomorrow. With today’s global energy sector undergoing constant change, Omexom works with its clients to achieve the energy transition.

Omexom’s solution targets those who produce, transform and transport electricity, including local authorities. Omexom thus helps energy producers, grid operators and territories fulfil their missions whilst simultaneously navigating the evolving landscape. Omexom’s expertise in the field of electrical grids allows us to anticipate the impact of renewable energies. We then work to develop storage solutions, make more sustainable infrastructures and meet new consumption trends. Omexom offers an entire range of engineering, construction and maintenance services to its customers. For further info check our website: https://www.omexom.se/

Headline: Thesis Project: 30 Credits - Interpretability methods for neural network based anomaly detection
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Background
Scania is one of the world’s leading manufacturer of trucks and buses for heavy transports, as well as industrial and marine engines. Transport services and logistics services make up an increasing part of our business, which guarantees Scania’s customers cost-efficient transport solutions and high availability. Over a million Scania vehicles are in active use, in over 100 countries.

In the Connectivity section within Scania R&D, we develop new solutions for connected vehicles in our Internet of Things (IoT) platform, as part of Scania’s increasing focus on communication, services, and smart transport solutions. Advanced data analysis capabilities are a cornerstone enabler in this development.

Target/scope
Deep learning and neural networks have shown their excellence of being versatile in different learning tasks. But these models are back box in nature as it is hard to motivate its working or decisions. Currently, there are huge advancement in the field of making it more explainable/interpretable. There are both ad-hoc methods which adds in these goals in modelling and post-hoc methods that are used once the models are generated. As a part of this thesis the student will aim to develop ad-hoc or post-hoc interpretability methods for neural networks based anomaly detection concentrated on time-series data.

Literature study on existing explainable and interpretable models

Build one or more neural network methods for anomaly detection (time-series data)

Design interpretability methods for neural networks, if time permits also extend for counter factual explanations.

Quantitative and qualitative evaluation measures on the explainability/ interpretability  method.

Student will be provided access to the computing infrastructure and to the dataset required for the task.

What skill are for needed this thesis

Required

Knowledge on basic of Machine Learning ML

Knowledge on basic of Neural networks (NN) e.g. back propagation, loss, supervised learning, convolution networks, recurrent networks

Education/line/direction
Area of education or direction: Masters programmes in Machine Learning, Data Science, Engineering Mathematics, Computational Mathematics, Complex Adaptive Systems, Computer Science or similar.

Number of students: 1-2

Start date for the Thesis project: Anytime during spring 2023

Estimated timescale: 20 weeks

Contact person and supervisor
Abhishek Srinivasan, Data Scientist, 08-553 816 96, abhishek.srinivasan@scania.com
Juan-Carlos Anderesen, Manager, 08-553 835 16, juan-carlos.anderesen@scania.com

Application
Your application should contain the following:
CV.
Personal letter.
Copies of grades.

Date of publication, as from – through
Until 2022-11-05. Applicants will be assessed on a continuous basis until the position is filled. Do not wait until the last date to apply.

Headline: Thesis Work - Synthetic data generation techniques for Automotive Machine Learning
Subject: Vehicle Engineering
Description:
Thesis Worker at Volvo Cars

Welcome to explore the world of Volvo Cars by writing your thesis with us!

Scope
The thesis starts with a literature review to understand the general principles for generating and using synthetic data for machine learning models. In the next step, based on interest and the availability of appropriate simulation tools for data generation, as well as real-world data for validation, one or more use cases in the automotive area are selected for further analysis (e.g. a selection of those listed below or other appropriate examples).  
 
Examples of potential use cases include synthetic generation of: 
•    images of belted and unbelted vehicle occupants to evaluate their posture in the vehicle and whether they are correctly using their seat belt;   
•    posture and kinematics of occupants and/or injury outcome in crashes; 
•    trajectories of passenger cars in specific crash scenarios;   
•    car trajectories in everyday traffic at a specific infrastructure type or location. 

For the selected use case(s), an initial sample of synthetic data is provided / generated. A machine learning model is trained on this initial batch of synthetic data and its performance is evaluated on real-world data. This procedure is then iterated with new batches of synthetic data whose generation takes insights from the first results (i.e. possible ideas for improvement are added, e.g. adding different types of noise to the synthetic data to simulate real world noise in the acquisition process) as input.

Additionally, various ways of including a small amount of real data in the process are investigated. This can include e.g. generating synthetic data based on variations of real-world data or using some real-world data in the training or validation of the models. It is also investigated how an iterative process of starting with synthetic data and improving with real data once it arrives affects the performance.  
 
By studying relevant real-world examples, the thesis project will provide insights in the given context for some, or all the general research questions described below. 
 
Research questions:   
A.    How well does the performance of a model trained with synthetic data indicate expected performance on real-world data? How confident can we be about this indication? 
B.    How can data augmentation improve the generation or analysis of synthetic data?  Which improvements have the biggest impact on performance?
C.    To what extent can the inclusion of a small amount of real-world data in the model training process improve performance? What are effective ways to include real-world data in the process? Is the inclusion of further real-world data expected to improve model performance? 

Duration  
The thesis work will start in January 2023 for 20 weeks, conducted at R&D Analytics and AI eART at Volvo Cars in Gothenburg Torslanda. The project is appropriate for a pair of students with strong analytical and programming skills (Python) and a good understanding of machine learning and deep learning. Appropriate university programs may include Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics and/or various engineering programs.

Be part of the change – apply today!
Selection will be ongoing during the application period, so do not hesitate to send in your application. Please attach your resume, a short motivation letter, and credentials. You apply individually, but if you have a preferred partner to collaborate with you can let us know so we can consider that.

Apply as soon as possible but no later than the 7th of November.

Please note that due to GDPR applications via email will not be accepted.

For questions about the thesis work please contact András Bálint at andras.balint@volvocars.com.

Headline: Thesis Work - Seat Belt Detection
Subject: Vehicle Engineering
Description:
Thesis Worker at Volvo Cars

Welcome to explore the world of Volvo Cars by writing your thesis with us! As a thesis worker in our organization you are supported by a supervisor who follows you during your project. All thesis projects are arranged in business critical areas and therefore you will be able to contribute to our company purpose – providing freedom to move in a safe, sustainable and personal way – from day one!

Background
Volvo Cars has a long tradition of introducing novel safety features into new cars. Innovation today is driven by data insights, and so is the development of new safety systems. In-vehicle sensors, such as cameras, can give valuable information about the current state of different safety features in the car. The seat belt is an important safety feature for which the efficiency can vary depending on how the user is behaving. It is therefore important to know the current state of the seat belt fit to identify if the seat belt is in a good position with respect to the occupant’s body, or if it is twisted, too close to the neck, or even off the shoulder.

Scope
In this thesis, we want to investigate the performance of different machine learning and neural network models predicting the location of the seat belt in 2D video sequences. This will include evaluating the accuracy of the predictions, but also important computational metrics, such as processing and prediction speed, memory consumption and the trade-off behavior between e.g. speed and accuracy to investigate different optimization strategies to make the solution feasible on real computing hardware in the cars.

Areas to explore:
1.    Improve current model architecture for improved accuracy.
2.    Improve pre-processing and prediction speed with faster algorithms.
3.    Knowledge distillation: Transfer knowledge from a large model to a smaller model.
4.    Investigate trade-offs between metrics, e.g. computation speed vs. accuracy.

Duration
The thesis work will start in January 2023 for 20 weeks, conducted at R&D Analytics and AI eART at Volvo Cars in Gothenburg Torslanda. The project is appropriate for a pair of students with strong analytical and programming skills (Python) and a good understanding of machine learning and deep learning. Appropriate university programs may include Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics and/or various engineering programs.

Be part of the change – apply today!
Selection will be ongoing during the application period, so do not hesitate to send in your application. Please attach your resume, a short motivation letter, and credentials. You apply individually, but if you have a preferred partner to collaborate with you can let us know so we can consider that.

Apply as soon as possible but no later than the 7th of November.

Please note that due to GDPR applications via email will not be accepted.

For questions about the thesis work please contact Jonas Andersson at jonas.andersson.10@volvocars.com.

We are Volvo Cars
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future. Since 1927, we've been known for our commitment to safety and for creating innovative cars that make life less complicated. In 2010, we decided to radically redefine our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technology, as well as steady growth and record sales - and we're only getting started. By 2025, we aim to have yearly sales of 1.2 million cars, 50% of which will be electric vehicles and sold directly to customers through digital channels. We also intend to strengthen our position as a modern, progressive employer committed to diversity and gender and racial equality. We believe in the power of people. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars' transformation.

Headline: MSc Thesis - Multilevel DC/AC inverters with advanced gate driver circuit in Electric Vehicles
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Thesis Worker at Volvo Cars:

Welcome to explore the world of Volvo Cars by writing your thesis with us! As a thesis worker in our organization, you are supported by a supervisor who follows you during your project. All thesis projects are arranged in business-critical areas and therefore you will be able to contribute to our company purpose – providing freedom to move in a safe, sustainable and personal way – from day one!

Background:

In Electric Vehicles (EVs), the Electromagnetic Interference (EMI) from the DC/AC inverters must be kept below limits to meet legal requirement and to ensure full function. To reduce the EMI from the power electronic devices, filters with bulky capacitors and inductors are used that consume quite a lot of space and are costly. At the same time, the electric propulsion system needs to have the highest possible efficiency; therefore, multiple methods for minimizing the inverter’s losses are utilized.
Multilevel inverters have been studied as candidates for future automotive electric drives, due to their capability to function at voltages higher than the existing 800V(dc), higher efficiency and also due to their superior harmonic performance. This can also result in much lower EMI requiring smaller EMI filters

Scope:

The objective of the thesis work is to investigate the development of a new advanced gate driver board suitable for the Neutral-Point-Clamped (NPC) inverter. This new gate driver circuit will optimize inverter efficiency and EMI performance with new functionalities developed during this project.
Main tasks:
1. Conduct literature review of already existing smart gate driver solutions for inverters and study the function of the NPC converter.
2. Simulation and modelling part:
2a. Create a detailed SPICE model of the selected gate driver electronic circuit board.
2b. Develop a high-level model of the inverter’s control structure integrating the functionalities of the selected gate driver circuit.
3. Design gate driver PCB board and select all needed components for an experimental setup

Your contribution is our future:

• Electric power engineering studies or equivalent
• Matlab/Simscape or PLECS and model-based development
• Electric circuit modelling software knowledge, e.g. LTSpice or PSpice
• Knowledge of PCB design software tools
• Good English skills
• Experience of EMC/EMI is meritorious


Duration:

• The work will start in January 2023, exact date is to be discussed
• The duration for this thesis work is 20 weeks.
• 30 ECTS (academic credits) if in agreement with your Thesis Advisor in University
• This thesis is suitable for 2 students working in pair (splitting task 2 between each other).
• The work will be performed in Gothenburg


Be part of the change – apply today!

Selection will be ongoing during the application period, so do not hesitate to send in your application. Attach your CV and personal letter stating your interests within the given area and your thoughts and credentials.
Please note that applications via email will not be accepted.
Please apply no later than November 15, 2022.
If you have any additional questions regarding the thesis work, you are welcome to contact
manager: Fredrik Niklasson (fredrik.niklasson.2@volvocars.com),
supervisors: Georgios Mademlis (georgios.mademlis@volvocars.com) and Raik Orbay (raik.orbay@volvocars.com).

Headline: Scene reconstruction from 4D radar data
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
Radar 4D imaging is increasingly becoming a critical component in the automotive industry. This rejuvenation is mainly attributed to the advancement in beamforming technology and hardware capabilities. However, the contextual information reconstructed from the 4D radar is more of a functional construct and does not replace cameras’ (classical) visual information. The recent development of deep (conditional) generative models in AI has shown great potential for generating realistic images. Namely, it is possible to mimic the discriminative feature of the training data to generate new realistic images straight from 4D radar data.

These generative models can generate plausible images, given that the training data is of primary quality. Diffusion models and generative adversary networks (GAN) can generate images with higher resolution relative to other generative models, such as variational autoencoders (VAE) or normalizing flows (NF). However, these latter models do estimate the likelihood as well. Therefore, a conditional version of the diffusion model, GAN, VAE, or NF, could be the starting point for image reconstruction from 4D radar data. Furthermore, a distributional shift of the 4D radar data is also a critical key driver for the validity of these models since their deployment should not be tailored to any specific environment. Also, the proposed model should not be affected by the relative velocity of the objects in close and far proximity since this information will be conveyed using Doppler information.

Last but not least, the evaluation of this method remains of primary importance, given that there is no annotation on the given data. The data acquisition will be performed using a 4D radar and a high-resolution camera mounted on a designed road intersection. Potential radar and camera deployment on a moving vehicle will be part of the method validation. For an example, see https://youtu.be/1mXy0oi8d60?t=2404


The student is expected to:

a)Design and train generative models for synthetic data generations
b)Design and execute a protocol for collecting the training data
c)Design and validate evaluation metric for the generative models.

Prior knowledge should include:

a)Good understanding of probability for modeling and inference
b)Good knowledge of mathematics behind neural network components
c)Understanding of optimizations and the mathemaPythonround gradient-based methods
d)Fluency in python and some experience with popular frameworks such as Pytorch, Keras, Tensorflow, etc.


What we offer:

a)Computation GPU resources for the experiment
b)Training data from both camera and state-of-the-art 4D radar
c)Financial compensation upon completion of the work

Headline: Studenter sökes till industri/logistik tjänster
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Är du student och är på jakt efter ett flexibelt extrajobb? Vi på Adecco i Stockholm söker nu efter ett flertal studenter till vår studentpool!

Om tjänsten
Som student hos oss har du möjlighet att arbeta på varierade uppdrag inom bland annat industri och logistik. Du är en viktig pusselbit för vår kund vid arbetstoppar och korttidsfrånvaro.
Du kommer att ingå i vår pool av extraarbetare vilket innebär att du kan få jobba hos flera av våra uppdragsgivare och på så vis bredda din kompetens.

Om dig
Vi söker dig som är studerande och som gärna har något år kvar av dina studier. Erfarenheter från arbete inom lager eller industri är meriterande. Vi ser gärna att du har körkort eller Truckkort, men det är inget krav.
Som person är du serviceorienterad och trivs med att arbeta med kunder. Vidare ser vi att du är flexibel och kan hoppa in och göra punktinsatser vid kort varsel. Du trivs med ett högt arbetstempo och glada kollegor!

Viktigt för tjänsten är:
- flexibilitet
- social kompetens
- servicekänsla
Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.

Tjänsten är en del av vår personaluthyrning. Du är anställd av oss på Adecco men arbetar ute hos våra kunder. Att vara ambulerande konsult innebär att man blir anställd av oss på Adecco för att utföra arbete i kundföretag och vars arbetsplats, arbetstid och arbetsuppgifter sålunda kan variera inom ett överenskommet tjänstgöringsområde.

Om anställningen
Tjänsten är ett konsultuppdrag med start omgående.
Som konsult får du en anställning i Adecco Student. Vi erbjuder extrajobb för dig som är studerande.

Om Adecco
Adecco är världens största rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. I Sverige finns vi på ca 50 orter och har 5000 anställda. Vår storlek gör att vi har kunder i de flesta olika branscher och en anställning som konsult hos oss leder ofta till att både ditt sociala och professionella kontaktnät växer. Då vi på Adecco samarbetar med många attraktiva företag som anlitar oss för sina personalbehov finns också chans att du erbjuds tjänster som aldrig når den öppna marknaden.


Kontaktuppgifter
Har du frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare:
Anastasija Mladenovic på anastasija.mladenovic@adecco.se
Har du frågor angående registreringen var vänlig kontakta vår support via info@adecco.se

Välkommen med din ansökan!

Headline: Examensarbete - 30 hp: Modell för sammanlagringsfaktor i försörjningssystem för elkraft
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Scania Industrial Maintenance AB är ett tekniskt produktionsstödjande bolag som är en del av Scania CV AB. Vi har ett brett utbud av tjänster inom industriella projekt och vi ansvarar för produktions- och fastighetsunderhållet inom Scania. Vi är ca 1000 anställda i Södertälje, Oskarshamn och Luleå. Inom hela vår verksamhet arbetar vi tillsammans för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra leveranser, våra metoder och vår kompetens. Hos oss finns specialistkompetens inom bland annat automation, styr & regler, el och VVS. Alla anställda har möjlighet till resultatbonus och vi erbjuder attraktiva förmåner såsom arbetstidsförkortning, personalbil och förmånliga priser på Scanias egna semesterbostäder i Sverige.

Examensarbete är ett utmärkt sätt att få närmare kontakt med Scania och bygga relationer för framtiden. Många av dagens medarbetare började Scaniakarriären med sitt examensarbete.

Bakgrund
Med ökat fokus på hållbar produktion står Scania inför stora utmaningar att optimera sina energi försörjningssystem.Den största delen av tillförd energi används i våra processer för att driva våra maskiner och utrustningar.

Uppdragsbeskrivning
Uppdraget innebär att utreda potential och möjligheter att i tidiga skeden beräkna sammanlagringsfaktor från maskin/produktionsutrustning i fabrik, via betjänande transformator till ställverk/station.

Arbetet utgår från "slöseri" dvs att nivå på investering alt. nyttjandegrad på befintlig investering ska utföras på rätt nivå. Dvs att med fakta undvika dels överinvestering dels otillräcklig nivå på försörjningssystem.

Genomförande
Arbetet utförs med handledning från institution samt utsedd handledare på avdelningen QFX i Södertälje.
Studenten ska vara närvarande på Scanias produktionsanläggning i Södertälje i omfattning som behövs för att
uppfylla målet. QFX tillhandahåller kontorsplats med bärbar dator och erforderligt stöd

Mål
Målet är att ta fram ett metodstöd för beräkning av simuleringsfaktorer för elkraft
Krav- och behovsstudie samt nulägesanalys.
-Identifiera nuläget. Förstå behov och krav som svarar på frågan ”varför är kunskap om
sammanlagringringsfaktor viktig”. Kraven kan exempelvis uttryckas i kvalitetstekniska termer,
säkerhetsaspekter men även dimensioneringstekniska termer såsom effekt och amper.
Inventering av utförda forskningsrapporter som är relevanta för uppdraget.
- Inventera utvalt delsystem (pilot) innehållande nivåerna #1, #2 och #3 inklusive maskiner och utrustningar.
Förstå kopplingen i försörjningsystemet mellan de olika nivåerna.
- Översiktlig bedömning/beräkning av befintliga sammanlagringsfaktorer på utvalt delsystem. Beskriva hinder
och möjligheter till optimering och förbättring.
- Sammanställning och delredovisning.
Analys och förståelse.
- Skapa modell för metodstöd för att identifiera storlekar på sammanlagringsfaktorer i nivå #1, #2 och #3.
Testa modellen på utvald pilot.
Sammanställning och delredovisning.
Slutsatser och resultat.
- Redogöra för aggregerad potential, metodbeskrivning och resultat från tillämpning av metod på pilot.
- Slutrapport och slutredovisning.

Utbildning/linje/inriktning
Utbildning, linje eller inriktning: Energi-/Elteknisk utbildning, Civ. ing
Antal studerande: Troligtvis mest anpassat för 1 st student. 2 studenter kan vara aktuellt också.
Startdatum för ex-jobbet: Q1-2023
Beräknad tidsåtgång: 30 HP (20 veckor)

Kontaktpersoner och handledare:
Uppdragsgivare: Roland Dahlström, roland.dahlstrom@scania.com 070-5534995
Handledare: Henrik Höglund, henrik.hoglund@scania.com

Ansökan:
Din ansökan ska innehålla CV, personligt brev och betygsutdrag

Headline: Studentkonsult Hållbarhet
Subject: Sustainability
Description:
Extrajobba som studentkonsult med uppdrag inom cirkulära affärsmodeller och LCA på Dafo Brand AB.

Arbetsbeskrivning
Som studentkonsult på Dafo Brand AB blir ditt arbete ett viktigt bidrag till att fortsätta utveckla vårt hållbarhetsarbete och gå i bräschen för brandskyddsbranschen. Du kommer att arbeta med att hjälpa oss att ta fram ett erbjudande baserat på cirkulär ekonomi med syfte att minska vår miljö- och klimatpåverkan. I arbetet ingår att ta fram en strukturerad process för Livscykelanalys (LCA) och klimatberäkningar. Genom arbetet kommer du att lära dig mycket om cirkulära affärsmodeller, få praktisk erfarenhet av LCA och bidra till en hållbar utveckling.

Vem vi söker
Intresse för miljö och hållbarhetsfrågor med fokus på klimatomställningen cirkulära affärsmodeller
Erfarenhet av LCA, klimatberäkningar och liknande
Studerar till civilingenjör eller motsvarande inom relevant område
God vana av att arbeta med datahantering och förmåga att jobba obehindrat i Excel
De personliga egenskaper som är viktiga för rollen är noggrannhet och självgående
Det är också meriterande om du har:

Erfarenhet från brandskyddsbranschen och/eller andra produktorienterade branscher
Villkor
Arbetsplats: Från kontoret i Tyresö för att komma in i arbetet, sedan flexibelt från valfri plats
Omfattning: 8–12 timmar i veckan i ca tre månader, med eventuell förlängning
Ersättning: Marknadsmässig timlön som studentkonsult
Tillträde: Omgående

Intresserad?
För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta hållbarhetschef Scarlett Roa, scarlett.roa@dafo.se. Ansökan skickas till rekrytering@dafo.se.

Headline: Degree project in molecular programming
Subject: Biotechnology
Description:
The Molecular Programming research group at Scilifelab led by Ian Hoffecker is looking for a motivated Master's thesis student interested in exploring the frontiers of biotechnology with us.  Our aim is to develop novel biotechnologies that leverage the programmable information storage capabilities of DNA to create molecular logical circuits, control the interactions of molecules, define structures at the nanoscale, and gather information from biological specimens through DNA sequencing methods.

The thesis concept is an exploratory molecular programming simulation project that would be at the interface of AI/neural networks and DNA physics/informatics and would involve programming (e.g. in Python or Julia). The project would be well suited to students in disciplines like computer science, applied math, chemical engineering, physics, biotechnology or other fields provided some programming experience or some exposure to AI/neural networks and, of course, an interest in DNA biotechnology. You will have the opportunity to shape the direction and specific aims of your project.

We are in the Gene Technology department at KTH on the Scilifelab campus, a vibrant collaborative environment with huge international visibility, shared state-of-the-art facilities, and fantastic colleagues. We are building a diverse, multidisciplinary group. You will get to work with and learn from an amazing bunch of fellow students and experienced scientists.

For more information please contact the group leader directly at ithof@kth.se with your CV and brief letter of motivation describing your scientific interests and educational goals.

Headline: Master Thesis Project: Model Based Testing for Programmable Data Planes
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Your future challenge
With Software Defined Networking (SDN) and programmable data planes it is possible to program the networking function all the way down to the silicon performing the switching of data packets. However, with programmability comes the risk of introducing bugs in the software. To mitigate this, testing can be used to identify the bugs. But the number of states in the data plane configuration together with number of combinations of network protocol fields in data packets makes testing an arduous task.

This master thesis project will study how Model Based Testing can be applied to a programmable data plane. Included in the project are the following steps:

Identification of strategies for reducing the number of combinations of tests.
Propose a model for the behavior of a data plane function.
Select a framework for test automation and implement a prototype of the proposed model.
The results will be presented in a written report.
The details of the project will be determined during the first week of the project where the student will write a specification and time plan for the project.

Your profile
This project is suitable for a master student in computer science, electrical engineering, engineering physics or other relevant education. Excellent programming skills in one or more high level programming languages as well as shell scripting. Analytical abilities are also required for this project. Furthermore, the student should be structured and able to work independently.

What you will be part of
Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 18,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer, more sustainable and more equitable world.

Business area Surveillance offers world-leading sensor technology in monitoring and decision support to protect against threats. The portfolio covers airborne, ground-based and naval radar, electronic warfare, C4I solutions, aviation systems and cyber security.

PU Communications is part of BU Combat Systems in Surveillance and is responsible for the design of robust solutions and infrastructure in network, radio and satellite communications. We design and implement systems in flying and land-based platforms.

Contact for information on the project: Anders Gunnar (PhD), +46 10-215 53 40, anders.gunnar@saabgroup.com.

Headline: Master Thesis Project - Lateral control availability in faulted state
Subject: Vehicle Engineering
Description:
CEVT is here to make urban mobility enjoyable, smart and sustainable. We fast-track innovation and transform ideas into pioneering technology solutions. Automotive is in our DNA and intelligent mobility is our core. We serve society with sustainable mobility solutions, both private and shared. As part of ZEEKR and the Geely family, one of the most innovative and fastest growing global mobility groups, our work comes to life in products and services from world-leading brands. CEVT was built by people from all over the world. We’re flexible, fast, and always in motion.

Master Thesis Project -  Lateral control availability in faulted state

Subject: Develop and verify strategies for increased availability of lateral control

Background
Automation in vehicles is becoming more commonplace and increasing in complexity. This drives the critical need for intervention by redundant systems in case of failure or major loss of system functionality. If the primary motion control system fails in an autonomous vehicle, there is a need for an independent backup system, especially for drive by wire systems for autonomous vehicles. In simple terms, how do you make an autonomous vehicle reach a safe position in different traffic scenarios when the steering system has failed. This thesis work will explore different strategies and possibilities of using longitudinal subsystem to increase availability of lateral control.

Scope
As a master thesis student you will work closely with the vehicle dynamics group and solution architects to investigate and identify the best strategy for better availability of lateral control in a faulted state. This work includes literature study and benchmark of different strategies and legal requirements, model development in Simulink, scenario development and demonstration in our dynamic simulator. This could be done by utilizing longitudinal actuators within the vehicle platform. Vehicle models for 1D simulation and support for integration into the Driver in the Loop simulator will be provided by CEVT.

Key project steps
Define and develop use cases and scenarios
Identify lateral control availability compliant with legal requirements
Build Simulink models and verify in Model in Loop environment (1D simulations)
Demonstrate strategies in DIL simulator

Prerequisites
Vehicle dynamics and control systems interest
Strong Matlab/Simulink skills
Analytical mindset
Excellent communication skills


Number of students: 2, please apply with CV and cover letter.
Starting date: January 2023. The duration of the thesis work is 20 weeks


For more information about the master thesis project please contact:
Mattias Larsson, SW Solution Architect, mattias.larsson@cevt.se

Last application date: 2022-11-02
Apply today. We will perform ongoing selection during the application period. We look forward to hearing from you!

Please note that due to GDPR regulations we can only accept applications sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.

Headline: Master Thesis Project - CO2 Reduction and Contribution to GHG emissions
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
CEVT is here to make urban mobility enjoyable, smart and sustainable. We fast-track innovation and transform ideas into pioneering technology solutions. Automotive is in our DNA and intelligent mobility is our core. We serve society with sustainable mobility solutions, both private and shared. As part of ZEEKR and the Geely family, one of the most innovative and fastest growing global mobility groups, our work comes to life in products and services from world-leading brands. CEVT was built by people from all over the world. We’re flexible, fast, and always in motion.

Master Thesis Project -  CO2 Reduction and Contribution to GHG emissions

Subject: Identify Body & Exterior CO2 Contribution and Propose Improvements

Background

The global warming is a major problem, and the automotive industry is a part of it. The Paris agreement targets max 1,5degree temperature rise by 2100. UN strategy of reducing the GHG emissions by 50% by 2030 and be carbon neutral 2050, put significant requirements on the industry to improve their impact.

In Europe, independent neutral initiative is established called Green NCAP to compare and promote vehicle manufacturer to develop vehicles/ cars that are clean, energy efficient and cause a little harm to environment as possible.

Scope

The master thesis is about understand the level of Body and Exterior contribution to complete vehicle CO2 impact, and by analyzing propose alternative solutions or directions of development to reach it targets.


Project steps

Understand situation

Perform LCA analysis by using the CEVT simulation model on Body and Exterior Components. Evaluation of method to be included. Is method used state of art? Compare CEVT simulation model with GABI simulation tool.

Connect above analysis with the method of evaluating Green NCAP and by that understand what the difference between real emissions and consumer rated emissions.

Identify Main Contributors and Evaluate Target

Identify the contributors for CO2. Define method for evaluation, i.e what contributors to continue study in next step.
Evaluate potential with group target and judge if realistic.

Identify Potential Improvements or Changes

For selected contributors, investigate alternative process, materials or design changes to improve impact. Report out findings.



Prerequisites

Mechanical or Electrical Engineer, preferably in Product Development with an Environmental focus.
Open-minded, willy to search for information and by that create pre-requisites.
Review with supervisor on CEVT calculation method.


Number of students: 2, please apply with CV and cover letter.

Starting date: January 2023. The duration of the thesis work is 20 weeks



For more information about the master thesis project please contact:

Stefan Cederström, Head of Exterior System | +46 721 84 36 18 - stefan.cederstrom@cevt.se
Marcus Schill, SMTE Polymer Materials |+46 731 44 18 61 - marcus.schill@cevt.se

Last application date: 2022-11-02

Apply today. We will perform ongoing selection during the application period. We look forward to hearing from you!

Please note that due to GDPR regulations we can only accept applications sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.

Headline: Master Thesis Project - Cloud-native vehicle software development and deployment.
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
CEVT is here to make urban mobility enjoyable, smart and sustainable. We fast-track innovation and transform ideas into pioneering technology solutions. Automotive is in our DNA and intelligent mobility is our core. We serve society with sustainable mobility solutions, both private and shared. As part of ZEEKR and the Geely family, one of the most innovative and fastest growing global mobility groups, our work comes to life in products and services from world-leading brands. CEVT was built by people from all over the world. We’re flexible, fast, and always in motion.

Master Thesis Project - Cloud-native vehicle software development and deployment.

Subject:

The Scalable Open Architecture for Embedded Edge (SOAFEE) project is an industry-led collaboration defined by automakers, semiconductor suppliers, open-source and independent software vendors, and cloud technology leaders. The initiative intends to deliver a cloud-native architecture enhanced for mixed-criticality automotive applications with corresponding open-source reference implementations to enable commercial and non-commercial offerings.

Background

The background is to be found in these documents:

SOAFEE White Paper 1: How the SOAFEE Architecture Brings A Cloud-Native Approach To Mixed Critical Automotive Systems'.

SOAFEE White paper 2: Accelerating Software-Defined Vehicles through Cloud-To-Vehicle Edge Environmental Parity


Scope

With references to the White Papers:

As an example of the first phase of cloud-native software development, imagine a developer sitting in a café with her/his laptop, connecting to the cloud, developing their advanced driving assistance system (ADAS), such as adaptive cruise control or lateral line control, application, commiting the code, and triggering a build and integration cycle in the cloud on a virtual execution environment closely representing the physical automotive target system, assuming environment parity between cloud and automotive edge.

In the coming phases, the developer can run SIL simulations in the cloud, deploy the software to HIL rigs, do run-time verifications in the vehicle. The different stages in the update are finished by vehicle engineers allocated all over the world and during any time of the day.


Thesis overview/Project steps
Collecting general information about the technology exemplified by the SOAFEE initiative. Understand how it can be utilized at CEVT. Present the information at CEVT.
Specifically understand how the Environment Parity between cloud and vehicle can be achieved in a CEVT case. Document it and present it at CEVT.
Follow the SOAFEE initiative.

Prerequisites
Knowledge and interest in software development.
Understanding cloud native vehicle development.
Able to work independently and cooperatively.
Understanding of the technology exemplified in the SOAFEE initiative.
Future Master of Data or Electrical Engineering or equivalent.

Number of students: 2, please apply with CV and cover letter.
Starting date: January 2023. The duration of the thesis work is 20 weeks

For more information about the master thesis project please contact:

Thomas Söderqvist, Electrical Architecture Expert, +46729802027, thomas.soderqvist@cevt.se

Last application date: 2022-11-02

Apply today. We will perform ongoing selection during the application period. We look forward to hearing from you!

Please note that due to GDPR regulations we can only accept applications sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.

Headline: Master Thesis - Virtualized Network Infrastructure
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
About this opportunity


The network automation team of the Network and Storage operations at Ericsson Service Area Network (SAN SAL NWS) is tasked with building automated services for enabling connectivity to corporate data centers through the company's network infrastructure. As connectivity volume increases, development of automated services need to be accelerated. As example, one network service being automated at the moment is VPN, Virtual Private Network. When it's fully deployed, for setting up, modifying or deleting one VPN connection, users will simply have to order one either from our ordering page, or via APIs, and service will be delivered all automatically. Many other services are already fully automated and deployed.

One important development enabler is to create a virtual network infrastructure, a simulated version of our network, to be used during development activities for performing tests and trials of new automated services.

The scope of this thesis work is to investigate, plan and prototype a virtual version of our network infrastructure. This virtual network will be interacted with for quick feedback to persons in our different development teams.



What you will do


The students on this assignment will be expected to propose a basic architecture for building a virtual version of a network infrastructure. Then together with the support team, a build plan will be drafted, before implementation of a prototype by the students.



You will bring


This project aims to have a student in electrical engineering, computer science, computer engineering, network specialists or similar areas.

The successful candidate should have following characteristics:
Good understanding about virtualization technologies
Good understanding of networking
Familiar to concept of network automation
Familiar to software development concepts
Some software architecture awareness
Preferred qualifications
Software development using Object Oriented Python

Why join Ericsson?


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.



What happens once you apply?


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

Feel free to apply and include a resume in English, outlining how you meet the specific requirements of the position.

The selection and interview process is ongoing. Therefore, send in your application in English as soon as possible.



Location: Stockholm, Sweden.

Headline: Master thesis 30 credits – Control-oriented temperature estimation model for electric machine
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Background
Our team is responsible for control and health monitoring of electric components in Scania battery electric vehicles (EV). Electric machine (EM) is a vital part in any EV whose operating conditions should be monitored and controlled for satisfactory performance. As EM runs, electrical and mechanical losses generate heat leading to temperature build up in different parts of EM. Overheating can damage the EM, lead to premature wear, and result in torque degradation. To prevent these negative effects, it is important to maintain optimal operating temperature around the EM via smart control of lubrication oil flow over the EM. Meanwhile, it is always desired to have as few sensors on our components as possible and therefore a reliable temperature estimation model is a key enabler.

Goal and Assignment description
A control-oriented temperature estimation model is to be developed for the electric machine. The model parameters have to be identified through proper techniques, and the model has to be validated against measurement data. The proposed model should exhibit high performance in estimating the highest temperature in the electric machine. The model should be implemented in Simulink, and model specifications shall be documented in the thesis report. Simulation results should be presented at Scania R&D.

The project is planned to take 20 weeks with start in January.

Why is this a good opportunity for you?

Doing a master thesis is always a good way to open the doorway into a future career at the industry. We highly value the outcome of this master thesis and you will therefore be supported by our experienced engineers along the way while learning how to deliver an industry level controller friendly model.

You profile
We think that you

Have a master degree in mechatronic systems, technical physics, mechanical engineering or similar program.
Have passed courses with good grades in all or some of the topics such as control theory, signal processing, modelling and simulation, thermodynamics, hydraulics systems.
Have already used Matlab Simulink in your course projects.
Can easily communicate and write in English.
Are a structured person and can effectively work both independently and also in a team.

Application
Your application should include a CV, grades from courses at university and a cover letter where you shortly describe why you think this is a good thesis for you.

Selections will be made throughout the application period.

Contact person
If you need more information, please contact the thesis supervisor, Iman Shafikhani at 0855350958 (only 9 AM to 5 pm) or iman.shafikhani@scania.com

Headline: Evaluation or real drive data of a refuse fuel cell truck
Subject: Energy and Sustainable Development
Description:
In a pilot project supported by EU and Swedish Energy Agency, a refuse truck produced by Scania and JOAB has been equipped with a fuel cell system (including a hybrid battery) developed and produced by the company Powercell. The truck fuelled with hydrogen, aimed to pick up recycled materials from city businesses, is completely silent and only emits clean water, which is better for city air, noise quality and driver comfort. In fact, the propulsion, loading and compaction of the waste all take place with the electricity which is produced in the fuel cells. The heat generated is used to heat the cab. The truck is presently in use to collect waste by Revona in Gothenburg. See more information at:
https://www.scania.com/group/en/home/newsroom/news/2021/swedens-first-ever-hydrogen-powered-refuse-collection-truck.html
The driving data has been collected and will be used for analysis and for comparison with other alternative drivelines and vehicle fuels. This master thesis project focuses on analysing the data in order to learn more about the load profile for this application, how the fuel cell system is operated, and how it can be optimised even further.
The project will be performed at Div. Applied Electrochemistry at Dept. Chemical Engineering at KTH in collaboration with the involved companies.
Supervisor: Martina Butori and Pontus Svens, Examinator:  Göran Lindbergh

Headline: Examensarbete inom Autonom skogsplantering - framtidens hållbara skogsbruk - VT 2023
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Är du i slutet av din utbildning inom datateknik, IT, inbyggda system, mekatronik, teknisk fysik eller liknande och letar efter examensarbete till våren? Leta inte längre!
BIT ADDICT är ett ingenjörs- och konsultbolag med huvudkontor i Göteborg. Vi på BIT ADDICT älskar teknik och att utvecklas som problemlösare. Just nu söker vi dig som skall skriva ditt exjobb och har ett gediget intresse för mjukvaruutveckling, bildbehandling, och/eller matematik.

Uppgiftsbeskrivning
I projektet BraSatt, som drivs av Södra Skogsägarna, utvecklas ett fordon för att autonomt plantera gran- och tallplantor som en del i framtidens hållbara skogsbruk. BIT ADDICT ansvarar för fordonets styrsystem, för autonom navigation och perception. I dagsläget sker plantering oftast i två steg: maskinell markberedning följt av manuell plantering. Den maskinella markberedningen ökar plantornas chans till överlevnad, men är energikrävande och åsamkar skogsmarken skada. Den manuella planteringsprocessen är skonsam, men förlitar sig på planterarens kompetens och tillgång till arbetskraft.

I BraSatt vävs de två stegen samman till ett: en relativt liten skogsmaskin navigerar autonomt runt på ett kalhygge för att markbereda och plantera i ett kombinerat steg. De potentiella vinsterna för miljö och ekonomi är stora, men kräver teknisk innovation på många fronter för att realiseras.

Om examensarbetet:
Computer Vision för evaluering av trädplantering
Skogsmaskinen väljer en planteringspunkt med hjälp av en stereokamera och utför sedan planteringen autonomt. Från en bild på plantan och marken efter planteringstillfället vill vi undersöka huruvida det är möjligt att med Computer Vision bedöma hur väl planteringen utförts. Ett första steg är att bekräfta att en planta faktiskt planterats på den valda punkten. Vidare kan plantans orientering, analys av jorden den planteras i samt närområdets karakteristik vara intressanta parametrar att identifiera. Relevanta förkunskaper: Computer Vision, Maskininlärning


Publik information om projektet BraSatt:
https://brasatt.se
https://iskogen.se/skogsbruk/andra-chansen-for-planteringsmaskiner/
https://www.sodra.com/sv/se/skog-medlem/aktuellt/nyheter/2021/for-alla-vo/kontrakt-med-samarbetspartners-for-projektet-brasatt-ar-nu-klara/
https://www.sodra.com/sv/se/skog-medlem/aktuellt/sodrakontakt/nyhetsartiklar/2021/nummer-2/full-fart-framat-i-projektet-brasatt/

Vilka är BIT ADDICT?
BIT ADDICT är ett ingenjörs- och konsultbolag med fokus på att möjliggöra innovation åt kunder som är ledande inom sina respektive branscher. Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Göteborg. Vi erbjuder anpassade utvecklingsprojekt och konsulter inom följande specialistområden:
Beräkningsmjukvara
Sensorik & Styrsystem
AI & Maskininlärning

Vår specialitet är att snabbt och säkert ta oss fram i outforskad teknisk terräng. Kunderna vänder sig till oss på grund av vår förmåga att konsekvent och effektivt skapa innovativa tekniklösningar oavsett bransch, tillämpning och teknikområde.

Kvalifikationer
Vi söker dig som studerar till civilingenjör inom datateknik, IT, inbyggda system, mekatronik, teknisk fysik eller liknande.

Relevanta förkunskaper inkluderar:
God programmeringskunskap inom C#, C/C++, Python, eller liknande.
Bekväm i Linux-miljö och med Git.
Kan arbeta med sensorer, mikrokontrollers (t.ex. Arduino), etc.
Intresse för fältexperiment.

Formalia
Omfattning: Fulltakt, 30 Hp
Antal personer: 1-2
Start: Januari 2023 eller enligt överenskommelse.
Arvode: Ja

Ansökningsprocess
Intresserad? Skicka in en ansökan redan idag. Intervjuer sker löpande. Du kan ansöka till oss antingen individuellt eller i par. Söker ni i par vill vi gärna ha endast en ansökan med all information. Ansökan sker genom att skicka CV, personligt brev och betyg till veronica.lilja@bitaddict.se

Kontaktpersoner
Veronica Lilja
Marknad- & rekryteringsansvarig
veronica.lilja@bitaddict.se
072 703 75 37

Headline: Master Thesis Project - Development of an Automated Test Framework for HiL Verification
Subject: Vehicle Engineering
Description:
CEVT is here to make urban mobility enjoyable, smart and sustainable. We fast-track innovation and transform ideas into pioneering technology solutions. Automotive is in our DNA and intelligent mobility is our core. We serve society with sustainable mobility solutions, both private and shared. As part of ZEEKR and the Geely family, one of the most innovative and fastest growing global mobility groups, our work comes to life in products and services from world-leading brands. CEVT was built by people from all over the world. We’re flexible, fast, and always in motion.

Master Thesis Project -  Development of an Automated Test Framework for HiL Verification

Subject: Design and implement a framework to automate test case definition, test runs and post processing

Background
Future mobility revolves around software and the mobility industry is undergoing a reformation towards continuous integration, continuous testing and continuous deployment. Increasing the efficiency, repeatability and accuracy in the verification and validation of software is highly valuable. CEVT utilizes HiL rigs (Hardware in the Loop) to test production software on a set of different ECUs (Electronic Control Unit) in a range of different scenarios.

Scope
Develop a process that integrates all parts of HiL test activities from scripting test cases, automation of test runs to result documentation and reporting as well as post processing/test judgement. Not everything is possible or feasible to automate and identifying this boundary should be part of the project. Utilize the existing framework for handling requirements, test methods and results as well as the HiL framework already available to build an efficient overall process. The processes in use are constantly evolving which needs to be appropriately addressed.

Recommendations on future process development to increase capabilities is expected. The main outcome is a combination of a set of scripts or similar that in turn produces test results and guidelines on how to work with these scripts or equivalent (how to write requirements and test cases, HiL model preparation, report database setup, etc).

Project steps
Design an overall V&V methodology for HiL.
Automate parts of test case scripting, utilize System Weaver input, integrate with IPG CarMaker.
Automate and optimize test runs.
Build a modular framework to identify common pass/fail criterias.
Script pass/fail modules that can be referenced in different test cases.
Design a suitable reporting methodology.

Prerequisites
Programming in Python (potentially other languages)

Meritorious
Vehicle models (mainly IPG CarMaker, secondary VI-CarRealtime, Adams Car, etc)
SW test experience
Rig testing
Design of Experiments
System Weaver


Number of students: 1 (possibility to be 2), please apply with CV and cover letter.
Starting date: January 2023. The duration of the thesis work is 20 weeks


For more information about the master thesis project please contact:
Supervisor: Albin Gröndahl, System Verification Lead, albin.grondahl1@cevt.se
HiL expert: Zoltan Raffai, HIL Engineer, zoltan.raffai1@cevt.se

Apply today. We will perform ongoing selection during the application period. We look forward to hearing from you!

Please note that due to GDPR regulations we can only accept applications sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.

Headline: 30 credits – Deep Neural Network for Lidar-Based Occlusion-Aware Detection and Motion Prediction
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
A thesis project at Scania is an excellent way of making contacts for your future working life. Many of our current employees started their careers with a thesis project. 

Background 
The concept of autonomous driving has rapidly transitioned from being a futuristic vision of robotics and artificial intelligence to being a present-day reality.  

To enable safe autonomous driving, in general, the task is divided into a chain of subtasks: perception, prediction, planning, and control. However, there is another approach to do it jointly, for example, exploring the perception and prediction jointly in one neural network for the Lidar or visual autonomous driving system. [1] is one of the examples and it claimed that such a joint task can avoid the propagation of error due to the chain. Here, we are interested in a Lidar-based joint network to do the detection and motion prediction together in a birds-eye view representation.

Besides the motion prediction of the previously seen objects, the occupancy state in the space (whether this position is occupied/free/unknown) is also essential for down streaming task planning and control. Using the information of perception range from the lidar – where is visible by the autonomous vehicle, where is not, the algorithm can learn to reason about future occupancy state [2]. It could reason about, for example, a newly appearing object in the largely possible area (e.g. incoming lanes), and consistently realize the partly/heavily occluded object which might show up from time to time.

Target 
The aim of this thesis is to develop efficient algorithms to do motion prediction from the lidar point cloud data. The proposed method should provide future occupancy reasoning to be occlusion-aware with some uncertainties if possible. It will use the open-source state-of-the-art methods and library as a foundation and modify based on it. Possible to compare among other methods.

 Assignment 
The assignment is divided into sub-tasks:  

Explore different models for lidar-based motion and occupancy flow prediction 
Develop new methods for efficiently predicting
Demonstrate the method’s performance with suitable metrics. 
Education 

Master (civilingenjör) in computer science, robotics, engineering physics, electrical engineering, or applied mathematics, preferably with a specialization in deep learning. Knowledge of programming and training deep neural networks is a plus. 

Number of students: 1-2 
Start date: January 2023   
Estimated time needed: 20 weeks 

Contact persons and supervisors 
Carol Yi Yang, Industrial PhD student in Perception, carol-yi.yang@scania.com 
Ajinkya Khoche, Industrial PhD student in Perception, ajinkya.khoche@scania.com

Magnus Granström, Manager, ATS Research, EARP, magnus.granstrom@scania.com  

Application 
Enclose your CV, cover letter and your transcript of records. 

References 
[1] Zhang, Yunpeng, et al. "BEVerse: Unified Perception and Prediction in Birds-Eye-View for Vision-Centric Autonomous Driving." arXiv preprint arXiv:2205.09743 (2022).
[2] Mahjourian, Reza, et al. "Occupancy flow fields for motion forecasting in autonomous driving." IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters 7.2 (2022): 5639-5646. arXiv:2203.03875

Headline: The Role of Hydro Power in the Future Power System
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
The Division of Electric Power and Energy Systems at KTH is offering two master thesis projects on hydro power modelling. The projects will be carried out in cooperation with the Swedish Energy Agency.

By 2045 Sweden should reach zero net emissions of greenhouse gases to the atmosphere. Political targets within energy, climate and environment will result in a large change of the energy system. One target is to have 100% renewable electricity generation by 2040. This transition is to take place at the same time as national and EU-wide environment goals are to be fulfilled. Hydro power has an important role in the Swedish power system, both as a resource for generation and for flexibility. The ability of hydro power for storage and balancing is expected to be particularly valuable in the transition of the power system, which will require an increased need for flexible resources. In this context, hydro power has a unique ability for storage and balancing large amounts of generation over virtually all-time horizons.

To fulfil the EU-wide goals for water environment, the Swedish government has decided on a national plan for revision of the hydro power plant licenses. The national plan is a strategy to balance environmental goals and energy goals. All hydro power plants which have licenses older than 40 years will be revised. In addition to this, the national plan should also promote the greatest possible regulatory capacity and accommodate the need for increased capacity in existing hydro power plants. The objective of these projects is to get an improved understanding of the role of hydro power in a future power system by studying the possibilities to increase the flexibility and capacity of hydro power systems and to investigate the impact of modern environment permits on these abilities.

For details of the two master thesis projects, please see the attached project description. Applicants for these projects should have knowledge of hydro power planning corresponding to the courses EG2200/EG2205 Power Generation Operation and Planning. Alternatively, the student can have very good knowledge in optimisation theory (at least 15 ECTS with top grades). Experience of working with programming and open source software is a merit. The projects will include collection of data, which might only be available in Swedish. Good skills in written communication in both English and Swedish is therefore valuable.
