Headline: Master thesis: Machine Learning
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
THE THESIS AREA

At Voi, you will not just be working with the latest technology, you will shape the product we put out on the streets. Rider safety is at the core of our business. There are many challenges when it comes to mitigating unsafe riding such as tandem riding, riding under the influence, pavement riding, etc. Our Machine Learning team is continuously developing features and methods for rider safety, based on sensor data, end-of-ride data, and auxiliary external data. Further, there is a need to test and quantify the performance for these models under different environmental conditions and geographic locations.

As thesis student in our team, you'll be tasked to:

-Design controlled experiments to evaluate the performance of existing machine learning models for different environmental conditions.
-Propose, design and implement ideas on how to improve machine learning models given the results of your experiments and the problems at hand.
-Connecting the learnings of your experiments to business outcome
-Machine learning methods that you are likely to be working with are computer vision, time series classification and anomaly detection.

DURATION

-The work to start in January 2023 and finish in June 2023 but is to be further negotiated with the students.
-30 ECTS (academic credits) if in agreement with your Thesis Advisor in University
-This thesis is to be conducted by 2 Students working in pairs.
-We expect you to be able to be present at our office in central Stockholm at least one day per week.

WHY VOI?

Writing your Master Thesis with Voi is more than just a project; Our People Promise includes growing as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:

-Gain insights in Europes #1 micromobility company and one of the fastest growing scaleups
-Have a direct impact on our continued success and the development of the micromobility industry
-Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
-Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution

Headline: Master thesis project on regeneration of zeolite catalysts used for production of chemicals from bio-based resources
Subject: Chemical Science and Engineering
Description:
Subject: Experimental investigation of coke characteristics and deposition from the catalytic cracking of pyrolysis oil and some model compounds on HZSM-5 catalysts

The transition to a sustainable society necessitates the production of chemicals from renewable bio-based resources. A very common process used is the catalytic cracking which aims at producing simpler molecules from long bio-based chains deriving from thermal degradation of biomass.  However, such process is hammered by reversible catalyst deactivation due to coke(carbon) deposition and imposes the need for catalyst regeneration. Catalyst regeneration, which is carried out by oxidation of deposited coke, ensures recovery of catalytic activity, and minimizes the need for catalyst replacement and process shutdown. Understanding the nature of the coke and its oxidation kinetics is thus critical to optimize and properly design the process. The kinetics depend on several parameters, such as amount and type of of coke, coke morphology and chemical nature, placement of the coke on the catalysts, shape selectivity, acidity, of the catalysts, as well as the operating conditions.
Temperature programmed oxidation (TPO) is one of the commonly used techniques for coke characterization, gaining insights into the amount, nature, or location of coke. Coupled with a mass spectrometer (MS), it allows the discrimination of the carbon species in the coke quantitatively. The coke composition and localization and chemical nature are also evaluated via extraction followed by GC-MS analysis.
This master thesis work focuses on the experimental investigation of coke characteristics and deposition on the catalytic surfaces and pores. The coke deposition from several compounds, at various temperatures, and on different catalysts, porosity and crystal sizes will be evaluated, aiming at a more comprehensive understanding of the catalyst deactivation by coking. This thesis will give insights on an industrial problem, a close examination on the scientific approaches to solve this problem, and a progressive knowledge in operating corresponding lab equipment and in proper lab conduct.
The project includes planning and execution of TPO analysis of the spent catalysts as well as chemical extraction and analysis of coke components. The results will generate a scientific publication.
The work will be carried out at KTH.

Period: 6 months, starting January 2023 (30 credits)

Work Description
The core work of the project is experimental, with the following preliminary steps:
1. Literature survey on catalytic deactivation of HZSM-5 by coke deposition
2. Planning and execution of lab scale experiments
3. Results analysis and evaluation of coke characteristics
4. Reporting

Requirements
- Chemical Engineering background or equivalent
- Excellent analytical skills
- Great teamwork skills as well as a strong drive and the ability to work independently
- Good command of English language, both written and verbal

Contacts
Elise Farah        Efthymios Kantarelis
Email: efarah@kth.se    Email:ekan@kth.se

Headline: Framdriftsmodellering av ubåt med CFD
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
För att utveckla metoder för detektering, spårning och kvalificering av fartyg och undervattensfarkoster bedriver FOI idag forskning med beräkningsbaserad strömningsmekanik, CFD. De metoder och modeller som används för hydrodynamiska simuleringar utvecklas ständigt för att öka tillförlitligheten i resultaten. En stor utmaning är att modellera den turbulenta vak som bildas bakom en ubåt som ger upphov till en signatur. Signaturen kan upptäckas och röja ubåtens färdväg och position, vilket kan användas vid ubåtsjakt. Det är därför viktigt att ha god förståelse och tillförlitlig simuleringsmetodik för och kunna prediktera vakens karakteristik. Ubåts- och propellergeometri samt driftläge påverkar denna karakteristik, vilket gör den komplicerad och kostsam att prediktera.

Dina uppgifter:

Din uppgift är att med CFD utvärdera metoder för att simulera flödesfältet i en propellervak, med syftet att ta fram en metodik som kan prediktera vakegenskaper som turbulenskaraktäristik. Studien består av två delar och vi söker därför två personer som kan arbeta parallellt med varsin del. En del består av att utvärdera lägre ordningens framdriftsmodeller, vilka ersätter propellern med källtermer och finns i varierande komplexitet. Den andra delen består av att studera en propellervaks turbulenta egenskaper med en roterande propellergeometri.

Din profil:

Vi söker dig som studerar till civilingenjör med inriktning mot strömningsmekanik eller liknande och som vill genomföra ett utmanande examensarbete. Examensarbetet är forskningsnära och ställer höga krav på din drivkraft och initiativförmåga.

Vad erbjuder vi dig?
När du gör ditt exjobb hos oss ger vi dig en god inblick i vår verksamhet, där du får arbeta i en kreativ miljö. Arbetet på FOI bedrivs i form av projekt av varierad storlek och karaktär. Att arbeta på FOI innebär ett omväxlande arbete med stor grad av frihet och krav på egna initiativ och hög kompetens. På FOI kommer du att göra ditt exjobb i en forskningsnära miljö, full av engagerade experter och handledare som stöttar dig på bästa sätt.

Arbetet kommer att ske vid enheten Undervattensteknik Kista som tillhör avdelning Försvarsteknik.
Läs gärna mer om vad vi gör: https://www.foi.se/om-foi/organisation/forsvarsteknik.html

Har vi fångat ditt intresse?
Vi vill att du ansöker om examensarbetet med ett komplett CV inklusive senaste betygsutdraget samt ett personligt brev.
Du är välkommen med frågor till Alfred Sederlin som nås på telefon +46723946048.
Löpande urval kommer att ske under ansökningstiden. Examensarbetet beräknas starta våren 2023.

Då arbetet sker på en säkerhetsklassad anläggning krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före examensarbetet enligt 19 § i säkerhetsskyddslagen.

Headline: Dolt samband under vattenytan
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
Dolt och effektivt samband under vattenytan är ännu svårare än ovan vattenytan. FOI bedriver därför forskning och utveckling av operativt användbara system för akustisk undervattenskommunikation. Syftet är att förbättra och nyutveckla metoder som ger effektiva lösningar för marina kommunikationslänkar och kommunikationsnätverk. Dessa metoder ska bl.a. kunna användas för kommunikation inom ett utlagt sensornätverk där det samtidigt ställs höga krav på låg energiförbrukning.

Dina uppgifter:
Utrustning för undervattenskommunikation är av praktiska skäl ofta drivna av batteri. Därför finns ett behov av att hushålla med energiförbrukningen för att öka driftstiden. En teknisk lösning är att ha ett passivt detektionssystem som lyssnar efter en väckarklocka, en pilotsignal som indikerar ett inkommande meddelande. När en pilotsignal detekteras, väcker detektionssystemet upp ett signalbehandlingssystem som avkodar meddelandet och skickar det vidare till mottagaren.
Syfte med examensarbetet är att ta fram ett koncept för hur en batteridriven nod för undervattens-kommunikation kan utformas för att uppnå och förbättra användbar driftstid.

Målet är att realisera en demonstrator som påvisar att konceptet fungerar och levererar den önskade funktionen. I examensarbetet används demonstratorn för att undersöka olika typer av pilotsignaler och uppskatta möjliga driftstider.
Examensarbetet kännetecknas av en bredd som spänner över såväl praktiska som teoretiska moment. Arbetsuppgifter återfinns inom flera olika tekniska discipliner som elektronik, signalbehandling, program- och maskinvara, men tyngdpunkten kan diskuteras efter önskemål.

Din profil
Du uppskattar kombinationen av praktiskt arbete, signalbehandling och programmering och bör kunna driva arbetet självständigt med stöd från handledaren. Du har en grundläggande förståelse för problemlösning och att omsätta en idé till ett färdigt system.

Vi erbjuder:
När du gör ditt exjobb hos oss ger vi dig en god inblick i vår verksamhet, där du får arbeta i en kreativ miljö. Arbetet på FOI bedrivs i form av projekt av varierad storlek och karaktär. Att arbeta på FOI innebär ett omväxlande arbete med stor grad av frihet och krav på egna initiativ och hög kompetens. På FOI kommer du att arbeta i en forskningsnära miljö och ingå i en expertgrupp med kompetenta handledare som stöttar dig på bästa sätt.

Arbetet kommer att ske vid enheten Undervattenssensorer Kista som tillhör avdelning Försvarsteknik.
Läs gärna mer om vad vi gör: https://www.foi.se/om-foi/organisation/forsvarsteknik.html

Har vi fångat ditt intresse?
Vi vill att du ansöker om examensarbetet med ett komplett CV inklusive senaste betygsutdraget samt ett personligt brev.
Du är välkommen med frågor till Staffan Lindgren eller Per Morén som nås på telefon 08 555 030 00
Löpande urval kommer att ske under ansökningstiden. Examensarbetet beräknas starta våren 2023.

Då arbetet sker på en säkerhetsklassad anläggning krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras före examensarbetet enligt 19 § i säkerhetsskyddslagen.

Headline: M.Sc. Thesis work Topic recommendations using Machine Learning
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Recommendations of topic- and keyword merging

The Gavagai Explorer is a tool made to facilitate the analysis of large amounts of textual data for corporations with a need of processing large amounts of text. During the analysis, the customer can be recommended to group keywords together to have a similar topic, and topics can also be merged under one. The goal of this thesis is to investigate how we can better recommend these actions to the user of our tool to improve our customers' experiences using our product.

Research questions:

- How can we best build a dynamic model that accurately recommends words to go under the correct topics based on user history?
- How can we best recommend to merge different topics with each other?
- How can we take domain-specific factors into account into the recommendations?

The ultimate goal is to build machine learning models that help us improve the user experience for our customers using our products. If you have insights or suggestions yourself on how to leverage different recommender models, we are more than happy to discuss these and formulate your research questions into a reasonable scope. We encourage all suggestions.

Who you are:

You can be one or two people. You need to have:


- Enrolled at a master’s program at a Swedish university in computer sci-
ence, applied mathematics, data science or similar.
- Eager, curious and happy about learning new things!
- Experience in Python.
- Machine Learning Experience (preferably coursework, but demonstrated internships and/or kaggle experience does count too).
- Some related work to Natural Language Processing (coursework or out-
side).


It is even better (but far from a must) if you have:
- Experience with training embedding-based models with different loss functions.
- A github repository with interesting projects you have worked on.

We do not expect you to know anything about the subject of neural subgraph matching on beforehand - just learn from and with us and enjoy the amazing learning curve!

Who we are:

Gavagai is a leading NLP start-up company in Sweden, born out of RISE. We
provide text analytics services and help companies derive insights
from their textual data. You would be under supervision of a Filip Cornell@Gavagai/KTH (PhD student) and Fredrik Olsson@Gavagai and help us generate results that would be a stepping stone towards the next state-of-the-art recommenders. We will also be able to guide and teach you how to make your work functioning in an industry setting - a skill highly sought after in the
industry. We are also always looking for potential candidates to join our data
science or development teams to improve our text analytics tools.

Contact

Send your application to filip.cornell@gavagai.io. Cover letter is optional; if you do not attach one, a brief explanation as to why we should choose you is okay as well. For any questions, contact me at filip.cornell@gavagai.io and I would be very
happy to answer any of your questions. I am looking forward to your applications
and hope we could generate amazing results together (and if not, we’ll learn a
lot)!

Headline: ESG-verktyg för att katalysera en global omställning till hållbarhet - Marknadsanalys och affärsutveckling
Organization: KTH, ABE, SEED, Energy, Resources, and Infrastructure
Subject: Industrial Management
Description:
Syfte
Att kartlägga hållbarhetsverktyg som GRESB, LEED, GreenAssetWallet, Green Position, identifiera styrkor, svagheter och konceptutveckla en lösning som kan bidra till en snabbare omställning för hållbarhet.

Bakgrund
Äntligen har investmentbolag insett att hållbarhet och lönsamhet går hand i hand, vilket har lett början av en total omställning i hur hållbarhet, energieffektivitet, och låga klimatutsläpp i allt mindre utsträckning drivs av ideella organisationer, till förmån för investeringsbolag och pensionsbolag som äger majoriteten av den byggda miljön. Som ett led i detta arbete har ett antal verktyg utvecklats av branschen för att underlätta omställningen. Men dessa verktyg lider av att det inte finns standardiserade sätt att mäta och följa upp indikatorer för fastighetsägare, föränderliga ramverk för investerare, svårigheter i att verifiera uppnådda mål och prestanda.

Delmål 1:
En kartläggning av ESG-verktyg i form av litteraturstudie, analys av verktygen, intervjuer med fastighetsbolag, investerare och utvecklare av verktyg. Identifiera aktörernas ”jobs, pains, och gains”.

Delmål 2:
En jämförande analys av befintliga verktygs för- och nackdelar.

Delmål 3:
Föreslå ett koncept som på ett mer effektivt sätt kan ta bort ”pains” och skapa ”gains”. Gör en kvalitativ bedömning om den snabbare kan bidra till att driva igenom hållbarhetsomställningen.

Resultatet presenteras till USGBC:s Vice President of Research, Chris Pyke.

Handledare
Hossein Shahrokni, SEED
hosseins@kth.se

Headline: Master thesis - Reinforcement learning policies for energy-aware mobile networks
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering

Headline: Master thesis project: Explainable Reinforcement Learning for Remote Electrical Tilt
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Position Summary
Reinforcement learning (RL) is a machine learning method that is widely applied in the telecom domain. Remote electrical tilt (RET) is an example of a problem where RL can be used, in which the configuration of multiple antennas is controlled in order to optimize a set of KPIs. Despite deep Q networks having already been successfully employed for this problem, due to the black-box nature of the model, it is not possible to obtain explanations from each decision taken. In addition to this, the absence of model transparency can then lead to a lack of trust in the RL outputs by the final users.
Explainable RL (XRL) is a set of methods that aim to provide explanations so that human users have a better understanding of the RL agent’s behavior. The explanations can be produced in various forms such as feature importance, graphical causal, model simplification, and text-based explanation. Given that the RET use case is a multi-agent problem and each RL agent can influence the others' performance, the focus will be on researching XRL methods for multi-agent RL (MARL).  The experiments will be conducted on our telecom RET use case.
The first research area that we propose to explore is to summarize the policies of the RL agents while taking into account the collaboration and/or conflicts happening among the agents. The result should be a summary of the policies which is interpretable for human users (e.g., text-based).
Another research area is to explain the MARL model by considering the contribution of each agent in achieving a common/collaborative goal. In this work, the goal is to identify the agents with a significant contribution and to detect potential conflicts. Optionally, there are also possibilities to extend the existing work, for example by reconfiguring the trained RL model based on the explanations, incorporating the explanations to improve the RL model, or detecting and mitigating bias of the RL model.

This thesis is suitable for 2 students. The thesis would involve the following steps (can be adjusted to the research interest of the candidates):
• Study MARL methods especially suitable for the RET use case.
• Study XRL methods with a focus on analyzing the RL policy of individual or collective agents.
• Implement and evaluate XRL methods for the RET problem.
• Optionally, implement and evaluate the solution on a different telecom problem employing RL.

Qualifications:
We are looking for 2 open-minded students who seek a challenging research project with the freedom to propose and develop their own ideas. To be successful in this thesis work, we are looking for the candidates with the following qualifications:
• Doing MSc studies in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a similar area.
• Excellent programming skills in Python.
• Good knowledge of concepts in machine learning and particularly in reinforcement learning.
• Experience with reinforcement learning and deep learning frameworks such as Ray RLlib, PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras.
• Team working.
• Have writing skills and be fluent in English.

References
[1] Boggess, K.; Kraus, S.; Feng, L. “Toward Policy Explanations for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning”. 2022. Proceedings of the Thirty-First International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence (IJCAI)
[2] Bouton, M.; Farooq, H.; Forgeat, J.; Bothe, S.; Shirazipour, M.; Karlsson, P. ”Coordinated Reinforcement Learning for Optimizing Mobile Networks”. Arxiv.CoRR 2021, abs/2109.15175.
[3] Heuillet, A.; Couthouis, F.;and Díaz-Rodríguez, N. 2022. “Collective eXplainable AI: Explaining Cooperative Strategies and Agent Contribution in Multiagent Reinforcement Learning With Shapley Values”. Comp. Intell. Mag. 17, 1 (Feb. 2022), 59–71.

Headline: Master thesis project: Assessment of Heuristic Explainable AI Methods
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Position Summary
Explainable AI is about providing reasons behind decisions made by AI systems. Machine learning (ML) models are often too complex to understand why a trained model makes certain predictions. In recent years many different techniques for explaining ML model input/output behavior have been proposed. Counterfactual explanations are of particular interest in that they aim to answer the question “why not another decision?” and indicate how a desirable output may be obtained by changing the input. Counterfactual explanations are often heuristic, obtained by sampling and approximating a model’s behavior. Their goodness is measured against various properties of “correctness”, but different explanations for the same input/output often diverge and are hard to be seen as trustworthy [1]. Yet provably correct, formal explanations of ML models are also possible [2]: this may be achieved by encoding a trained model into constraint programming (as a set of linear arithmetic inequalities and satisfiability constraints) where the model’s exact behavior can be determined. Such formal explanations can be used to improve the model itself as well as to evaluate the correctness of the heuristic explanations. However, extracting formal explanations from encoded ML models is feasible only for some classes of models (such as feed forward neural networks, boosted trees) and is typically computationally challenging. Heuristic counterfactual explanations are thus still crucial for explaining ML models, but we need to know which ones and when to apply.
This project will study techniques for assessing correctness and evaluating goodness of ML model input/output behavior explanations. We will aim to find and characterize settings where heuristic counterfactual explanations are trustworthy for the task at hand, and where formal provably correct explanations are more useful. We will use and aim to extend off-the-shelf tools for explaining ML models via both heuristic and formal explanations.

This thesis is suitable for 2 students. The thesis would involve the following tasks:
• Conduct literature review, identify different techniques for encoding and analyzing ML models as well as useful methods to assess heuristic explanations
• Generate trustable explanations
o Use (and potentially extend) off-the-shelf tools to train and explain ML models
o Use and extend off-the-shelf tools for encoding ML models into constraint programming (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Constraint_programming), such as satisfiability (SAT/SMT) and/or mixed-integer linear programming (MILP)
o Use (and potentially extend) off-the-shelf tools to extract provably correct formal input/output explanations
o Identify properties of the ML model
• Evaluate heuristic ML model explanations using the identified formal properties
• Assess the feasibility of both heuristic and formal explanations in different settings
• Implement a proof-of-concept tool for generating and assessing ML model explanations
• Optionally, implement and test the solution on a telecom use-case

Qualifications
We are looking for 1-2 open-minded students who seek a challenging research project with the freedom to propose and develop their own ideas. To be successful in this thesis work, we are looking for the candidates with the following qualifications:
• Doing MSc studies in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a similar area.
• Good knowledge of AI concepts, such as building and optimizing neural networks (using e.g., XGBoost)
• Some knowledge of constraint programming and understanding of SAT/SMT or MILP would be desirable
• Some knowledge of XAI methods would be desirable (collection libraries e.g. https://github.com/alexeyignatiev/xreason, https://github.com/alexeyignatiev/xdual, https://github.com/NeuralNetworkVerification/Marabou )
• Good programming skills in Python
• Good writing skills and fluency in English

Headline: Examensarbete 30 HP: Industri 4.0
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Bakgrund
Scanias transmissionsmontering i Södertälje står inför flera utmanande förändringar kopplade mot framtidens drivlina och kunder. Transmissionsmonteringen producerar idag växellådor och axlar till Scanias chassimonteringarna i Zwolle, Angers och Södertälje samt växellådor till MANs chassimonteringar i Europa. Scania ställs inför höga krav och förväntningar vad gäller kvalitet på den produkt som levereras men också på att minimera kvalitetsförluster. Scania ser en stor potential i att både kunna öka kvaliteten och samtidigt minska de kvalitetsrelaterade förlusterna. Vi söker er som studerar till civilingenjörer inom maskinteknik eller med inriktning mot produktion. Headline: Master thesis project: Safe Reinforcement Learning for Real Robots
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
In an automated warehouse where autonomous robots collaborate with humans, a proper safety analysis is needed to avoid hazardous situations without compromising the productivity. For that we have implemented a risk mitigation method that runs to determine the optimal movements for the robot to maximize the safety metrics. This solution is based on reinforcement learning (RL) that is trained on a simulated environment, which allows robots and humans experiment unsafe situations. However, as the simulation has differences compared to the real environment, the trained model would not behave as expected if deployed on the real robot and can lead to unexpected consequences. Therefore, it is primordial for the model to get experiences from the real world to fulfil the simulation to reality gap.
Safe RL is an approach to enable the exploration of real environment by the robot without entering in hazardous situations. This is done by considering safety metrics, defining safe regions of the exploration space, or using some strategy that ensures the RL policy to satisfy safety constraints. In addition, before exploring the real world, it is still possible to pre-train the model in the simulated environment. For that, we started to investigate the enhancement of RL-based risk mitigation through safe RL shielding.
The main target of this project is to continue the studies of safe RL for risk mitigation in collaborative robots. It will be focused on deploying the developed solution on the real robot and perform training on real scenario. The context can be further generalized to other domains such as telecom, where exists agents that have limited access to the real world during the training step.

This thesis is suitable for 1 student. The thesis would involve the following steps (can be adjusted to research interest of the candidate(s)):
• Study safe RL solution for agents that interact with humans.
• Implement or adapting the safe RL solution.
• Test the solution on the real robot and perform training on real environment.
• Optionally, test the solution on the telecom problem.

Qualifications
We are looking for 1 open-minded student who seek a challenging research work with the freedom to propose and develop your own ideas. To be successful in this thesis work the candidate(s) would need the following:
• MSc studies in Robotics, Control, Machine Learning Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or similar area.
• Excellent programming skills in C/C++ and Python.
• Good knowledge of concepts in machine learning (e.g. deep learning, RL) and robotics (e.g. ROS, V-REP, Gazebo).
• Experiences with machine learning libraries, such as Tensor flow, Keras, PyTorch, Sci-kit learn.
• Knowledge in communication protocols and technologies (edge/cloud, D2D) is a bonus.
• Knowledge in safety analysis techniques is a bonus.
• Team working.
• Have writing skills and be fluent in English.

Headline: Thesis Work - How can perceived vertical choppiness in driver seat be improved for an electric car?
Subject: Vehicle Engineering
Description:
Thesis Worker at Volvo Cars

Welcome to explore the world of Volvo Cars by writing your thesis with us! As a thesis worker in our organization you are supported by a supervisor who follows you during your project. All thesis projects are arranged in business-critical areas and therefore you will be able to contribute to our company purpose – providing freedom to move in a safe, sustainable and personal way – from day one!

Background

Choppiness is road induced, (continuous), irregular pitch and bounce motions of the vehicle above the primary ride frequency. High levels of choppiness distort the voice of driver/passenger when speaking or singing in the car, also it makes car feel cheaper and less refined.

Increased level of vertical vibrations in 3-8 Hz region leads to more pronounced choppiness, perceived by driver and front passenger. When replacing a combustion engine (ICE) with an electric motor, choppiness increase. The ICE on its engine mounts works as a heavy mass damper which heavily reduces vibration input to seats in the frequency range of 3-8 Hz. Electric powertrains have lower mass and by that less potential to reduce choppiness.

Scope
We want to reduce choppiness for an electric vehicle and pinpoint actions that effect choppiness.

•    Build new simplified system model or refine existing MATLAB model.
•    Demonstrate how driver vertical bounce frequency on seat influence perceived choppiness.
•    Study how driver bounce frequency on seat interact with i.e., primary ride frequency, powertrain and wheel hop. Answer how vibrations 8 to 20 Hz are affected.
•    Recommend actions to reduce choppiness.
•    Document work in a report.
•    Present report, based on model result and findings. Give recommendations to further work.
•    Optional: Demonstrate riding experience with help of simulator. Depends on findings and availability of simulator.

Your contribution is our future
Required: Good knowledge in rigid body dynamics. Self-sufficient, curious and eager to learn. Knowledge in MATLAB programming.

Preferable: Driving license. Interest in vehicle dynamics.

Duration
•    The job will start January 2023 and continue 20 weeks. 2 students preferred. This diploma work gives 30 points/student.

Be part of the change – apply today!
Please note that due to GDPR, applications via email will not be accepted.

Last application date        2022-11-30

For questions about the thesis work, please contact Bo Krüger at bo.kruger@volvocars.com (+46-72 977 50 67) or Erik Wendeberg at erik.wendeberg@volvocars.com (+46-73 786 05 96).

We are Volvo Cars
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future. Since 1927, we've been known for our commitment to safety and for creating innovative cars that make life less complicated. In 2010, we decided to radically redefine our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technology, as well as steady growth and record sales - and we're only getting started. By 2025, we aim to have yearly sales of 1.2 million cars, 50% of which will be electric vehicles and sold directly to customers through digital channels. We also intend to strengthen our position as a modern, progressive employer committed to diversity and gender and racial equality. We believe in the power of people. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars' transformation.

Headline: Fasseparation av vätskeprov i olika fraktioner- Examensarbete, Ringhals
Subject: Chemical Science and Engineering
Description:
Om tjänsten
Power Climate Smarter living – det är vårt syfte. Vi är på jakt efter talangfulla studenter som vill hjälpa oss på vår resa mot ett fossilfritt liv. Genom att skriva ett examensarbete på Vattenfall får du en unik möjlighet att bidra till vårt syfte. Det enda vi begär av dig är att du frigör dina superkrafter och delar din energi med oss.

Om examensarbetet
Kemienheten har som huvuduppgift att övervaka och optimera kemiprocessen i kärnkraftverkens system. Detta görs genom analys, utvärdering och trenduppföljning av kemin i processvatten och luft från primär- och sekundärsystemen.

Ämnesområde/Uppdrag
Korrosionsprodukter analyseras regelbundet i olika systemvatten på Ringhals för att övervaka att ingen accelererad korrosion pågår på insidan av systemen. Korrosionsprodukterna koncentreras upp på filter avsedda för partikulära och jonogena föroreningar. Dessa filter löses sedan upp på kemilaboratoriet och analyseras med ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Processen för uppslutning av prover tar relativt lång tid och Ringhals kemiavdelning tittar på möjligheterna att effektivisera provtagning och analysförfarandet.

Mål/Syfte
Syftet med arbetet är att undersöka möjligheten att fasseparera vätskeprov från reaktorvattnet i olika fraktioner med tonvikt på jonogena och partikulära korrosionsprodukter med hjälp av en statisk magnet samt ”chelat”-massa.

Målet är att redovisa vilka möjligheter som finns med ovanstående teknik att separera, koncentrera upp samt analysera partikulära och jonogena metallföroreningar i systemvatten.

Detta uppdrag är för 1 student


Din bakgrund
Vi letar efter student/studenter som vill arbeta mot ett fossilfritt liv inom en generation och som snart tar examen från dina akademiska studier. Du är även någon som identifierar dig med våra principer: Aktiv, Öppen, Positiv och Säkerhet

• Utbildning – Kandidatexamen med inriktning mot kemi

• Omfattning - 15 hp

• Svenska: Mycket goda kunskaper i tal och skrift

• Engelska: Goda kunskaper i tal och skrift


Mer information
• Uppdraget startar: under våren 2023 eller vid överenskommelse

• Placeringsort: Ringhals AB

• Ansökan – en kombinerad fil med ditt CV och personliga brev, samt en kopia av dina betyg.

• Sista ansökningsdag är 2022-11-30

• Kontaktperson och handledare på Vattenfall:

för- och efternamn: Jimmy Hägg

e-mail: jimmy.hagg@vattenfall.com, telefon: 072-5603386

Mångfald och inkludering – i allt vi gör
Vi är övertygade om att heterogena team kan överträffa homogena team. Men vi kan bara frigöra och använda kraften av mångfald när alla känner sig inkluderade. Läs mer om vårt viktiga arbete med mångfald och inkludering https://careers.vattenfall.com/se/jobba-med-oss/mangfald-inkludering/


Om oss
Vi på vattenfall har bestämt oss för att göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt inom en generation. För att lyckas måste vi, som ett av Europas största energibolag, först bli helt fossilfria själva. Men det räcker inte. För att bidra till ett fossilfritt samhälle måste vi göra mer än att enbart fokusera på hållbar energiproduktion.

För vi är övertygade om att om vi ska göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt inom en generation måste vi nämligen se på utmaningen ur ett bredare perspektiv än att enbart producera energi på ett hållbart sätt.

Följ med oss på vägen mot ett fossilfritt liv.

Vill du veta mer om oss? Besök www.vattenfall.se

Eftersom Vattenfall är en del av den svenska kritiska infrastrukturen är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Det innebär, om denna position är säkerhetsklassad, att slutkandidaterna kan vara föremål för en särskild säkerhetsprövning som är i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.

Headline: From Onshore to Floating: The Paradigm Shift for Substations Technology within Wind Power Applications, Thesis
Subject: Energy and Sustainable Development
Description:
About the job

Power Climate Smarter living - that’s our purpose. We are looking for the brightest students to make this happen. Together you will contribute to a fossil free future. You will have a unique position to contribute to our purpose. All we ask from you is to use your Superpowers and share your energy to help us achieve our goal.

About the thesis

The master thesis will be carried out with Vattenfall R&D Offshore Wind Power Technology Team (OPT) in cooperation with Vattenfall BA Wind.

-Description of the topic / mission:

Deployment of wind power, both onshore and offshore, is globally speeding up. The 2050 offshore wind installed capacity is estimated to reach approx. 1748 GW out of which 15% is expected to be floating. Serving as vital links between wind turbines and the electrical grid, offshore substations need to keep pace with this development. The proposed thesis is to shed more light on the existing/traditional and innovative substation technologies within the context of wind power from electrical equipment point of view. The project mission is to build the knowledge basin on the onshore & offshore substation solutions that are applied now or are possible/probable to be applied in future (are under development) in a systematic manner (e.g. in a form of a catalogue). With respect to that, the planned study activities are to predominantly focus on the challenges and specifications relating to the electrical equipment that accompanies the shifts in the substation technology paradigms, namely:

(i) onshore-to-offshore (bottom-fixed) and

(ii) offshore (bottom-fixed)-to-floating.

Brief background info:

As for the utility-scale onshore and offshore wind farms, substations represent the critical components that receive the power produced by wind turbine generators that is then to be further transmitted. Moreover, within the framework of the ongoing energy transition, there is a worldwide growing interest in driving the wind power technology forward in a direction of offshore (and possibly, floating) applications. And indeed, the commercial-scale floating projects intended for deeper waters will require offshore substations. Such advances then inherently impose new requirements and challenges on, among others, electrical equipment within substations that steps up the voltage for sending the power onshore via seabed-buried power cables. As a pre-requisite for the corresponding technological progress to occur, these challenges are first be addressed in a structured manner.

Therefrom originates a need to better understand/collect the information on: electrical equipment set-ups for different existing practical substation solutions, their technological prospects and business potential from industrial practice point-of-view. The idea of the proposed master thesis project is therefore to make the first steps towards a comprehensive understanding of these issues.



Thesis goal / purpose

-The primary goal of the thesis is to identify & investigate the requirements imposed on the electrical equipment within offshore substations while accounting for:

(i) the technology applied (bottom-fixed or floating, HVAC or HVDC),

(ii) the available data (actual or from standards) and

(iii) the specifications of the equipment employed in the commercial Offshore Wind Farms (OWFs) operated by Vattenfall in comparison to the challenges faced by their onshore “twins”.

A more clear picture on these aspects could reinforce a proposal of more preferrable set-ups (technology/electrical components) given the specific set of parameters (conditions, expected installed capacity) in future OWFs and also assist in recommending a general technological “way forward”.

This assignment is for 1 student

Read more about the thesis on our website:  https://careers.vattenfall.com/global/en/job/REF627T/From-Onshore-to-Floating-The-Paradigm-Shift-for-Substations-Technology-within-Wind-Power-Applications-Thesis

Headline: Partial Discharge monitoring on cables: Physical Testing of Detection methods, Master Thesis
Subject: Energy and Sustainable Development
Description:
Power Climate Smarter living – that's our purpose. We are looking for talented students who want to help us on our journey towards a fossil-free life. By writing a degree project at Vattenfall, you get a unique opportunity to contribute to our purpose. The only thing we ask of you is that you release your superpowers and share your energy with us.


About the project
Vattenfall R&D is responsible for conducting business driven technical development that creates value for the company and helps us realize our strategy. We develop cost-effective, safe & sustainable solutions to improve the infrastructure of Vattenfall assets including Hydro, Wind, Nuclear, SKB, Heat and Distribution.

Partial discharge (PD) is one of the main issues when it comes to maintenance of cables in wind farms. For this reason, gaining understanding on the phenomenon and its detection is of high relevance.

The thesis consists of conducting literature review of existing PD detection and monitoring techniques as well as testing PD detection equipment at the High Voltage laboratory at KTH. The aims are to understand the behavior of the equipment under different PD sources, to learn how to interpret the collected data and to compare different techniques in terms of performance with more conventional detection systems. The physical testing should be implemented in relation to the conducted literature review on existing PD detection methods and a summary of the available sensors in the market.

Based on the results of the analysis, we will be able to design the most appropriate PD monitoring option that would allow us to plan pro-active maintenance needed in each of our locations. In this way, we enable continued safe and stable electricity production in the wind farms in question.

Objective/Purpose: The ultimate goal is to gain full understanding of the potential of different PD monitoring sensors when it comes to PD.

This assignment is for 1 student


Profile
We are looking for students who want to work towards a fossil-free life within a generation and who will soon graduate from your academic studies. You are also someone who identifies with our principles: Active, Open, Positive and Safety

• Since the project is carried out in collaboration with KTH, only KTH students can apply to this Thesis
• Education – Any of the following master programs or similar: MSc Electric Power Engineering or MSc Energy Physics.

• Language requirements - English

We are convinced that heterogeneous teams can outperform homogeneous teams. But we can only unleash and use the power of diversity when everyone feels included. Learn more about our important diversity and inclusion work https://careers.vattenfall.com/se/jobba-med-oss/mangfald-inkludering/

Headline: Adaptive Sampling for Counterfactual Explanations
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Although the accuracy of predictions and decisions from AI/ML systems have vastly improved with their increasing sophistication and complexity, nowadays even domain experts are challenged in comprehending and retracing how a model reached a result.
This poses a concern for (semi-)autonomous decisions that affect an individual (e.g., legally, financially, or medically). The right to explanation [1] stipulates that an individual can ask for a humanly interpretable justification in high-stakes decisions, such as a (denied) loan-application. In the rapidly developing fields of interpretable machine learning (IML) and explainable AI (XAI) [2], a counterfactual explanation of a decision describes the smallest change that should be made to the input features to change the output of the model [3]. For example, a counterfactual explanation for
a rejected loan applicant might be: “The application would have been approved had the person had less credit cards and not defaulted on a loan three years ago.”
The popular Wachter et al.’s algorithm [4] for producing counterfactual explanations optimizes an objective function that balances the distance between x and x’ with how much the model’s output changes. To avoid local minima in the optimization problem either grid-search (in the feature space) or random sampling is used to reinitialize a local hill-climbing procedure (e.g., ADAM, L-BFGS).
In this project, we aim to explore adaptive sampling techniques for reinitializing the optimization procedure [5]. That is, a new candidate for x’ is no longer sampled uniformly, but rather in proportion to how promising it appears for producing a better counterfactual explanation. A similar approach has recently been explored in [6] by researcher at J.P. Morgan AI Research.
Candidates need to be highly motivated and capable of independent work and study. Programming experience in Python and knowledge of standard ML terminology, concepts and algorithms is a must. Previous exposure to (Bayesian) optimization is valuable. If the project is successful, then submission for presentation at an international conference (e.g., NeurIPS or ICML) is encouraged.

Organizers: Prof. Cristian Rojas (crro@kth.se), Dr. Robert Mattila (robert.mattila@seb.se)
References:
[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Right_to_explanation
[2] https://christophm.github.io/interpretable-ml-book/
[3] Verma et al. “Counterfactual Explanations for Machine Learning: A Review” (2020)
[4] Wachter et al. "Counterfactual Explanations without Opening the Black Box: Automated Decisions
and the GDPR" (2017)
[5] Garnett, “Bayesian Optimization” (2022), https://bayesoptbook.com/
[6] Spooner et al. “Counterfactual Explanations for Arbitrary Regression Models” (2021)

Headline: Explainable AI - Take part in creating the future of human-system interaction
Subject: Information and Communication Technology
Description:
Background

In industrial settings, AI holds the potential for significant improvements such as energy-efficient operations, increasing throughput, and enabling more sustainable operations. According to a Gartner research study, only 15% of AI solutions deployed by 2022 will be successful. Despite a model’s statistical performance, process experts often don’t trust a ML model whose inner reasoning is not clear to them. If deployed, the end-users further struggle to comprehend the outputs and actions of the ML models.

To realize the possible benefits of AI in industrial applications, domain experts and end-users need to be given insights in the internal reasoning of ML(Machine Learning)-models. This is the subject of XAI (Explainable AI) research which gained a lot of attention in the last years. However, the needs and characteristics of the users and their working context is very diverse in industrial applications and these aspects need to be considered when designing industrial AI systems. Hence, it is imperative to consider diverse industrial users, use-cases, and data to develop a better understanding of the context and requirement of appropriate AI solutions.

Research questions

Using the fields study material gathered by us as a foundation to understand the industrial context of mining or pulp and paper, the following areas are proposed for the thesis student to dive deeper into:

• How do different types of explanations affect end-user understanding of an ML model?
• How and when should feedback be collected from an end-user?
• How can data be visualized to help end-users build accurate mental models and reduce cognitive load?
• What effect do data types have on understanding explanations?

Deliverables

Deliverables can be vary depending on either Human Factors, HCI or Computer science background. Examples of desirable deliverable are, Research methods for XAI to harvest inputs (needs, requirements), personas, user experience maps, demos / prototypes (coded is desirable), Interaction flows, validation methods for XAI technologies. Learnings from your work in form of recommendations or guidelines will also be beneficial for your master’s thesis and for ABB.

Headline: Privacy-preserving single-cell RNA sequencing using Confidential Computing
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Secure data sharing is a major barrier preventing efficient collaboration in biomedical research. For example, single-cell RNA sequencing data can be useful in improving our understanding of health and disease– however, its difficult to securely share datasets. Biomedical researchers actively seek approaches to deploy standardized data processing pipelines and process large data sets from multiple parties without disclosing aggregated data to the contributing parties. This can be solved by processing data in confidential computing environments. Recent advancements in platform security enable radical improvements in the security and privacy of cloud data and workloads. This allows creating isolated, verifiable, and user-controlled confidential computing environments that radically alter the trust relationship between customer businesses and cloud service providers. Combined with other Privacy Enhancing Technologies, confidential computing enables new business models for data sharing and workload collaboration.

Objectives:
CanaryBit’s technology protects the security and privacy of data stored and processed in public clouds. We leverage the latest hardware support for security features in commodity platforms (AMD SEV-SNP and Intel TDX) to enable confidential data analytics.

The thesis includes the following objectives:
• Design and implement a solution for multi-party, secure processing on single-cell RNA-sequencing data in a confidential environment.
• Evaluate the functionality and scalability of the designed solution with realistic data processing pipelines (provided by the Hayat Lab in Translational Data Science from RWTH Aachen).
• Create a prototype demonstrator and document the solution in a thesis report.

Implementation on x86 platforms (bare-metal and VMs). A successful project could lead to a valuable open-source contribution and a top-tier academic publication.

Terms:
• Supervisor: Nicolae Paladi, PhD, Founder, CanaryBit, Sweden (nicolae@canarybit.eu)
• Co-supervisor: Sikander Hayat, PhD, University Hospital, Aachen, Germany (shayat@ukaachen.de)
• Scope: 30 points
• Start: As soon as possible, not later than February 1st, 2023
• Duration: 6 Months
• Compensation: 10 000 SEK upon a successful completion of a high-quality thesis

Candidate profile:
Good programming skills in: C, Python and Rust + UNIX skills. Furthermore, an interest in operating systems, virtualization, cloud computing and distributed systems security. Solid oral and written English skills are required. Knowledge of single-cell sequencing data analyses is preferred but not required.

Deadline:
Send in your application as soon as possible, by September 30th, 2022 at the latest.
Application:
Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Applications should include:
1. Your CV with your education, professional experience, and specific skills.
2. A written report you authored or co-authored for a university level course.
3. Samples of previous programming or other relevant projects.
4. Recent grades (academic transcript).

More information:
Visit: https://www.canarybit.eu/ and hayatlab.org

Headline: Master thesis: Microwave design & materials for future radio solutions
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Board engineering is one of the key competences for 5G! The need for innovative RF integration solutions have never been bigger. We are currently looking for 1-2 Students for the board design team in our BTS Engineering lab in Stockholm to take part in the challenge of board analysis and design our future radio solutions and site concepts.

The task will be to analyze and optimize board solutions for radio in the form of a degree project / master thesis. This can involve board integration design or RF passive circuit solutions.
The work will be done in very close cooperation with our design teams in Sweden and our head office in China. Due to our current projects time-schedules it would be valuable for us if the work can start during 2021 or early 2022


Qualifications & experience

A general understanding of microwave circuit design and CAD tools like HFSS, MWO and CST using experience would be beneficial.
The candidate can of course communicate fluently in English, both verbally and in writing


Required skills/personal characteristics
We expect that the candidate can work independently as well as in a team
The candidate should have a high focus on delivering high quality work
Prior experience from international and multicultural work is preferred

Headline: Master thesis: Thermal design of future radio solutions
Subject: Engineering
Description:

The task will be to analyze and optimize cooling solutions for antennas and radio in the form of a degree project / master thesis. This can involve natural cooling, forced cooling or 2phase solutions.
The work will be done in very close cooperation with our design teams in Sweden and our head office in China. Due to our current projects time-schedules it would be valuable for us if the internships could start during 2021 or early 2022

A general understanding of electronics cooling and CFD tools like Flotherm, Fluent and Star CCM+ using experience would be beneficial.
The candidate can of course communicate fluently in English, both verbally and in writing


Required skills/personal characteristics
We expect that the candidate can work independently as well as in a team
The candidate should have a high focus on delivering high quality work
The candidate should have a good understanding of working in a test/lab environment
Prior experience from international and multicultural work is preferred

Headline: Master Thesis: AI Based Channel Estimation for 5G and Beyond
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Versatile approaches of conventional channel estimation (CE) algorithms such as linear minimum mean square error (LMMSE), compressive sensing (CS), and Gaussian mixture model (GMM) have been applied to multi-input multi-output (MIMO) and Orthogonal Frequency-Division Multiplexing (OFDM) wireless communication systems such the fifth generation new-radio (5G-NR). As such, it remains a mature engineering field while diminishing returns with regards to performance-improvement and complexity-reduction. However, conventional CE algorithms strongly dependent on assumptions on the channel such as the sparsity, Gaussian-like distribution, and stationarity. Whereas in practice, uncertainties remain due to the nature of wireless channel and the complex and changeable electromagnetic propagation environments. Conventional CE approaches still have some limits, and machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) based approached may improve CE by exploiting potential hidden factors in the propagation environments. Currently, researchers are exploiting CE from the perspective of model and data driven categories, but many questions remain open and yet to be answered.

In this master thesis project, entitled as “AI Based Channel Estimation for 5G and Beyond”, our targets are to investigate state of the art of model-driven and data-driven deep learning (DL) based channel estimation, and compare performance of different DL architectures with conventional methodologies. The student(s) will conduct researches under supervisions including the following tasks:
i.Build up an OFDM system model according to 3GPP standard for channel estimation, and use 3GPP and Quadriga channel models.
ii.Explore and simulate CE performance of conventional methods (LMMSE, GMM) and DL-based benchmarks such as DNN, CNN, RNN and their variants.
iii.Analyze and understand the underlying impacts of different AI structures to the performance, find metrics to measure the accuracy of learning, measure the sensitivity of model’s mismatch to performance behavior.
iv.Draw observations and conclusions about how and when AI based CE can improve conventional CE.

Headline: Master Thesis: AI Real-time Scheduler
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Founded in 1987, Huawei Technologies is one of the fastest growing telecommunications and network solutions providers in the world, and 2000 Huawei established the first overseas R&D office in Sweden. Huawei Technologies Sweden is continuously growing and with 300+ R&D engineers located in Stockholm, Gothenburg and Lund we are trailblazing the path to future 5G wireless systems with focus on standardization, research and pre-development. In Lund Research Center we focus on mobile chipset system architecture, standardization and algorithms.

Mobile phones and modems are subject to never-ending growth of requirements. The expected bit rates and the number of different services are growing rapidly. In order to keep the development pace and achieve flexible solutions, more and more algorithms are implemented in SW. In a cellular modem SoC, this translates into a computational load above 10-20G complex vector operations per second. The operations originate from different tasks, ranging from channel estimates and demodulation with hard real-time requirements to radio environment measurements with relaxed timing requirements. In order to keep the cost down, these tasks need to share SoC resources.

The objective is to study different ML approaches (including RL) and create an AI scheduler that can schedule tasks on multiple resources while keeping the system deadlines and selecting operating frequency to reduce the overall power consumption.

Qualifications
• Master student in Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
• Knowledge in areas such as machine learning, scheduling and real time systems.
• Basic knowledge in cellular communication.

Now we are looking for a topic as “High-efficiency Single-Stage Isolated Micro Inverter Design”, though this thesis, you will analysis the alternative solution include topology, control algorithm, components selection, etc.

The rough specifications list as below:
1. Single-stage isolation topology
2. Wide gain implementation
3. Implement soft switch/ZVS
4. Implement PV MPPT function
5.Output Power:450 W
6.Input voltage 22~58Vdc, Output voltage 220 Vac

Essential Skills required :
•Be familiar with the working principles of the isolate single stage DC/AC converter.
•Skillful in using circuit and magnetic simulation tools, such as: Psim, Multiphysics, MATLAB & Simulink.

Key Words: Power Electronics, Mico-inverter, PV, Digital Control

Headline: TSN Distributed Clock
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Emoco Labs is looking for engineering students who study a bachelor or a master within electrical engineering, computer science or similar that are interested in doing their thesis project at our automation lab.

Emoco is an automation solution provider. We assist people, companies and organizations in the automation transformation.
Emoco delivers ROS2 (Robot OS framework) enabled hardware and software, from components to complete functions. Applications running on local servers managed from the cloud.

TSN Distributed Clock
TSN Time-Sensitive Networking (TSN) is a set of standards under development by the Time-sensitive Networking task group of the IEEE 802.1 working group.
IEEE 802.1AS Timing and Synchronization for Time-Sensitive Applications. TSN networks is distributed from one central time source directly through the network itself using the IEEE 1588Precision Time Protocol, which utilizes Ethernet frames to distribute time synchronization information. IEEE 802.1AS is a tightly constrained subset of IEEE 1588 with sub-microsecond precision.

- Create a lab setup according e.g. picture above.
- Configure a clock master preferably on a PC using an ethernet MAC supporting TSN.
- Connect minimum 2 nodes through a switch 100 BaseT.
- Find solution and develop a software to get a common clock over the network with a target of reaching a T=1us deviation

Suitable skills and education:
We are searching for you who are studying robotics, electrical, mechatronics on bachelor or master level.

Do you have an idea?
We would love to hear your ideas and thoughts on what type of thesis work would be of interest for both you and Emoco. We are open for two students working jointly on a common thesis as well as one student working alone.

Start date of the thesis project is flexible.

Headline: SLAM - robot navigation
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Emoco Labs is looking for engineering students who study a bachelor or a master within electrical engineering, computer science or similar that are interested in doing their thesis project at our automation lab.

Emoco is an automation solution provider. We assist people, companies and organizations in the automation transformation.
Emoco delivers ROS2 (Robot OS framework) enabled hardware and software, from components to complete functions. Applications running on local servers managed from the cloud.

SLAM
Simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) is the computational problem of constructing or updating a map of an unknown environment while simultaneously keeping track of a robot's location within it. There are 2D and 3D maps where the more common solution in domestic robots (e.g.vacuum cleaners) utilizes a 2D, 360 degree rotating LIDAR. Which in any given time can return a 2D top view edge picture of the environment. This instant picture can be added to the map and also be used to recognize the robot position within the map. A robot that is flat to the floor could in most situations drive freely only by the 360 LIDAR. But when a robot
gets bigger it has to detect and understand objects in 3D like tables. By fusing multiple sensors a more accurate representation of the environment could be constructed resulting in a more accurate map and position. Example of sensors are 3D camera, IMU and Odometri (wheel location). A 3D map is a vast more complex product to handle with a huge amount of data. The size of such a map could be reduced to represent vectors, points, selected points of clouds
represented by blocks of different kinds and sizes. This type of mapping could also be complemented by recognition of specific objects that can be placed as markers in the map. There is also the approach of using 2D mapping for location and 3D for adding avoidance data to the 2d map.
-Analyze available research and techniques.
-Define criteria for price, size and availability.
-Define criteria for navigation environment.
-Test sensor solutions and evaluate pros and cons.
-Analyze and compare mapping an localization strategies.
-Make calculation cost analysis of different strategies.
-Suggest a solution that best criteria
-Verify the solution based on hardware provided by Emoco Labs

Suitable skills and education:
We are searching for you who are studying robotics, electrical, mechatronics on bachelor or master level.

Do you have an idea?

Headline: AI-Assisted Drone Identification Using Optical Camera
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
Due to the high freedom of movement, modern drones can penetrate most of the traditional ground-based defense systems and cause serious damage. However, tracking and capture the intruding drone is not an easy task. Comparing with other drone detection technologies like radar or radio-frequency detection, the vision approach is the most direct and accurate one to lock and track drones [1].

Problem formulation
With input from Skysense’ RF-based drone detection system, the camera gets the location of the drone. To improve the computer vision-based (AI) drone identification system, we want the student to carry out the following tasks:
1) Collect additional training data including images using infrared cameras
2) Train the AI model using appropriate (efficient) methodologies
3) Integrate the AI-assisted system with the drone surveillance system

Required background
Background in AI, in particular image processing and computer vision; Python and/or C++.

What you will be part of
Skysense is a fast-growing startup in the field of manned/unmanned aircraft tracking. Your workplace will be at our R&D site in Kista. Thesis work will begin in January (2023) and end in June (2023). A student who can start working before the thesis starts would be very good. A generous remuneration is envisaged for the right applicant.

References
[1] Fan, Heng, et al. "VisDrone-SOT2020: The Vision Meets Drone Single Object Tracking Challenge Results." European Conference on Computer Vision. Springer, Cham, 2020. Link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/15xSzXUSA7Ubo_ZuzkPWhAkOhAIGj9W90/view

Headline: Thesis Project at DeLaval International - Establishing methodology for estimating downstream GHG emissons of sold products in global supply chain
Subject: Sustainability
Description:
Background:
Sustainability is among the top prioritized questions for companies globally and an increasing number of companies put ambitious targets to decrease Greenhouse Gas Emissions in line with the Paris agreement.

For DeLaval, a world leader within equipment for dairy farming, sustainability lies in our roots – We make sustainable food production possible. Having a long history within development and manufacturing, serving a global market of innovative products, we are continuously working to improve the sustainability of our company and our products. Two years ago, we established a methodology for estimating the carbon footprint of upstream supply chain activities. Now, we want to improve our understanding of the sustainability performance of our product by creating a methodology for estimating and continuously monitor the carbon footprint of our downstream emissions in the supply chain.

For this work, we are looking for two ambitious student who want to use their Engineering skills to develop such methodology. The aim of the thesis is to establish a methodology to systematically and continuously estimating the GHG emissions of the downstream activities of sold products, including the use-phase and end-of-life treatment, by utilizing internal data and external sources of information. The methodology shall adhere to global best practices for GHG reporting.

The scope is limited to the use-phase and end-of-life treatment of sold products. Based on the methodology developed, a baseline scenario should be established that can be shared internally. Data will be collected throughout the organization and some travelling to our sites outside of Sweden might be required to give the students a better understanding of our products.

Depending on the student´s engineering background and specialization, the thesis could be extended to, for example, propose directions for improved sustainability of our products or improvements in data quality and data sources for improved measurements of the carbon footprint.

Your main task will be to:
Establish methodology for estimating downstream emissions of sold products
Conduct benchmark of methodology to similar companies
Establish baseline of carbon footprint for downstream emissions
Propose recommended areas for improved product sustainability
Propose recommended methodology improvements for increased accuracy
The work shall be delivered in English.

Your qualifications:
Master level in Industrial Engineering and Management and Production technology, Mechanical engineering, Chemistry and Biological Engineering, Energy and Environment, Physics and mathematics or similar
Good analytical and problem solving skills
Courses within Sustainability
Ability to work partly at DeLaval HQ in Stockholm

We offer you:
To do your thesis project in a professional international environment
To work in an innovative department
Economic compensation according to DeLaval standard
The working place will both be at the University and at DeLaval in Stockholm. The work will also to some extend be performed at different company facilities outside Sweden.

Number of students: 2

Start date:
The master thesis will be performed during spring 2023 with estimated start date in late January.

Interested?

Headline: Master Thesis Project: Multi-task learning in autonomous vehicles using knowledge distillation
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
General Summary:

Field: Deep Learning, Computer Vision

Background

In an autonomous vehicle, there are many tasks that needs to be learned by a neural network. Learning a single task per neural network is not a feasible solution because of the limited computational resources. Thus, learning multiple tasks using a single network (multi-task learning) is of interest.

Multi-task learning could be addressed in different ways. The most obvious solution would be to learn all tasks in a single network at once by combining data and loss function. Alternatively, one may utilize knowledge distillation technique for multi-task learning. That is, each task is first learned by an individual network, similar to single task learning, then the knowledge of those single-task networks is distilled into another multi-task network.

Purpose

This purpose of this thesis is to investigate alternative ways for multitask learning by utilizing knowledge distillation.

Learning objectives

This thesis will follow the following objectives:

To understand alternative ways for multi-task learning

Pros and cons of using knowledge distillation for multi-task learning

Number of students : 2

Student Background : Deep Learning, Python,  Computer Vision, Tensorflow / PyTorch

Last application date: November 30

Although this role has some expected minor physical activity, this should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. Headline: Examensarbete 30HP: Optimering av end user i fjärrkylsystem" i Södertälje
Subject: Energy and Sustainable Development
Description:
Scania Industrial Maintenance AB är ett tekniskt produktionsstödjande bolag som är en del av Scania CV AB. Vi har ett brett utbud av tjänster inom industriella projekt och vi ansvarar för produktions- och fastighetsunderhållet inom Scania. Vi är ca 1000 anställda i Södertälje, Oskarshamn och Luleå. Inom hela vår verksamhet arbetar vi tillsammans för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra leveranser, våra metoder och vår kompetens. Hos oss finns specialistkompetens inom bland annat automation, styr & regler, el och VVS. Alla anställda har möjlighet till resultatbonus och vi erbjuder attraktiva förmåner såsom arbetstidsförkortning, personalbil och förmånliga priser på Scanias egna semesterbostäder i Sverige.

Examensarbete är ett utmärkt sätt att få närmare kontakt med Scania och bygga relationer för framtiden. Många av dagens medarbetare började Scaniakarriären med sitt examensarbete.

Bakgrund
Med ökat fokus på hållbar produktion står Scania inför stora utmaningar att optimera sin energianvändning. Sedan i mitten av 2000-talet kyls Scanias produktion och kontroslokaler i Södertälje av centralt kylsystem med sjövatten från Mälaren, sk fjärrkyla. Utbyggd produktionskapacitet samt förtätning av kontors- konferensytor har medfört att möjligheten att ytterligare öka kylsystemets effektuttag under den varma perioden är begränsad.

Mål
Att presentera teknisk/ekonomisk lösning med tillhörande konsekvensanalys som förbättrar möjligheterna till ökad nyttjandegrad av utvalda end users anslutna till Scanias centrala fjärrkylsystem.

Uppdragsbeskrivning
Uppdraget innebär att utreda porential och möjligheter att optimera och förbättra temperaturprogam och delta T på sjövattnet för fjärrkylsystemet. Förslag på åtgärder/optimeringar ska utvärderas tekniskt/ekonomiskt. Dimensionerande temperatur är +11- +18 grC, delta T7 grC. Nuläget är att många anslutna maskiner och utrustningar, s.k end users, i produktionsprocesserna inte levererar på deimensionerande temperaturprogram och delta T är ofta lägre. Detta leder till outnyttjad kapacitet och lägre nyttjandegrad av systemet.

Krav- och behovsstudie samt nulägesanalys. Identifiera nuläget. Förstå kopplingen mellan temperaturprogram, lågt delta T, returtemperatur och kapacitetsnyttjande. Kartläggning och inventering av utvalda maskiner och utrustningar inom bearbetande processer. Beskriva hinder och möjligheter till optimering och förbättring. Sammanställning och delredovisning.

Analys och förståelse. Skapa metod för att stödja konsekvens och resultat av optimering och förbättring i utvalda maskiner och utrustningar. Skapa simuleringsmodell för verifiering av rätt retrtemperatur och temperaturprogram. Testa metod och simuleringsmodell på utvalda maskiner och utrustningar. Färdigställa metod och beräkningsmodell utifrån resultatet från piloten. Sammanställnign och delredovisning.

Slutsatser och resultat. Redovgöra för metoden och simuleringsmodellen inklusive testpilot. Slutrapport och slutredovinsning.

Utbildning/linje/inriktning
Utbildning, linje eller inriktning: Energiteknisk utbildnig, Civ ing.
Antal studerande: 2 studenter
Startdatum för ex-jobbet: Q1-2023
Beräknad tidsåtgång: 30 HP (20 veckor)

Kontaktpersoner och handledare:
Uppdragsgivare: Roland Dahlström, roland.dahlstrom@scania.com 070-5534995
Handledare: Mattias Abrahamsson, Mattias.abrahamsson@scania.com

Ansökan:
Din ansökan ska innehålla CV, personligt brev och betygsutdrag

Headline: Thesis Worker - Efficient Oil Cooling of electric machine
Subject: Vehicle Engineering
Description:
Thesis Worker at Volvo Cars

Welcome to explore the world of Volvo Cars by writing your thesis with us! As a thesis worker in our organization you are supported by a supervisor who follows you during your project. All thesis projects are arranged in business critical areas and therefore you will be able to contribute to our company purpose – providing freedom to move in a safe, sustainable and personal way – from day one!

Background
The Electric Drive department at Volvo Cars is proud of being one of the most successful players in SW development for Electric Vehicles. We are responsible for delivering system solutions and SW functionality for the Inverters, Electric machines, and transmission in our electrified vehicles. Our vision is to become “Leading in electrification” and aiming to contribute to world class sustainability, energy efficiency, E-machine functionality, customer satisfaction, to all our future products.

Scope
Efficient Oil Cooling of electric machine:
All rotating electrical machines generate heat as a result of the electrical and mechanical losses inside the machine. Using oil cooling is a highly effective way to run the electric machine in the best way and to improve efficiency and reliability.

To refine the current concept design. We would like to study the Oil Cooling of copper windings and stator, but at the same time prevent oil from entering the air gap between the rotor and stator to prevent losses. Oil in air gap can create 10-20 times higher losses.

Activities we foresee that should be done during this thesis work are:
•    Benchmarking of competitors.
•    Create a 3D design of the concept
•    Prototype evaluation
•    Perform testing in rigs.

Your contribution is our future
We believe that the suitable students study Electric power engineering or Mechanical Engineer.

Duration
• The duration of the Thesis is approx. 4-5 months
• The Thesis starts in spring 2023, exact date to be discussed
• 30 ECTS (academic credits) if in agreement with your Thesis Advisor in University
• This thesis is to be conducted by 2 students working in a pair
• Office, computer, and software will be arranged by University and Volvo Cars.

Be part of the change – apply today!
Selection will be ongoing during the application period, so do not hesitate to send in your application. Attach your resume and cover letter and copies of grades. You can provide a reference if you would like. Please note that due to GDPR, applications by email will not be accepted.

We want your application at the latest 2022-12-02.

If you have any additional questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact:
Supervisor Roar Matsson at roar.matsson@volvocars.com, (+46729775109).
Hiring manager Martin Randle at martin.randle@volvocars.com, (+46729775319).

We are Volvo Cars
Volvo Cars is a company on a mission to bring traditional car manufacturing into a connected, sustainable and smart future. Since 1927, we've been known for our commitment to safety and for creating innovative cars that make life less complicated. In 2010, we decided to radically redefine our business, resulting in a totally new generation of cars and technology, as well as steady growth and record sales - and we're only getting started. By 2025, we aim to have yearly sales of 1.2 million cars, 50% of which will be electric vehicles and sold directly to customers through digital channels. We also intend to strengthen our position as a modern, progressive employer committed to diversity and gender and racial equality. We believe in the power of people. Join us and be part of Volvo Cars' transformation.

Headline: Metallic objects CAD design for Big Metal Masses Research
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Background
Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Our product portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, and trams to integrated systems, customised services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. Joining us means joining a caring, responsible, and innovative company where more than 70,000 people lead the way to greener and smarter mobility, worldwide.

Both Balises and onboard system suffers from metallic objects on track. Some of them would have slight impact on the transmission performance, while some of them would trigger alarms for onboard system.
Measurements with big metal masses have been performed in lab with a reference loop which is a lab equipment. It would be interesting and beneficial to do a research, to see the feasibility of characterising with the antenna which is already mounted on the train.  In this way, the antenna can be used on a test train or maintenance vehicle for preventive purposes.
Problem description and goals

The feasibility study has two parts, the first step is to investigate different metallic object that would appear on track and that would have impact on the onboard system(e.g. cause sporadic antenna test failure). The second step is the feasibility study of BMM characterisation with the existing antenna on the train.

The scope of this thesis will focus on the first part above. Within the required responsibilities the candidate should:
• Perform a technological survey of the metallic objects that might be placed on track and might appear on track.
• Perform a research for metallic objects which wouldn’t appear on real track, but would provide informative data for the feasibility study of the characterization with train antenna.
• Based on the study above, do design calculations and CAD design of the metallic objects(DfM)
