Headline: Misbehavior Mitigation in Vehicular Platoons
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Master thesis project @ Networked Systems Security (NSS) Group
www.eecs.kth.se/nss

Project title: Misbehavior Mitigation in Vehicular Platoons

Problem to solve: Currently, studies in the field [IRS+19, G+19] suggest that vehicles operating under Cooperative Adaptive Cruise Control (CACC) should degrade their mode of operation to Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) when a misbehavior is detected; however, this diminishes the bene ts of the platooning application. More elaborate mitigation techniques can be deployed, categorized in two groups. One group aims to modify the input that reaches the CACC controller when a misbehavior is detected, e.g., by removing the attack's noise or by modifying the input data [Sun17, MS15, BGP17]. The other, aims to improve the resiliency of the CACC controller itself [LMWZ17]; for example, by increasing the intra-platoon distances based on a misbehavior suspicion before devolving to ACC [W+20].

What to do?
1. Literature review on the available mitigation and data  ltering techniques
2. Identify security and safety issues in the literature
3. Evaluate the di erent mitigation techniques in the context of the platooning application
4. Implement falsi cation attacks that a ect the vehicles' driving capabilities
5. Design and implement a mitigation technique capable of securing the vehicles against falsification attacks

Headline: The effects of Vehicular Maneuvers in Misbehavior Detection Schemes
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Problem to solve: Vehicles support some levels of automation, ranging from simple Adaptive Cruise Control (ACC) to Cooperative ACC (CACC). Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS), aim to provide safety, better road throughput and comfort to the driver. An integral part of the automation is the ability of the vehicles to perform manoeuvers. Recently, ACC-equipped vehicles were used to perform  manoeuvers in order to avoid obstacles and merge into traffic [CAG+19, SCPZ+20]. To achieve this type of coordination, vehicles need to exchange information. Its accuracy is important, both for the nominal functionality of the service but also in in order to preserve the safety of the passengers and follow the traffic laws. Several works in the literature has shown that malicious actors can disrupt this functionality, either by falsifying the transmitted information, or by jamming one or more vehicles. These attacks can affect the traffic flow and lead to accidents [VdHLK18, KKBP22]. To thwart this type of misbehavior, several types of Misbehavior Detection Schemes have been proposed [KAP+20, KKBP22]. However, the presence of manoeuvers further complicates the detection of attacks; smart attackers can choose to initiate an attack during the manoeuvering [KKBP22], making it harder to detect. Considering the potential for damage, the role of the manoeuvers combined with potential misbehavior should be analyzed.

What to do?
1. Literature review on the state-of-the-art Misbehavior Detection Schemes and its usage in Vehicular Ad-hoc Networks
2. Perform falsification and other type of attacks against vehicles during manoeuvering
3. Evaluate the feasibility of the current Misbehavior Detection Schemes during maneuvering scenarios
4. Design an Misbehavior Detection Scheme (MDS) capable of performing with high level of accuracy and precision in all vehicular scenarios, including manoeuvers

Who would be the right person for the project?
1. Background (including one or more): machine learning, computer & network security
2. Tools and programming skills: good knowledge on Python, programming knowledge in C/C++ is a bonus

Headline: Attacking Participatory Sensing Systems
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Master thesis project @ Networked Systems Security (NSS) Group
www.eecs.kth.se/nss

Project title: Attacking Participatory Sensing Systems

Problem to solve: The emerging number of mobile devices equipped with multiple sensors has enabled Participatory Sensing (PS) [GGP14] on a large-scale in recent years, providing cheap and easy-to-deploy sensing compared to traditional wireless sensor networks. Compared with traditional wireless sensor network, in PS mobile devices act as nodes to collect data from anywhere, at any time, about anything. However, the openness of PS systems makes them vulnerable to selfish and malicious users who often collaterally contribute faulty data. Besides, the lack of public PS datasets makes the evaluation of the defence mechanism hard and not reproducible. On the other hand, using rich real-world participatory sensing datasets could bring some ethical problems for researchers and limit their free use. As an illustration, the lack of accurate documentation for the data collection process could cause termination of an ongoing project (e.g. [BHKT19] had stopped due to the ethics) as the data subject might be under different legislation, putting some restrictions on data processing. Therefore, there is a need for PS simulation system which generates realistic data considering different adversarial model.

What to do?
1. Familiarise with participatory sensing application
2. Investigate the available tools for generating ground truth for PS data
3. Design a framework using the tool to simulate different participatory sensing scenarios in
the chosen domain
4. Design different adversarial model on top of the framework
5. Visualise the effect of the adversarial scenarios on the system with the designed framework

Who would be the right person for the project?
1. Background (including one or more): Computer security, simulation
2. Tools and programming skills: Programming

Headline: Secure and Privacy-enhancing Decentralized Location-based Services
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Master thesis project @ Networked Systems Security (NSS) Group
www.eecs.kth.se/nss

Project title: Secure and Privacy-enhancing Decentralized Location-based Services

Problem to solve: A Location-based Service (LBS) query targets a location/region and expresses one or more specific user interests; the LBS server responds with the most up-to-date relevant Point of Interests (POIs). During this process, users’ current or future whereabouts and interests are disclosed to the LBS server through their queries. Although Privacy Enhancing Technologys (PETs) and Location Privacy Protection Mechanisms (LPPMs) have been proposed to protect users’ location privacy, improper practice could render the protections ineffective [1, 2, 2]. In this project, you are expected to design a decentralized privacy-enhancing LBS that protect users from curious LBS servers, and curious and/or malicious neighboring users. The projects should investigate different existing LPPMs and apply chosen LPPMs (based on your investigations) to the queries before sending to the LBS server.

What to do?
1. Literature review on the PETs and LPPMs
2. Identify security and privacy issues in decentralized LBSs
3. Design a resilient and privacy-preserving decentralized LBS
4. Security and privacy analysis based on numerical and simulation results

Who would be the right person for the project?
1. Background (including one or more): network security, data privacy, applied cryptography
2. Tools and programming skills: basic programming, simulation

Headline: Scalable and Resilient Secure Vehicular Communication Systems
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Master thesis project @ Networked Systems Security (NSS) Group
www.eecs.kth.se/nss

Project title: Scalable and Resilient Secure Vehicular Communication
Systems

Problem to solve: Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X) communication in Vehicular Communication (VC) systems entail high-rate transmissions: typically, for safety beacons, vehicles/On-Board Units
(OBUs) transmit at a rate of 10 Hz, i.e., 10 beacons per second. In spite of approaches that adapt the beacon rate, the challenge is clear: as VC systems get progressively widely deployed, each
vehicle will have to process safety beacons (along with other traffic) from several tens of vehicles within its OBU range, e.g., 300 messages per second for 30 neighboring vehicles. The provision of
security and privacy protection aggravates the situation, adding communication overhead (digital signatures and short-term certificates attached, thus longer messages), as well as computation
overhead (signature veri cations mostly, and signature calculations).

What to do?
1. Literature review on secure VC systems
2. Propose enhancement(s) for an efficient and resilient VC system
3. Implementation of the proposed scheme
4. Security and privacy analysis, and experimental evaluation of the system

Who would be the right person for the project?
1. Background (including one or more): network security, data privacy, applied cryptography
2. Tools and programming skills: Fluent in C, basic Python

Headline: Performance enhancement for Resource Public Key Infrastructure
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Master thesis project @ Networked Systems Security (NSS) Group
www.eecs.kth.se/nss

Project title: Performance enhancement for Resource Public Key Infrastructure

Problem to solve: As an important routing protocol, the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) is used to exchange routing information among autonomous systems (ASs). The appearance of Resource Public Key Infrastructure (RPKI) addressed the problem of lacking security method to verify the legitimacy and authenticity of the routing information in BGP-4 [1]. Current RPKI using Route Origin Authorizations (ROA) and certificates to secure the origin of IP
prefix and autonomous system numbers (ASN) [2]. In current RPKI, users get the service of Route Origin Validation (ROV) by querying the Relying Party (RP), which is a server caching the RPKI repository. Thus, the accuracy of ROV is highly relying on the cached repository. Since RPKI is widely accepted and widely deployed in recent years, the repository is growing fast. As an algorithm designed for data synchronization in RPKI, the efficiency and accuracy of RRDP (RPKI Repository Delta Protocol) is becoming more and more important. Thus, this thesis aims
to create/revise the current data synchronization method for RPKI to improve the performance.

What to do?
1. Study the mechanism of RPKI and the characteristic of data synchronization between RPs and publication points.
2. Study the data sync algorithm: rsync and RRDP. Design an algorithm (based on existing algorithms or a newly
designed one) with better performance for data sync between RP and PPs.
3. Testing the performance of the algorithm by synchronizing real RPKI repository between one RP and several PPs. (Testing by hardware or simulations)

Who would be the right person for the project? You are interested in working on cutting edge topics regarding security, privacy, applied cryptography. You are motivated and capable of working independently, while under the supervision and mentorship of experienced researchers. Grow your skills and yourself as an excellent person and professional by joining us at the NSS group, where you will have a chance to test yourself and influence your own
research!
1. Background (including one or more): Computer/network security, basic mathematics/statistics.
2. Tools and programming skills: Scripting skills for testing and simulations (Python or MATLAB)

Headline: Multiband Carrier Aggregation in HF Communications
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Background
High Frequency Communications (“shortwave”) in the frequency range 2-30MHz is still an important component in medium to long range communications where its used for airborne, maritime and emergency communications  in particular in high latitudes where satellite communications fail. At HF frequencies signals are reflected In the upper layers of the earth’s atmosphere, the ionosphere,  where solar radiation and particles (“solar wind”) create electrically charged layers.  These layers are located at 100-400km height and allow for communication of up to 4000km in a single hop and globally through multiple hops.  The electrical characteristics of these layers will change with location, time of day and the solar activity and can be difficult to predict in detail. Therefor modern HF communications system use Automatic Link Establishment procedures where the system scans and probes the pool of available frequencies to find frequencies with favorable propagation and low interference.  The communication channel is subject to severe multipath propagation as various wave-modes have differing path delay in the ionosphere. This gives rise to  frequency selective fading, and conventional system are limited to a few kHz in bandwidth. One possibility to increase the transmission bandwidth is to use parallel transmissions on many narrowband channels in different frequency bands and aggregating the bit streams.  This also requires a fast link set-up procedure that can find frequency bands with favorable propagation conditions and  “empty slots” in the spectrum, avoiding interference from other systems.

The project objective
The project aims at designing and evaluating a practical protocol based on the concept in [1], and to verify that simultaneous probing and data transmission is technically feasible in many channels in several frequency bands.

The project task
The project task consists of implementing a parallel probing and data transmission scheme for HF using  Red Pitaya Software Defined Radio(SDR) boards and the open source GNU Radio software platform [4].  The project should demonstrate the functionality in lab setup. If time permits, also an “on-air test” over a few hundred km is performed.
The project task is suitable for 2 students as the problem can be subdivided into one protocol design and one radio-electronics sub-problem. Experience from practical electronic design and radio systems is valuable.

Headline: Power Amplifiers for HF-systems with carrier aggregation
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Background
High Frequency Communications (“shortwave”) in the frequency range 2-30MHz is still an important component in medium to long-range communications where it’s used for airborne, maritime and emergency communications in particular in high latitudes where satellite communications fail. At HF frequencies signals are reflected In the upper layers of the earth’s atmosphere, the ionosphere, where solar radiation and particles (“solar wind”) create electrically charged layers.  The electrical characteristics of these layers will change with location, time of day and the solar activity and can be difficult to predict in detail. Therefore modern HF communications system use Automatic Link Establishment procedures where the system scans and probes the pool of available frequencies to find frequencies with favorable propagation and low interference.  In order to do this fast and efficient and to increase the transmission data rate, systems have been proposed [1] that use parallel transmissions on many narrowband channels in different frequency bands and aggregating the bit streams.  The link set-up procedure finds frequency bands with favorable propagation conditions and “empty slots” in the spectrum, avoiding interference from other systems (

Operating simultaneously with multiple carriers over a large frequency range requires highly linear amplifiers in order to avoid spurious emissions.  A particular problem with multicarrier transmissions is that although the average powers of the different signals add up, also the signal amplitudes add up. If there are N signals with power P, the resulting average power will be NP.  However, in unfavorable situations the amplitudes A of the N signals may add up to a AN resulting in a peak power proportional to (AN)2 or N2P.  The means that the Peak-to-Average-Power- Ratio (PAPR) grows proportional to N.  In order to avoid clipping that will cause signal distortion and spurious emissions the power amplifier has to be “backed-off” allowing the peak-power transients to remain in the linear range of the amplifier. This means that a 1 kW amplifier for, say, 10 carriers, has to operate at an average transmit power of 100W, i.e. only 10W per carrier to avoid clipping.
Today’s solid state amplifiers typically use Silicon MOSFET transistors that can deliver 1 KW peak power, operate at 50V supply voltage. One way to significantly increase the peak power would be to use other semiconductor technologies, e.g. Gallium Nitride(GaN) ,  Silicon Carbide (SiC) MOSFET:s or Si CoolMOS that can operate at 500V  or more, and thus potentially could deliver very high peak powers.  Such transistors are today mainly used in high voltage or high temperature switching applications. An interesting question is if they could be used in linear amplifiers.
The project objective
The project aims at investigating whether SiC or GaN transistors can be used to build highly linear power amplifiers with peak powers up to 5-10 kW and average powers in the range 500-1000W for the frequency range up to 30 MHz.

The project task
The project task involves reviewing the literature on linear HF amplifiers and high voltage transistors, to select some promising device, to design and build a SiC, GaN or Si CoolMOS based power amplifier and verify its performance by measurements.
The project task is suitable for students with a course background in electronic design
Project advisor:  Prof Jens Zander, jenz@kth.se
Project examiner: Prof Carl-Mikael Zetterling, bellman@kth.se
Bibliography

[1]  J. Zander, "Greedy Channel allocation in Meshed Wideband HF Radio Networks with Channel Aggregation," in EuCAP 2022 (submitted), Madrid, 2022.

Headline: FPGA-based 1588 Timing Synchronization for embedded systems
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
BitSim NOW is an electronics design and consultancy house in Kista, part of Prevas. We develop our customers future product development in many different markets such as Industrial, Medtech, Defence, Telecom.

Time Synchronization is an important aspect for communication between systems in areas such as Industrial Measurement, Power Generation & Distribution, and Mobile Connectivity. It is increasingly important to minimize the timing delay utilizing newer technology.

The implementation will be a mixture of HW  and, on a smaller scale, embedded  SW. The plan is to implement the design on in an FPGA on an evaluation board,

The thesis work task is to create timing synchronization between two units utilizing the IEEE1588 protocol and investigate the time delay performance in different configurations.

The task is:

1. Learn and analyze the 1588 protocol and investigate different implementation alternatives including using externally sourced sub blocks.

2. Implement the 1588 protocol on the units.

3. Test the performance measured in a resulting timing delay (jitter, network delays) between two units in different test configurations.

4. Analyze the SW needed to control and interact with remote devices on higher layers.

Required background: VHDL FPGA, C, embedded SW,
Start date: January 2022

Contact: Anders Sivard,  BitSim Now AB, part of Prevas.

Headline: Ericsson IT Trainee Program 2023
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Our Exciting Opportunity
As part of the IT Trainee program you’ll join different highly proficient teams, focusing on redefining the operating model of Ericsson.  You will improve your skills by working side by side with our specialists in state-of-the art technologies. You will use your technical knowledge and skills to develop solutions that address tricky business problems across all areas of Ericsson together with our highly committed and multi-cultural teams.

Eager to kick-start your career in a global company with endless opportunities...
Then we encourage you to join our exciting journey! We will provide the keys - it is up to you to show us, and yourself, how you'll unlock a well of opportunities with your resourcefulness and personality! We are looking for trainees who are willing to take action and want to do true impact on the technology used in every-day life. We want you to challenge us by using your problem-solving skills, dedication and creativity to come up with solutions that can scale globally.

We can offer
In our program, we offer the opportunity to explore Enterprise IT at Ericsson. For this, you will have the possibility to alternate between areas such as Cloud, Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence, Data & Analytics, Automation, and Software Development.

You’ll have the chance to take part in both technical and business-related projects. It is an outstanding opportunity to try new areas that you might have never considered before, to be taken outside of your comfort zone, grow, and boost your career. It will be a learning curve through exciting projects and personal development training. With mentoring and guidance from our employees, together we will find where your passion lies within Ericsson and make sure that the work you will do is aligned with your goals and values.

Learn more about Enterprise IT at Ericsson here.

It is a permanent position, starting with a one-year program in August 2023. After the program you will have a role within Enterprise IT, where depends on your interest and our need. During the rotations we will offer you many ways to build your career according to your field of interest.

After this inspirational year, you can expect to have:

a good introduction and broad general knowledge of Ericsson and Enterprise IT in particular
built a network with other trainees as well as employees
increased your technical skills, self-awareness and found your right element
an open discussion on where your strengths best fit within Enterprise IT

To us, you are...
graduating in 2023 with a Bachelor or Master’s degree from a Swedish University in Computer Science, IT, Engineering Physics or other relevant field of studies
strongly interested in the IT field and eager to learn
enthusiastic with an outcome approach
inherently curious and have a hands-on, can-do approach
a person who thrives in a multi-cultural workplace and enjoy interacting with people globally
open-minded communicative team-player but can also do projects independently
comfortable in English, both written and orally

Headline: Visual data flow programming compiler. Study and investigate the possibility of creating an optimized compiler from a low coding structure
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Visual data flow programming compiler. Study and investigate the possibility of creating an optimized compiler from a low coding structure.

Uppdragsgivare
Vi är ett IT-konsultbolag med många års erfarenhet av systemutveckling och affärsanalys. Våra kunder är kreativa verksamhetsutvecklare eller innovativa pro-duktutvecklare som använder ny teknik. Vi är ett personligt konsultföretag där vi bryr om oss varandra.

Bakgrund
Inom systemutveckling används idag alltfler sk ”Low Coding” verktyg för att generera
programsystem. Dessa verktyg genererar ofta olika datastrukturer som sen tolkas så
att arbete utförs i datorn. Speciellt vanligt är detta inom data integration och webbut-veckling. En nackdel är dock att prestanda blir lidande.

Exjobbsförslag

Utforska möjligheterna att konstruera en kompilator som utgående från ett interpreter-ande språk genererar nytt interpreterade språk eller direkt maskinkod. Ursprungs-kod
har genererats av ett grafiskt dataflödesverktyg.
Innehåll:
 Studera kod som genereras av ”Low Coding” grafiskt verktyg.
 Undersök vilka möjligheter det finns att konstruera en kompilator för sådan kod.
 Konstruera en enkel kompilator för sådan kod.
 Undersök vilka prestandaförbättringar som kan åstadkommas.
 Dokumentera resultatet.

Den sökande är fri att utforma, omformulera eller begränsa uppgiften för att skapa en passande exjobbsuppgift.

Övrigt
Viss information om exjobbet kan endast lämnas under sekretess. Flexibelt startdatum.

Behov
Den sökande bör ha goda erfarenheter i programmering och viss kunskap om kompilatorkonstruktion.

Headline: Protecting software in embedded devices like IoT units. Investigate and design a method for high level protection against illegal copying and reverse engineering.
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Protecting software in embedded devices like IoT units. Investigate and design a method for high level protection against illegal copying and reverse engineering.

Uppdragsgivare
Vi är ett IT-konsultbolag med många års erfarenhet av systemutveckling och affärsanalys. Våra kunder är kreativa verksamhetsutvecklare eller innovativa produktutvecklare som använder ny teknik. Vi är ett personligt konsultföretag där vi bryr om oss varandra.

Bakgrund
Fler och fler små elektroniska enheter s.k. IoT enheter används för olika tillämpningar. Ett problem med dessa är att de relativt enkelt kan kopieras av andra aktörer. Speciellt kan olika detaljer i programvaran kopieras. Detta gäller tex algoritmer för Machine Learning. För att förhindra detta kan kanske olika krypteringsmetoder användas.

Examensarbete förslag
Undersök och konstruera en möjlig metod för att säkerställa att programvara i IoT enheter ej kan studeras eller läsas ut.

Innehåll:
 Vilka metoder är möjliga.
 Utveckla eller studera krypteringsmetoder för inbyggd programvara.
 Skriv ett program som använder en metod.
 Genomför en riskanalys om hot mot utläsning/kopiering
 Dokumentera resultatet.

Den sökande är fri att utforma, omformulera eller begränsa uppgiften för att skapa en passande uppgift.

Viss information om exjobbet kan endast lämnas under sekretess, hör gärna av dig så berättar vi mer.
Flexibelt startdatum.
Vi har kontor i Kista och Umeå.

Headline: Energy harvesting (energiskörd) – methods and investigation of energy collection
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Energy harvesting (energiskörd) –  methods and investigation of energy collection.

Vi som uppdragsgivare
Vi är ett IT-konsultbolag med många års erfarenhet av systemutveckling och affärsanalys. Våra kunder är kreativa verksamhetsutvecklare eller innovativa produktutvecklare som använder ny teknik. Vi är ett personligt konsultföretag där vi bryr om oss varandra.
Omicrons Way of Working: Vi har kunskap - Vi bryr oss - Vi hjälps åt


Bakgrund till förslaget
För att driva små elektroniska apparater ofta benämnda IoT enheter kan s.k. ”energy harvesting” användas. Det finns ett flertal metoder för att utvinna energi tex via rörelse, värme, elektriska och magnetiska fält.

Examensarbete förslag

Utforska olika metoder för att utvinna energi via ”energy harversting”.

Innehåll:
 Vilka metoder finns.
 Hur mycket elektrisk energi kan utvinnas med de olika metoderna.
 Genomför ett praktiskt prov.
 Dokumentera resultatet.

Den sökande är fri att utforma, omformulera eller begränsa uppgiften för att skapa en passande uppgift.

Övrigt
Examensarbete 30hp. Viss information om exjobbet kan endast lämnas under sekretess men mycket information kan hämtas via sökning på nätet med ”energy harvesting”.
Hör gärna av dig om du vill veta mer. Vi är flexibla med startdatum och vi har kontor i Kista och Umeå. Besök oss gärna under D-dagen på KTH i Stockholm.

Headline: Biochemical digitalisation of horses
Subject: Chemical Science and Engineering
Description:
Chemical Sensing Group is a large initiative placed at KTH central campus. We are a multidisciplinary research group with more than 20 researchers. Our aim is to design electroanalytical and optical sensing concepts with great impact on sports,  healthcare and environment.

We would like to develop a wearable sensor for horse monitoring. Correlations between diverse biomarkers is yet under study.
We have a close collaboration with the Swedish horse sector and vets.

We are looking for highly motivated students with background in chemistry, biochemistry, biotechnology, or medical engineering.

We may be able to offer interested students from Sweden or abroad internships in these fields with flexible start dates and duration (20 - 40 weeks). Our group is very dynamic and international that collaborates with industries, create start-ups, and work on exchanges with prominent universities from all over the world. For foreign students, KTH may be able to offer help to find accommodation and get settled.

If you are master student, we would like a commitment of 10-12h a week, and full-time arrangement during summer season.

Submit your CV to gacp@kth.se indicating your experience, and research you would like to pursue. We will start revising applications immediately.
Do not hesitate to contact us for further details.
https://cuartero-research.com

Gaston Crespo
Maria Cuartero

Headline: Diploma work in organic synthesis (catalysis, biorefinery, electrosynthesis)
Subject: Chemical Science and Engineering
Description: The Lundberg lab at the Department of Chemistry, Division of Organic Chemistry, at KTH accepts students for diploma works (BSc and MSc) and project courses (15-30 hp) with flexible starting dates on a rolling basis. We offer projects connected to our on-going organic chemistry research in the areas of catalysis and electrosynthesis, spanning from fundamental studies of reactivity and selectivity to applications in biomass valorization and textile recycling. The projects are typically centered around synthetic method development with the main body of work being carried out in a laboratory setting under the guidance of a designated supervisor. Enrollment in a diploma or non-diploma project course in our lab is a great opportunity for students to learn new organic chemistry techniques, such as electrosynthesis that employs electricity as chemical reagent, as well as to further develop synthetic skills previously learnt in course labs. In addition, analysis of organic molecules using chromatographic e.g. HPLC and spectroscopic techniques such as NMR will be practiced with the aim of training independence. Interested students are very welcome to visit our lab's website https://lundberglab.se to learn more about our young and ambitious group and what we do. To discuss available projects, contact Helena via email to book a time.

Headline: Master thesis - Image analysis, RaySearch Laboratories
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
Are you in the end of your studies in engineering physics, computer science, mathematics or similar? RaySearch now offers a Master Thesis position within image analysis at our head office in central Stockholm, starting January 2023.

We offer the following Master Thesis job:
"Implementation and validation of robust perfusion models"

The topic is development and validation of robust algorithms for computing quantitative pharmacokinetic parameters from dynamic MR imaging data, by looking at changes over time. Such algorithms are medically relevant for diagnostic as well as treatment purposes.

The project will result in a prototype implemented in a research version of our treatment planning system RayStation.

Starting your career at RaySearch
Joining RaySearch as a Master Thesis Student, you will:
… get a solid introduction to our company, products and ways of working.
…become part of a global Swedish company with 350+ employees, head office and R&D department in central Stockholm with a chance of full-time employment after graduation
… join 180 well-educated and dedicated engineers who enjoy knowledge sharing, problem solving and working in teams.
… work in a great work environment with flex hours, breakfasts, afterworks and social activities
… work with cutting-edge technology for cancer treatment. Your daily work will contribute to improve cancer treatments for patients all over the world.

Master thesis students with an interest in image analysis. The project starts in January 2023.
You are interested in using your knowledge in image analysis to contribute to our mission. You may be an experienced software developer or you may be less experienced but eager to learn. Mathematics skills, programming interest, relevant hobby projects and summer/part time jobs within development and/or research are highly valued.

Headline: Master thesis - Optimization, RaySearch Laboratories
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Are you in the end of your studies in engineering physics, computer science, mathematics or similar? RaySearch now offers a Master Thesis position within optimization at our head office in central Stockholm, starting January 2023.

We offer the following Master Thesis job:
"Optimization of the FLASH effect in radiation therapy treatment of cancer"

The topic is development of algorithms for optimization of FLASH treatments—a novel radiation therapy technology for treating cancer, where ultra-high dose is delivered to the patient for a very short time. Experiments indicate that this type of treatment can reduce the damage to healthy tissues induced by radiation while retaining a high probability of removing the tumor, thereby leading to better outcome for patients. Depending on the time structure of the delivery of radiation, the extent of the FLASH effect can vary. In this project, you will investigate methods to maximize the effect by optimizing the timing of the delivery of the treatment. The project will result in a prototype determining how treatment plans should be delivered to give the highest potential of obtaining the indicated positive treatment effects.

… work with cutting-edge technology for cancer treatment. Your daily work will contribute to improve cancer treatments for patients all over the world.

Master thesis students with an interest in optimization and project start in January 2023.
You are interested in using your knowledge in optimization to contribute to our mission. You may be an experienced programmer or you may be less experienced but eager to learn. Mathematics skills, programming interest, relevant hobby projects and summer/part time jobs within development and/or research are highly valued.

Headline: Master thesis - Medical radiation physics, RaySearch Laboratories
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
Are you in the end of your studies in engineering physics, physics, medical physics or similar? RaySearch now offers a Master Thesis position within medical radiation physics at our head office in central Stockholm, starting January 2023.

We offer the following Master Thesis job:
Radio-nuclear medicine in RayStation

Radionuclide medicine is when radioactive nuclei are injected in the body and bind to tumor cells where the radioactive decay can be used for treatment, tumor imaging or both. Radionuclide therapy has been used for over a century (Radium against Leukemia or Iodine against thyroid disease). The modern version are treatments where the radioactive nuclei (often Lutetium or Yttrium) are attached to manufactured peptides engineered to bind to molecules expressed at the surface of tumor cells. Nuclear beta-decays give a highly local energy deposit ranging only mm’s into the tumor or normal tissue, effective when there are many small lesions. Simultaneous photo-emissions reach outside the patient and can be used to create a, somewhat blurry, image of the tumor distribution in the body using a SPECT/CT imager (single photon emission CT). For some treatments a diagnostic PET/CT (positron emission tomography) is acquired before treatment using a beta+ emitter attached to the very same peptide.

There is mounting evidence that more precise knowledge of the dose distribution could inform treatment decisions leading to better patient survival.

We hope that at the end of this project we have created a RayStation prototype able to extract activity maps from SPECT or PET-images, feed these into the RayStation coupled photon-electron Monte Carlo dose engine with appropriate decay spectra and compute dose rates, time integrated dose or, time permitting, biologically equivalent dose for comparison to external radiotherapy.

Starting your career at RaySearch
Joining RaySearch as a Master Thesis Student, you will:
… get a solid introduction to our company, products and ways of working.
…become part of a global Swedish company with 350+ employees, head office and R&D department in central Stockholm with a chance of full-time employment after graduation
… join 180 well-educated and dedicated engineers who enjoy knowledge sharing, problem solving and working in teams.
… work in a great work environment with flex hours, breakfasts, after-works and social activities
… work with cutting-edge technology for cancer treatment. Your daily work will contribute to improve cancer treatments for patients all over the world.
Who can apply?

Master thesis students with an interest in medical radiation physics and software development with project start January 2023.
You are interested in using your knowledge in physics and programming to contribute to our mission. You may be an experienced software developer or you may be less experienced but eager to learn. Physics skills, programming interest, summer/part time jobs within development and/or research are highly valued.

Headline: Thesis work at Software Engineering, Husqvarna Group – Open suggestions
Subject: Design and Product Realisation
Description:
We are now looking for students who study for a master's in software engineering that are interested in doing their thesis project at our Construction Division in Gothenburg.

For more than 325 years we have driven innovation and technological development exceeding end-customers’ expectations. Husqvarna Construction, a division of the Husqvarna Group, is a world leader in machinery and diamond tools for the construction and stone industries. The foundation is built on product and technology leadership ensured by high investment levels in user-focused product development to offer professional end-users the most effective and efficient solutions. Products and services are distributed globally in all relevant sales channels. In 2020 the net sales were SEK 5.8 billion. In the last years the division has transformed through important acquisitions. Please read more at www.husqvarnacp.com/se

Background:
Managing variants and variability is a well-known software development challenge [Bosch 2004]. Several approaches exist for handling the technical aspect of variation points. For example, repo, Conan, and Hydra. Variant handling also relates to the notion of reproducible builds. However, no universal approach exists for the broader software engineering task of variant handling, each case in practice has its own unique circumstance.

The objective:
Modularized builds for release- and variant handling.

This thesis project will explore the specific needs for the case of Husqvarna Construction, define which scenarios to solve, and do a prototype implementation.

Possible examples scenarios to consider:
- updating only one component of a product in the field,
- track which component versions a specific product version consists of.

Proper area of education:
Software Engineering

Do you have an idea?
We would like to hear your ideas and thoughts on what type of thesis work would be of interest for both you and Husqvarna.

Location: Jonsered/Partille
Level of thesis: Master
Language: Swedish/English
Number of students: 1-2
Start date: In the beginning of 2023, Q1.

How to apply:
Please send in your application with CV and cover letter no later than November 11th.
Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications by email.

For questions regarding the thesis project please contact:  
Johan Berg, johan.berg@husqvarnagroup.com

Read about Husqvarna Group here:  
https://www.husqvarnagroup.com/

Headline: Thesis work at Software Engineering, Husqvarna Group – Open suggestions
Subject: Design and Product Realisation
Description:
We are now looking for students who study for a master's in software engineering that are interested in doing their thesis project at our Construction Division in Gothenburg.

For more than 325 years we have driven innovation and technological development exceeding end-customers’ expectations. Husqvarna Construction, a division of the Husqvarna Group, is a world leader in machinery and diamond tools for the construction and stone industries. The foundation is built on product and technology leadership ensured by high investment levels in user-focused product development to offer professional end-users the most effective and efficient solutions. Products and services are distributed globally in all relevant sales channels. In 2020 the net sales were SEK 5.8 billion. In the last years the division has transformed through important acquisitions. Please read more at www.husqvarnacp.com/se

Background:
Husqvarna Construction develops construction equipment, including embedded software. The systems are resource-limited, which also constrains the software stack. Resource-limited systems offer possibilities for keeping down both production costs and power consumption. Achieving these benefits may, however, rely on trading convenience during development for increased engineering efforts. For example, operating system features and programming language capabilities may be comparatively limited. Extending the software stack with technologies that can increase development efficacy is thus interesting. For example: use a more capable operating system such as Linux, utilizing Rust or another managed language, and leveraging external libraries such as Boost.

The objective:
Software stack improvements for development efficiency in embedded systems.

Explore the specific needs for the case of Husqvarna Construction, chart available technology improvements, map these to the case, and implement a prototype of promising option.

Software Engineering
