Headline: Master Thesis Project at Modulai
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
1. Deep learning to extract structured information from web pages

Background & Description

Machine learning techniques within natural language processing (NLP) have made significant strides toward interpreting semantic content, especially since the advent of Transformer-based models. Most of the text information available for processing exists on the internet on web pages with a particular structured form. Few NLP techniques to date, however, have taken advantage of this structure despite it often containing relevant semantic information.

This project aims to leverage state-of-the-art NLP techniques to process raw HTML text to extract structured semantic information from web pages in a multilingual context. The project will focus on company web pages and extracting information pertaining to them by modifying existing NLP approaches and understanding the structure particular to web pages. If this approach works, it will make crawling and parsing web pages much more efficient and less reliant on hand-crafted parsing tools that risk removing important semantic information from the pages in question.

ML techniques and tools

NLP
Frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow, or Keras
References

https://arxiv.org/abs/2202.00217
https://arxiv.org/abs/2101.09465


2. Multimodal models for image similarity

Background & Description

It is not always straightforward to say if two images are similar and quantify how similar they are. Often the answer depends on the context and the part of the image which is interesting. If one image shows a horse in the desert and one image shows a horse in a forest, they are similar if we are interested in horses but dissimilar if we are interested in landscapes. For a machine learning model, one usually disambiguates this problem by turning it into a supervised learning problem by adding labels. But what if we don’t have labels?

A more and more dominant idea and concept in state-of-the-art computer vision are to do multimodal training, i.e., combining text with images. The CLIP model from Facebook AI, and LIMoE from Google, would be two recent examples of that. In this context, a multimodal model can disambiguate the similarity between two pictures by using the language description of the image. The phrase “A horse” could describe both images in the example above, making it clearer for the model to focus on.

Based on this idea, the thesis will explore multimodal training of joint embedding spaces for image similarity models for specific classes of objects in the wild. The training set contains images of relevant objects together with their description. The goal is to explore how multimodal models can improve categorizing these classes of objects in unseen data.

The thesis student(s) will explore the problem and, during the thesis, develop as good models as possible, evaluating if the combined approach of using text and images help the image similarity models in practice, using zero-shot, few-shot, or using fine-tuning.

ML techniques and tools

Computer Vision
NLP
Frameworks like PyTorch, Tensorflow, or Keras
References

https://aclanthology.org/2021.eacl-main.249/
https://arxiv.org/abs/2207.12033
https://arxiv.org/pdf/2209.01667.pdf

Apply through our Teamtailor page:
https://modulai.teamtailor.com/jobs/2110369-master-thesis-project-2023

Headline: Robot navigation, servo motors, kinematics or real time network - Emoco Labs
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Emoco Labs is looking for engineering students who study a bachelor or a master within electrical engineering, computer science or similar that are interested in doing their thesis project at our automation lab.

Emoco is an automation solution provider. We assist people, companies and organizations in the automation transformation.
Emoco delivers ROS2 (Robot OS framework) enabled hardware and software, from components to complete functions. Applications running on local servers managed from the cloud.

The thesis project shall focus on robot navigation, servo motors, kinematics, real time network or security.
Examples of thesis subjects:
- Use SLAM to navigate and localize a robot fusing multiple sensors. Evaluate combination of sensors to get better estimates over time such as IMU, RGB-D camera, LiDAR, ToF sensors or Sonar.
-  New demand on light weight robots both in mobile and stationary Cobots requires new servo motor technology. Evaluate, calculate and test new possible topologies.
- Time sensitive networks (TSN) enable distributed controls with synchronized clocks down to nano second resolution. Evaluate and analyze a system of distributed nodes that are synchronized with the standards that TSN offers.

Suitable skills and education:
We are searching for you who are studying robotics, electrical, mechatronics on bachelor or master level.
Experience working with python and ROS2 is advantageous.

Do you have an idea?
We would love to hear your ideas and thoughts on what type of thesis work would be of interest for both you and Emoco. We are open for two students working jointly on a common thesis as well as one student working alone.

How to apply:
Please send in your application with CV and cover letter no later than November 11th.

Start date of the thesis project is flexible.

For questions regarding the thesis project please contact: exjobb@emoco.com.

Read about us here: https://emoco.com

Headline: Master thesis: Developing measurement techniques for EMC in marine environments
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Opportunity to complete a master thesis in developing measurement
techniques for EMC in marine environments.

Roxtec develops, manufactures and delivers flexible sealing solutions for cable and pipe penetrations. Roxtec modular-based transits are used in numerous demanding industries and projects worldwide as the seals provide certified protection against multiple risks, including fire, gas and water.

As an add-on feature, Roxtec has products designed to protect against electromagnetic threats such as EMP and HEMP. Roxtec has invested in a large electromagnetic laboratory at the headquarters in Karlskrona where we continue to develop our product offer. We are now ready to take the next step and examine the possibility to verify the electromagnetic performance in the field, typically marine environments.

We are therefore looking for students who can help us explore measurement techniques that can be applied. The thesis research includes both conducted and radiated measurement techniques, H- and E-field, and the benefits or limitations of these methods such as standing waves, resonance frequencies and reflections. The overall work aims to find a method where combined techniques are used to locate and remedy any installation errors and verify the electromagnetic shielding performance.

The work is preferably, and at least partly, carried out on site in Karlskrona, where the laboratory equipment is available. The work is aimed for one or two students.

Headline: Business models around secure Federated Analytics of sensitive industrial process data
Subject: Industrial Management
Description:
High level description
The large amount of data gathered from the connected BioTech machines could potentially be used collaboratively among the companies to form a shared pool of data for RnD. However, this type of data is highly sensitive – both in terms of company trade secrets as well as compliance relating to patient health records.

A new development in homomorphic encryption – the ability to statistically analyze data remotely without leaking its content – could potentially challenge the historically protectionist stance. What if these companies can overcome their collaboration concerns and benefit each other without risking leaking sensitive data?

Project Description
This master thesis builds on top of existing cutting-edge theoretical research into secure data collaboration. In essence: What new business models and opportunities arise in the BioTech markets if Federated Analytics via Multiparty Homomorphic Encryption (FAMHE) research successfully removes data collaboration concerns between the existing industrial giants and governments?

Study the cutting-edge FAMHE field and its possible impacts on future secure data collaboration. What actors could benefit through large-scale healthcare/medicinal studies? Can the big industrial parties benefit each other’s RnD? Is there a new market for a purely AI-driven BioTech company?

Who are we looking for?
Master of Science (M.Sc.) in Industrial Economy student(s) with practical experience & interest in exploring business models in never-before-seen areas currently being created via digital transformations.

References
Truly privacy-preserving federated analytics for precision medicine with multiparty homomorphic encryption, Nature Communications, https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-25972-y

Headline: Secure In-Browser Key Management for Distributed Cryptographic Applications
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Modern secure applications are beginning to step away from password-based authentication and instead utilize cryptographic keys and certificates to securely identify users. Consumer laptops and smartphones have, in recent years, become capable of locking such cryptographic material into dedicated hardware modules protected by using biometrics. This enables previously centralized security operations to be architected out onto client devices instead.

High level description
As an example, Digital Identity attributes have historically been stored & accessed centrally in an Identity Provider service. However, the centralized locality of user information has been an issue when it comes to the digitalization of state/EU-level services since many countries require sovereignty on a smaller scale.

Could secure hardware-based cryptographic operations on client devices be used to design a sovereign identity system architecture?

Project Description
Evaluate technology alternatives and trade-offs for enabling cryptographic operations in web browser applications. Implement a Web Authentication-based envelope encryption proof-of-concept (POC) application to allow for in-browser hardware-managed cryptographic keys protected by end-user biometrics.

Who are we looking for?
Bachelor/Master of Science (B/M.Sc.) in Computer Science/Engineering student(s) with practical experience in frontend development and an interest in Security and Cryptography.

Purpose and scope
Get acquainted with WebAuthN and similar cryptographic standards now part of modern browsers. Design and develop a PoC client-server application that allows the web application to decrypt/encrypt data locally through a key (in)directly derived to a key managed by the platform’s Hardware Security Module, e.g., through envelope encryption in collaboration with the server.

Headline: Will PWAs kill the native app market?
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Progressive Web Apps (PWA) is a way of developing a web-based mobile application that can be as efficient and fast as a native application. One of the major benefits of PWAs is their easy use, as the application is run in the browser.
This thesis investigates how a PWA would stand against a native application in speed, security, and time of development.

Project Description
In this thesis, design and implement one Progressive Web App and one native app which has the same functionality and then evaluate the challenges and benefits of the two.

Who are we looking for?
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science/Engineering

Purpose
In this thesis, investigate these questions:

- How much time does it take to develop a Progressive Web App versus a Native application?
- Can a Progressive Web App be faster and more secure than a Native app?
- What can a Native app do that a Progressive Web App cannot?
- Will we still have the need for an app store in ten years?

Progressive Web Apps (PWA) is a way of developing a web-based mobile application that can be as efficient and fast as a native application. One of the major benefits of PWAs is their easy use, as the application is run in the browser.
This thesis investigates how a PWA would stand against a native application in speed, security, and time of development.

Headline: Pressure ulcers with Artificial Intelligence
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
The field of Artificial Intelligence (AI) has increased extensively during the last decade. Several ongoing projects already utilize the power of AI to solve different problems. However, computational calculations bring additional cost since it often needs a lot of data in order to train the networks, which requires a powerful GPU. Thus, it is interesting to investigate how networks can be optimized.

High level description
AI within healthcare is a topic that is increasing. Pressure ulcers are common problems for older people who are hospitalized. This problem is also common at home. A pressure ulcer is caused by sustained pressure being placed on a particular part of the body. This pressure interrupts the blood supply to the affected area of the skin.

Therefore, it would be of interest to investigate and implement a neural network or a machine learning algorithm that could decide if or when a pressure ulcer is occurring. You will also investigate how you can generate a dataset that can be used for your algorithms. For instance, body temperature, current time, age, gender, length, and weight are only examples of features that can be used in order to generate a dataset. It is up to you which features you decide to use. It is also up to you what kind of AI method you choose.

Project Description
Investigate and implement a suitable solution that can predict if or when a pressure ulcer occurs. You need to evaluate algorithms and networks and provide the accuracy of the different models. How often do they make correct decisions? An interesting topic would also be to investigate the minimum size of training data to get the desired result.

Who are we looking for?
We are looking for someone interested in and knowledgeable of AI and machine learning technologies. This work is suitable for those of you who are studying computer engineering or equivalent at the bachelor's or master's level.

Purpose
The aim of this project is to investigate and implement suitable machine and deep learning technologies in order to predict if or when pressure ulcers occur. More information will be given during the interviews.

Headline: Comparing NFT (Non-fungible token) to other watermarking techniques
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Non-Fungible tokens, or NFTs for short, are a way to utilize a blockchain to verify the ownership of a piece of digital media. This thesis further investigates what NFTs are and how these can be utilized in comparison with more traditional ways of stating ownership online.

Project Description

Non-Fungible tokens, or NFTs for short, are a way to utilize a blockchain to verify the ownership of a piece of digital media. This thesis further investigates what NFTs are and how these can be utilized in comparison with more traditional ways of stating ownership online. The NFT with blockchain technology to further describes the possibilities of blockchains, more than only currency. In this thesis, design and create an NFT with blockchain technology and investigate how this can be compared with traditional ways of showing ownership of online media.

Who are we looking for?
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science/Engineering

Purpose
This thesis investigates these questions:

• How can an NFT-tagged art piece be implemented?
• How does the NFT technique compare to other water markings?
• What are the pros and cons of NFT


Non-Fungible tokens, or NFTs for short, are a way to utilize a blockchain to verify the ownership of a piece of digital media. This thesis further investigates what NFTs are and how these can be utilized in comparison with more traditional ways of stating ownership online.

Headline: Identity broking for Single Sign On authentication
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Identity broking is a way to isolate authentication to a service that can be configured in runtime instead of merging multiple authentications flows into the application configuration at build.
This thesis investigates how an identity broker can be implemented to make the configuration of single sign-on authentications in runtime easy and secure.

Project Description
Identity broking is a way to isolate authentication to a service that can be configured in runtime instead of merging multiple authentications flows into the application configuration at build.
This thesis investigates how an identity broker can be implemented to make the configuration of single sign-on authentications in runtime easy and secure.
In this thesis, design and implement an identity broker which can be used to configure multiple single sign-on authentications at runtime and evaluate the challenges and benefits versus doing the configuration merged to the application.

Who are we looking for?
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science/Engineering

Purpose
This thesis investigates these questions:

• How can an identity broker be implemented?
• Are there any security issues with moving the authentication to an identity broker?
• What are the pros and cons of isolating the authentication to an identity broker instead of, e.g.,using apache virtual host configuration for single sign-on implementation?

Headline: Federated analytics of BioTech process data – anonymized via homomorphic encryption
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Research, development, and manufacturing of medicine – including mRNA-based vaccines and personalized cell therapies – is becoming increasingly data-driven. The practical processes of cell growth, protein extraction, and chemical analyses take place daily at an industrial scale across many thousands of laboratories in hundreds of BioTech companies around the world.

High level description
The large amount of data gathered from the connected BioTech machines could potentially be used collaboratively among the companies to form a shared pool of data for RnD. However, this type of data is highly sensitive – both in terms of company trade secrets as well as relating to patient health records. Can these companies overcome these issues by building upon cryptographically proven secure and anonymized Federated Analytics via Multipart Homomorphic Encryption (FAMHE)?

Project Description
This master thesis builds on top of existing cutting-edge theoretical research into secure data collaboration. In essence: Applying FAMHE research conclusions on the field of cell-growth & protein manufacturing optimization.

Who are we looking for?
Two Master of Science (M.Sc.) in Computer Science/Engineering students with practical experience in cryptography, proof-of-concept full-stack software development, and statistics/ML.

Purpose and scope
Study and select relevant parts of the cutting-edge FAMHE field. Analyze the practical requirements/structure/limitations of the field of cell growth and protein manufacturing. Design and implement an application that connects to a data store and enables Federated Analytics to an ecosystem of BioTech companies – enabling them to collaborate securely over an anonymized decentralized pool of RnD data.

References
Truly privacy-preserving federated analytics for precision medicine with multiparty homomorphic encryption, Nature Communications, https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-021-25972-y

Headline: Evaluating EBSI-Compliant Cryptographic Proof Algorithms
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
EU citizens will, in the future, be able to utilize government services in any of the countries in the EU. To support this requires a shared trust model around digitally verifiable credentials such as identity, corporate mandate, educational diplomas, driving qualification, etc.

High level description
Digital Identity attributes have historically been stored & accessed centrally in an Identity Provider service. However, the centralized locality of user information has been an issue when it comes to the digitalization of state/EU-level services since many countries require sovereignty on a smaller scale.

The EBSI standards suggest a way for citizens to hold their credentials in a digital wallet and only present selected pieces of verifiable information when needed – instead of today's typical action of showing the whole driver's license just to prove you are, e.g., older than 21.

Project Description
Analyze alternatives for cryptographic proofs that conform to the requirements of EBSI – allowing a natural person to share computed information while maintaining the recipient’s ability to verify cryptographically that your claims are derived from claims issued by the correct authority.

Implement the top candidate proof algorithms and evaluate their performance impact on handling and sharing between simple devices – such as compute efficiency and storage size of the proofs.

Who are we looking for?
Bachelor/Master of Science (B/M.Sc.) in Computer Science/Engineering student(s) with practical experience in explorative development and an interest in Security and Cryptography.

Purpose and scope
Get acquainted with cryptographic proof algorithms. Based on currently available research and reference implementations, select the top candidates compatible with the EBSI use case. Implement and evaluate their performance.

Can these proofs be computed and/or verified on a low-end microcontroller? Are these proofs small enough to be shared mobile-to-mobile via a QR code? What are their limitations regarding computing derived credentials while maintaining verifiability?

Headline: Edge computation as enabler for on-site machine-health anomaly detection in sensitive process data
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
In highly regulated industries – such as the manufacturing of medicine or electricity – the distinction between service data and process data is important from a regulatory point of view. Process data, in essence, refers to sensor values (such as temperature), while service data refers to meta-information about, for example, the state and health of machines.

High level description
When developing software for machine health monitoring and maintenance optimization, it is beneficial to limit the inputs to only work with service data. There is, however, a risk of missing machine issues that may only be visible in process data anomalies over time.
This thesis aims at covering the gray zone between process data and service data from a maintenance point of view – using ML-based anomaly detection. Is it possible to teach a machine to report arbitrary health degradation (as anonymous service data) based on local ML anomaly detection in process data?

Project Description
This master thesis aims at exploring Edge Computation (in BioTech laboratories) as an enabler to utilize process data and machine learning to find potential machine issues when/before they happen – without ever leaking sensitive process data outside the confines of the laboratory.

Who are we looking for?
Master of Science (M.Sc.) in Computer Science/Engineering and/or Industrial Economy student(s) with interest in practical machine learning (anomaly detection/prediction), cloud IoT platforms, and industrial optimization.

Purpose and scope
Explore the GxP boundaries of process data flow and usage. Design and develop a machine learning model capable of detecting anomalies in arbitrary numerical process data. Explore business models around predictive maintenance and industrial optimization with the assumption that on-site black-boxed ML models can react to sensitive process data to produce anonymized service data.

Headline: Deepfake image processing in live video streaming
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Deepfake image processing is a way to create an image or video where the person in the video can be edited to look like someone else with the help of machine learning. This thesis further investigates if deepfake image processing can be implemented and used to forge a live video stream, e.g., a conference call.
In today's environment where remote-first is the go-to for meetings, could this technique be used to impersonate a person in a conference call?

Project Description
Deepfake image processing is a way to create an image or video where the person in the video can be edited to look like someone else with the help of machine learning. This thesis further investigates if deepfake image processing can be implemented and used to forge a live video stream, e.g., a conference call.
In today's environment where remote-first is the go-to for meetings, could this technique be used to impersonate a person in a conference call?
In this thesis, design and create a live video streaming solution in which deepfake processing occurs and evaluate the possibility and to what extent the technology can be used to impersonate another person.

Who are we looking for?
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science/Engineering

Purpose
In this thesis, investigates these questions:

- How can a forged video stream be implemented with deepfake?
- To what extent can the solution be used to impersonate other users?
- What are the ethical issues with the technology?
- What are the cybersecurity aspects of the technology?

Headline: Comparing the New Generation of RPC Libraries
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Microservice architecture is a common application architecture in today's cloud-based hosting. It can consist of multiple small services, from anything between 10s to 100s of smaller applications. Building internal communication between the different services in a cluster of services can be quite cumbersome because of the amount of boilerplate and code duplication that it entails. Which can also be hard to maintain or time-consuming. One way of avoiding writing boilerplate code is to use an RPC library for inter-service communication, which promises faster development cycles, higher throughput, and more stable communication because they leverage a newer version of HTTP protocol compared to its counterparts.

Project Description
RPC: Remote Procedure Call is one of the ways applications can communicate with each other outside their address space. The new generation of RPC is often targeted for communication via a network with serialized data and client and server stub generation. There are several implementations of RPC libraries that offer a different set of features and performance, but they also come with their trade-offs and backward compatibility issues.

Who are we looking for?
Bachelor in Software Engineering.

Purpose and scope
Compare a selected range of RPC libraries, like DRPC, gRPC, and other new RPC libraries you can find.

- Performance: serializing and deserializing objects (memory, network throughput, and CPU usage)
- Security: Are there any security flaws in certain RPC libraries, how do we mitigate them?
- Compatibility: What language platforms do they support (Java, Golang, NodeJS ...)?
- Backward Compatibility: How do they handle changes in the models, and what pitfalls do they have
- Avoiding breaking changes in the different RPC frameworks/libraries?
- Usability: How easy/hard are they to use?
- Features: What different features do the different libraries offer.

Headline: Charging infrastructure with Artificial Intelligence
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Electric vehicles are an important part of reducing carbon dioxide emissions, and the use of electrical vehicles is constantly increasing. However, there is a fear of running out of battery before reaching your final destination, which may contribute to choosing a vehicle with a different fuel type. To encourage people to buy and use electric vehicles, the ability to charge must be within reach and available when the need arises. Can machine learning be used to find out where the need for electric charging stations is greatest?

Project Description
Investigate and implement a suitable solution to predict where it is most appropriate to place electric charging stations based on traffic density. You need to evaluate algorithms and networks to find out which model is best suited for real-time traffic flows. An interesting topic would also be to predict how much capacity the charging stations need during different hours of the day.

Who are we looking for?
We are looking for someone interested in and knowledgeable of AI and machine learning technologies. This work is suitable for those of you who are studying computer engineering or equivalent at the bachelor's or master's level.

Purpose
The aim of this project is to investigate and implement suitable machine and deep learning technologies in order to find out where the need for electric charging stations is greatest.

Headline: Browser VS almost native VS native cryptography
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Using end-to-end encryption, where the data is encrypted on the device before being sent to the server, would ensure that no matter where my data ends up, only the intended audience may read the data. This requires a convenient way of encrypting the data in such a way that anyone can be the target audience, eg, RSA public key encryption.

High level description
This thesis aims to investigate if and how to make on-device cryptography efficient when dealing with a set of individually encrypted data in the context of: browser, almost native (eg, React Native), and native.
Who are we looking for?
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science/Engineering

Project description
Assume a set of data < 10 000 entries, each individually encrypted. Each entry has an overhead of a signature to trace where the data originates from.

Investigate and implement encryption and decryption in: browser, almost native and native on a modern IOS or Android unit and evaluate the applications on minimum performance and time.

Purpose
In this thesis investigates these questions:

•Is any of the approaches suitable for an end-user environment where especially response time is crucial?
•Are there any security implications to consider in the different approaches?
• Is some cryptographic algorithm better suited for the use case?
• Is it possible, securely, to make the data intentionally short-lived to cut down on key sizes and increase performance? Is the gain justifiable to sacrifice security?

Headline: Bicycle priority
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
The bicycle is one of the cleanest and most healthy modes of transportation that we have at our disposal. So why are people in big cities not biking more?

High level description
One way of motivating people is to make it easier for cyclists to get from A to B by using the built-in countdown functionality in the traffic lights and broadcasting it to cyclists in the area. The information on the time remaining until the traffic light switches from, for example, red to green can be shown on a wearable device such as an Apple watch. This way, the bicyclist can time his/her ride better.

The position of cyclists can also be broadcast to traffic control which then automatically can adjust the traffic plan in the traffic light to favor cyclists, i.e., create a green wave for cyclists. This could also be used to give the bicyclist perks such as “rain coins,” which can be traded for bus tickets on rainy days or other rewards.

Project Description
Investigate and implement a suitable solution for a prototype that should be tested in an environment as close to reality as possible, i.e., building and testing different ways of communicating with bicyclists, which could be through display, audio, vibration, or a combination of them.

Who are we looking for?
We are looking for someone with interest in creating and investigating HMI and cycling as the work requires some figuring out on how to best communicate with the cyclists during the bicycle ride. This work is suitable for you who are studying computer engineering or equivalent at the bachelor or master level.

Purpose
The aim of this project is to find a solution that could motivate people to take a bike to work instead of a car.

Headline: Autonomous driving in real-time
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
What is an autonomous car? By definition, an autonomous car is a vehicle capable of sensing its environment and operating without human involvement.

High level description
Current discourse argues that utilizing Artificial Intelligence (AI) for decision-making in navigating the car comes with several benefits. It eliminates driving affected by external factors, such as aggressiveness, tiredness, alcohol, and a lot more. There are various techniques utilized to achieve self-driving capabilities. Large datasets from image recognition systems, along with machine learning and neural network technologies, are used by developers in order to solve the self-driving problem. However, with large datasets come high costs as this requires higher computation power. Thus, there is an interest in finding and optimizing networks that can be run on less expensive computers.

Project Description
Investigate and implement a suitable solution for a prototype vehicle to acquire self-driving skills. It would be of interest if you could investigate and use reinforcement learning. You need to evaluate algorithms and networks and provide the accuracy of the different models. How often do they make correct decisions?

Who are we looking for?
We are looking for someone with an interest and knowledge in AI and machine learning technologies. This work is suitable for those of you who are studying computer engineering or equivalent at the bachelor's or master's level.

Purpose
The aim of this project is to investigate and implement suitable machine and deep learning technologies in order to make a prototype vehicle acquire self-driving skills. More information will be given during the interview.

Headline: Automated Time-Orthogonal Feature Extraction
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Machine Learning has proven to be a very useful tool in many data-heavy industries – but training a model is only viable if the data quality and shape are good enough in relation to the amount of data and computation available. Cleaning and reshaping data are thus important steps in a data pipeline, which essentially uses domain knowledge to minify search space and aid learning.

High level description
Feature Extraction is a form of data reshaping where existing data columns are transformed into more informative and non-redundant features. But such transformations and aggregations are usually done along the time-axis in time series data – between columns – without looking for global batch-level features orthogonal to the time dimension.

Project Description
Analyze possible ways to find global batch-level features by comparing multiple similar batches of time series data stream collections. Design and implement an algorithm to automatically analyze and extract batch-level features from new batches based on historical feature extraction training. Evaluate batch-level prediction performance in comparison to existing full-dataset predictions.

Who are we looking for?
Master of Science (M.Sc.) student with an interest in: implementing data processing/analytics applications; and/or training and analyzing large-attention-span Machine Learning models.

Purpose and scope
Feature Extraction is, in many cases, a manual endeavor, both in terms of guessing what to extract as well as implementing the specific extraction. This thesis aims to analyze the current state of batch-level global feature extraction as well as investigate how, e.g., data analytics tools, or new large-attention-span ML techniques, can aid in time series feature extraction for new industries.

Headline: Image and Video Compression
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
While image and video feeds are becoming essential to everyday technology, i.e., training AI models, video streaming services, displaying images in mobile apps or websites, educational purposes, and the list goes on.

High level description
Though images provide numerous benefits to humanity, they also produce issues of their own. If one would sum the number of resources spent on transferring, compressing, or decompressing images. One would not only be surprised at the amount of energy in terms of wattage used to display images or train machine learning models; but shocked at the amount of power that is allocated to decompress, compress or send image data through the wire.

Project Description
Explore several popular images or video formats and what can be done to reduce the size or compression/decompression performance of the image. There are plenty of unexplored options in plenty of popular compression algorithms or even unnecessary data that is stored in the image (which can be removed or improved).

There's also the possibility of exploring the usage of AI to generate models trained for compressing images and how they perform compared to current compression algorithms.

Who are we looking for?
Bachelor in Software Engineering or Master in Computer Science/Engineering related field.

Purpose and scope
Bachelor level:
- Either create or approve existing compression algorithms.
- Explore what chunks of data can be removed from existing image formats.
- Measure performance metrics in said cases and compare them to the prior art.

Master level:
- Explore state-of-the-art machine learning in relevant fields.
- Generate a machine learning model that compresses images using state of the art.
- Measure performance and summarize the state-of-the-art in relevant fields.

Headline: Master Thesis 30HP - AI Dataset Drift Detection (Unfilled)
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Master Thesis 30HP – Dataset Drift & Dataset Poisoning Detection for Machine Learning Applications in Radar Warner Receivers

Background
Saab Electronic Warfare and Aircraft Systems (EWAS) develop a wide range of systems, including passive receivers of radar signals such as Radar Warning Receivers (RWR). An RWR is responsible for detecting active radars and signaling when anything dangerous is approaching the aircraft.

An RWR can be operational for decades. During the lifecycle the signal environment will likely change, which the system must adapt to in order to stay relevant. An AI/ML-based function in an RWR will thus likely need to be updated on a regular basis, as new data is recorded.

An AI/ML-based function depends mainly on two factors: the software for training and running inference, and the dataset that the model is trained on. As the training and validation dataset grows over time, ideally the performance on the old validation dataset should be maintained or improved, while performance on new validation datasets should also be sufficient.

You will belong to the department Future Technology, which is a very competent and cross-functional team. We work with additive manufacturing (AM), machine learning (AI /ML), Business Intelligence (BI) etc. which creates a very innovative work environment.

Description of the master thesis
Your task in this master thesis will be to investigate methods related to any of the following topics, in the context of an AI/ML-model in an RWR:

Dataset poisoning: A malicious actor could emit carefully designed signals, which if introduced into the training dataset, could increase the error rate in an AI/ML model.
Dataset drift: Significant change in emitter behavior could increase the error rate in an AI/ML model, and could indicate that it is time for an update.
Specifically, given a dataset where some samples have labels, and a (potentially unlabeled) dataset which is a candidate for being introduced into the first dataset, define a metric or model that signals when the new dataset contain anomalies, significant drift, or potentially poisonous samples.

The AI/ML-model development will not be of focus in this master thesis, but rather the dataset lifecycle: How should new (potentially unlabeled) data be incorporated into the training and validation dataset?

Your profile
We are looking for a student who:

Is at the end of his/her master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Applied Physics, Electrical Engineering, or similar.
Has an interest in data science and machine learning.
Has taken courses related to data science, machine learning, deep learning.
Start January 2023, or according to agreement.

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.

What you will be a part of
Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 18,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer, more sustainable and more equitable world.

Business area Surveillance offers world-leading sensor technology in monitoring and decision support to protect against threats. The portfolio covers airborne, ground-based and naval radar, electronic warfare, C4I solutions, aviation systems and cyber security.

Last application date: 2022-12-15

Contact

Eric Norgren: eric.norgren@saabgroup.com

Alexander Karlsson: alexander.karlsson1@saabgroup.com

If you aspire to help create and innovate whilst developing yourself in a learning culture, Saab may well have the perfect conditions for you to grow. We pride ourselves on a nurturing environment, where everyone is different yet we share the same goal – to keep people and society safe.

Headline: Master Thesis 30HP - Analysis of product development within Engineering-To-Order
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Job Description
Background
Product development within the aerospace and defence industry is pushing the boundaries of new technology, forcing companies to adapt quickly or risk becoming outcompeted. Time to market is of strategic interest and combined with state of the art engineering tools our current ways of working have to be challenged.

Most of Saab’s business can be said to revolve around Engineering-To-Order (ETO), where innovation and complex technical components are tailored to highly specialized customer needs. Analyzing how other parts of Saab and how other companies approach an ETO way of working, identifying potential challenges and opportunities, serve as valuable input for the ongoing process development initiatives at Saab Surveillance in Järfälla. The master’s thesis would focus from the point of view of a business unit within Saab.

You will conduct the thesis at the department Future Technology, which is a very competent and cross-functional engineering team. We work with additive manufacturing (AM), machine learning (AI /ML), Business Intelligence (BI) etc. which creates a very innovative work environment.

Project description
Define current state by data/information gathering and benchmark regarding best practice of development processes, methods and ways of working around ETO.
Perform gap analysis with suggestions and improvements where we are strong, and where we have the greatest improvements possibilities.
Your profile
We believe this project will fit anyone interested technology development and improvement work. You shall perform a master’s thesis (30 credits) as you are ending your engineering or master’s degree. Knowledge within project management, software development, hardware development and system of systems are all beneficial but not required.

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.

Start January 2023, or according to agreement.

What you will be a part of
Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe.

Empowered by its 18,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer, more sustainable and more equitable world.

Business area Surveillance offers world-leading sensor technology in monitoring and decision support to protect against threats. The portfolio covers airborne, ground-based and naval radar, electronic warfare, C4I solutions, aviation systems and cyber security.

Last application date: 2022-12-15

Contact

Emil Ljungberg: emil.ljungberg@saabgroup.com

Emil Sandberg: emil.sandberg@saabgroup.com

Saab is a company with a strong people-orientation. We offer a friendly work environment where we support and help each other to be at our best. Continuous learning, career & talent development and employee well-being are examples of areas where we always put the strongest effort to offer great opportunities.

Headline: 30 CREDITS: IMPROVED METHODS FOR ASSESSING LOGISTICS CARBON FOOTPRINT
Subject: Sustainability
Description:
Scania’s science based carbon reduction targets commits the company to reduce carbon emission from both company operations and product use, thus enabling more efficient and sustainable transports. A thesis project with Scania is an excellent opportunity to help us achieve our targets for carbon reduction. It is also a great way of kickstarting your future career!

Background
Transport utilization is a key performance indicator when assessing the efficiency in logistics, and it directly impacts the carbon footprint of the transportation segment. Optimizing the utilization is an important step towards more sustainable transportation and understanding the environmental cost of individual parcels is an important step in incentivizing and enabling that optimization. Consequently, logistics companies face demands to present carbon budgets and calculations, which is a major challenge in multi- drop scenarios.

Goal
The focus of the thesis is to evaluate to what extent existing methods for assessing environmental impact of transports could be improved by increased resolution of carbon footprint analysis in a multi-actor, multi-pickup and drop, logistic network.

Assignment
The thesis should include a study of existing methods of assessing carbon footprint. Further, relevant actors and stakeholders in the logistic chain using these methods should be identified. Based upon interviews with relevant actors and stakeholder, improved data driven methods should be proposed and compared to current methods.

The thesis is proposed as one of two complementary MSc theses, planned to run in parallel, where the other thesis focuses on potential additional metrics to collect to improve the methods.

Education
This project is intended for students in communications, transport and infrastructure, specializing in sustainability and/or data collection, management and analysis.

We are looking for 1-2 students, with a start date early 2023. Applicants will be assessed on a continuous basis until the position is filled. Office in Södertälje, Stockholm, Sweden, remuneration and support with furnished accommodation will be provided.

Contact and supervisor
Magnus Gille, Systems Architect, Connected Systems Platform

Application
Your application should include a CV, a personal letter and grades.

Headline: Mechanical Properties of secondary aluminium alloys
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Background
Primary aluminium often has superior properties compared to secondary aluminium; however, the CO2 foot print of primary aluminium is higher compared to secondary aluminium. Scania has the target to use 100 % secondary aluminium for cast components by 2025 in order to reduce the CO2 footprint. A low level of Cu is found in primary aluminium while higher content of Cu is present in secondary aluminium. This master degree project focus on understanding the impact of different level of Cu and heat treatment on mechanical properties.

Target:
To experimentally determine the mechanical properties (hardness, yield strength, tensile strength and fatigue strength) of the aluminium alloy EN AC 43400, having different contents of copper and heat treatments, and explain the results via microstructural and fractographic investigations along with a literature study.

Assignment, all with the focus on recovery practices:
Running fatigue test and investigated the fracture surface using microscopy
Running heat treatment, (T5 heat treatment) and analyse the result
Correlation between fatigue properties and microstructure will be novelty of the project

Education & organisation:
Material Science/Engineering interested in mechanical testing and microstructural investigations
Knowledge of Microsoft Office
Number of students: 1
Start of work: January 2023 - February 2023
Estimated duration: ~22 weeks incl. 10 holidays, full time 40 h/week
Language of work: English & Swedish
Location of work: Södertälje, Stockholm county, Sweden
Students from outside Greater Stockholm can rent a subsidized Scania apartment in Södertälje
Payment: 20'000 SEK at the start, 20'000 SEK after the final report has been approved by Scania.

Contact persons and supervisors :
Mostafa Payandeh (supervisor ) ph. no.+46700810860

Application :
Please enclose personal letter, CV and the list of grades from the latest M.Sc. studies.
Applications will be collected until 2022-11-11; however, evaluation will be carried out continuously including interviews via teams or telephone.

Headline: 30 credits – Automation and Digitalization - Smart Factory Lab
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Are you interested in working at the forefront of industrial development? Would you like to work on your own projects alongside other engineers in an expanding industry with strong core values?

Ingress and background: 
If you are looking for a dynamic work environment in which to do your thesis, Scania Production System aims to work with continuous improvements of the production system to make it more effective and efficient. Currently, automation, digitalization and the smart factory concept is seen as the fourth industrial revolution.

Scania aspires to be at the forefront of technological advancement and industrial trends and has made several initiatives within the automation and the digitalization area. Where will you be? Global Industrial Development is responsible for developing and maintaining Scania’s common core competence within production engineering. Global Industrial Engineering develops work methods and tools to implement them in the production line.  

Target and assignments: 
Scania’s Global Industrial Development has a Smart Factory Lab Team where new techniques are adapted, evaluated, demonstrated and implemented. Within this area we have a number of possible topic proposals: 

AI for Human Well-Being ( Human Pose Estimation / Motion Capture)
AI for Computer vision (Generate synthetics training data for production/Object detection for quality inspection)
Two autonomous mobile robots exchange material
Modern navigation and planning of mobile robots (with ROS)
AI for improving Energy Consumption and System Performance in Production
We are looking for a number of students to collaborate with us. Do you have another idea? Projects may also be initiated by you, so we welcome suggestions. Please indicate your interest area in the cover letter.

Education: 
Education: Master 
Number of students: 3 pairs of students
Start date: January 2023
Estimated time needed: 20 weeks 

Contact persons: 
David Svensson, 08-553 86114, david.svensson@scania.com

Application:  
Enclose CV, personal letter and school-leaving certificate. 
 
Selections will be made throughout the application period.

Headline: Master Thesis - Using Vision Transformers in Eye Tracking
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Looking for a place to write your thesis? Perfect! We are looking for 1-2 students to help us explore vision transformers in eye tracking.

Transformers is a modern machine learning technique that has been dominating the field of Natural Language Processing (NLP) for some time, and lately, the technique has been gaining traction in the field of Computer Vision as well, with the introduction of Vision Transformers (ViT). The aim of this thesis is to apply ViT to the problem of gaze estimation and compare the performance to that of traditional computer vision methods and machine learning methods.

You will be part of a team of algorithm developers at Tobii working with eye tracking solutions for PC screens and automotive driver monitoring. Images and ground truth data from several eye tracking systems will be provided for training and evaluation of the method. Our group of experienced engineers will help you become accustomed to the data and get you familiar with the field of eye tracking. In addition, you will need to be proactive and become the expert in the domain of Vision Transformers – we will gladly listen and discuss any high-level ideas with you.

Specifically, this project could include:

Train and evaluate a vision transformer network for gaze-estimation
Compare the performance against a CNN-based baseline
Investigate different vision transformer architectures and meta parameters
Investigate data augmentation strategies
Investigate hybrid Transformer/CNN architectures for training and data efficiency
Benchmark the computational footprint (processor and memory usage) on relevant hardware (i.e., desktop and/or edge device) and compare it against the baseline
Investigate compression strategies such as pruning and quantization
We believe that there are many interesting aspects to be investigated and therefore we are looking for up to 2 students for this project.

We are looking for you who:

Are currently pursuing a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, or a related technical field.
Feel confident programming in Python
Have academic experience and interest in Deep Learning and Computer Vision.

It would be beneficial if you:
Are familiar with any Deep Learning framework (PyTorch, TensorFlow etc.)
Have experience working in Unix/Linux environments.
About Tobii

Tobii is the world leader in eye tracking – a computer vision and machine learning based technology that enables a computing device to tell exactly where a person is looking. Eye tracking is used in a broad range of applications including market research and eye-controlled computer interfaces. Headquartered in Stockholm, Tobii covers the global market with offices in the USA, China, Japan, the UK, and South Korea. As our Master Thesis student, you will be working in our Stockholm office.

Next Step
We are curious to know who you are and why you want to do your Master thesis with us. Submit your application through our website including:

CV or LinkedIn profile
Cover letter
Transcripts

Headline: Kan man genom analys av patentlandskap se trender i framtidens kommunikationssystem med bakgrund av hur det ser ut idag?
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Exjobb i teknikens framkant
Läser du ett civilingenjörsprogram inom telekom, elektroteknik, datateknik, informationsteknik eller liknande på KTH, och vill vara med och utforska patent inom området ICT? Då erbjuder vi dig ett intressant, utmanande och självständigt arbete där du är med och stärker landets innovationsförmåga.

Ditt uppdrag
Alla framgångsrika, utvecklande företag har en sak gemensamt - en väl genomarbetad immaterialrättsstrategi. Här kan ett patentlandskap vara ett värdefullt verktyg för företagsledare, investerare och beslutsfattare. En patentlandskapsrapport innehåller en visuell presentation med grafer och tabeller som visar de största och mest betydande aktörerna inom området, ansökningstrender över tid, samarbeten, teknikens utveckling och hur konkurrensen utvecklas.

Målet är att genom analys av patentlandskap inom teknikområden som exempelvis trådlös kommunikation eller radiosystem för 5G och 6G kunna se trender i framtidens kommunikationssystem med bakgrund av hur det ser ut idag.  Patentlandskapet kan också användas för att hitta kritiska punkter i utvecklingsarbetet inom dessa teknikområden.

Du börjar med en introduktionsutbildning till patentsystemet. Utbildningen omfattar databaser, sökverktyg, granskningsmetodik, klassystem och patentjuridik.

När du har bekantat dig med patentsystemet och sökverktygen blir nästa steg att:
- Samla in stora mängder patentdata från relevant teknikområde
- Tvätta data
- Analysera data och dra relevanta slutsatser gällande trender, aktörer, samarbeten, teknikutveckling och hur konkurrensen utvecklas.

Du sammanfattar ditt arbete i en rapport som du presenterar på PRV. Omfattning på uppdraget är 30 högskolepoäng.

Vem är du?
- Du är nyfiken och intresserad av att sätta dig in i ny teknik.
- Du är analytisk och beslutsam och arbetar effektivt och strukturerat för att nå resultat.
- Du har ett flexibelt förhållningssätt och förmåga att prioritera. God samarbetsförmåga är också viktigt.
- Det är mycket viktigt att du är bra på att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska.

Arvode
För att du ska få arvode krävs:
- Att exjobbsrapporten är klar och tillgänglig i sin slutversion.
- Att PRV:s handledare har meddelat via mail att du är klar med ditt uppdrag hos oss, vilket innebär att du har presenterat ditt arbete på PRV.
- Att högskolans handledare har meddelat via mail att du är klar med ditt uppdrag, vilket innebär att du har presenterat ditt arbete på högskolan, och om det ingår även opponerat på någon annans arbete.
- Utdrag ur betygsregistret (PDF i mail) där det framgår att godkänt examensarbete är inrapporterat.

Det här är PRV
PRV är myndigheten för immaterialrätt. Vi jobbar med nya idéer i teknikens och utvecklingens framkant för att stärka tillväxt och konkurrenskraft i Sverige.

Hos oss granskar och registrerar vi patent, design och varumärkesskydd, och hanterar frågor om upphovsrätt. Hos oss arbetar allt från ingenjörer och jurister till IT-arkitekter.

På PRV:s patentavdelning arbetar vi med patentansökningar och uppdrag inom alla teknikområden: elektronik, mekanik och kemi. Enheten för data- och telekommunikationsteknik hanterar patentansökningar inom telekom, såsom hur kontakt mellan noder (basstationer och t.ex. mobiltelefoner) ska etableras, hur information som skickas mellan dessa noder ska paketeras och hur informationen ska skickas mellan noderna.

Hos oss får du trevliga kollegor, bra stämning och fina lokaler i centrala Stockholm.

Vill du veta mer?
På vår webbplats kan du läsa mer om hur det är att arbeta på PRV: http://www.prv.se/jobb .
Allmänna och praktiska frågor om hur det är att arbeta på PRV hänvisar vi i första hand till enhetschef Emma Hedlund, tel. 08-782 2714. Specifika frågor kring uppdraget hänvisar vi till enhetschef Elin Sylvan, tel. 08-782 2535.

Headline: WHEEL LOADER AXLE DESIGN AND VERIFICATION
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
This master thesis is suitable for two students that are completing studies in machine design or similar on MSc level. Knowledge of CAD and FE-method is required. Desired start date is Jan-Feb 2023.
Background
Volvo Construction Equipment, a division of Volvo Group, is one of the world's largest manufacturers of construction equipment such as wheel loaders, haulers, excavators, road machinery, and compact machines. To maintain a leading position, it is important to develop innovative products with high quality and, at the same time, high energy-efficient powertrains.
Volvo CE, as part of the Volvo Group, continuously improve their core products and methods to meet ever increasing demands.
Project Summary
The aim of this project is to explore capability of the CREO CAD software by applying it on a new Axle design.
The main activities are:
Apply design process with CREO instead of CATIA V5 and modify process as needed
Design an axle casing and drive head for a wheel loader replacing an existing design
Verify the design using FE calculations in Ansys

It is suitable for one student working with 3D CAD and one student working with FE analysis in parallel.

A full report in English of the work carried out shall be prepared and presented to staff at Volvo CE. It will be required for the students to perform the thesis at Volvo CE facilities in Eskilstuna.

Headline: Examensarbete, 30 hp: Störningar i logistikkedjor, hur sprids påverkan?
Subject: Sustainability
Description:
I det globala samhället vi lever i idag, med långa lands och kontinentöverskridande förädlingnskedjor, kan en begränsad incident i Asien leda till tomma hyllor i Europa. När Evergiven gick på grund i Suezkanalen ledde det till levernasförseningar över hela världen under lång tid.

Din framtida utmaning

Beskrivning av examensarbetet
Examensarbetet syftar till att utveckla vår kunskap kring logistikkedjor i allmänhet och elektronik i synnerhet.

 Några frågor som vi gärna vill se belysta är:

Vad är typiska störingar för elektronikproduktion, vad är applicerabrt på andra varugruppen?
Hur fort sprids störningar i logistikkedjan?
Var finns de flesta flaskhalsarna?
Är flaskhalsar brancspecifika?
Hur har Coronapandemin påverkat logistikkedjan, finns det skillander före/efter?
Benchmarka andra företag och branscher för att kunna jämföra Saab Dynamics AB med andra företag.
 Vilka metoder finns för att minska risker och vilka metoder skulle kunna införas på Saab Dynamics AB?

I arbetet kommer du att ha mycket kontakter med såväl Saab-medarbetare från flera olika funktioner som leverantörer samt aktörer utanför Saab.

Omfattningen och den slutliga inriktnigen kan anpassas i samråd med er och er handledare från universitetet. Examenarbetet genomförs under ledning av Saab Dynamics inköpsavdelning.

Headline: Master thesis project: Novel MXene (metal-carbide) electrodes for vanadium redox flow batteries
Subject: Chemical Science and Engineering
Description:
Vanadium redox flow batteries (VRFBs) are one of the promising energy storage technologies and compete with lithium-ion batteries for medium and large-scale stationary applications. It has been a couple of years since we developed novel components for VRFBs at the Division of Applied Electrochemistry, KTH. In general, an RFB system converts chemical energy into electrical energy and comprises an electrochemical cell and two tanks filled with liquid electrolytes. A competitive advantage that distinguishes RFBs from other batteries is the independent scale of power and energy. Therefore, the electrodes do not experience failures like phase transformations or morphology changes. Electrodes are one of the critical components in RFB systems that can influence not only the electron transfer rate (kinetics) but also the total resistance and capacity. The most common electrodes in VRFB systems are carbon paper or graphite. Due to the high cost of using catalysts like Platinum, usually, the electrodes are used in bare form. However, it is still feasible to use low-cost metals like Nickel or Titanium as the catalyst on the carbon electrodes.
In the current project, the electrochemical performance of MXene-based electrodes will be investigated. Mxenes, two-dimensional transition metal carbides consisting of low-cost metals combined with carbon, will be provided by the department of mechanical and energy engineering at Indiana University–Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI), USA.
The project includes the characterization of the electrodes using potential sweep and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy techniques. Also, the performance of the VRFB system using MXene electrodes will be studied by considering the system's efficiency, total resistance, and capacity retention.
We are looking for motivated candidates with chemistry or chemical engineering background. Please do not hesitate to contact if you have any questions.

Headline: Master thesis projects VT23 at Mestro
Subject: Energy and Sustainable Development
Description:
1. Using statistical methods to identify renovation needs in properties

Properties/apartments around Sweden are in need of renovations, and it is not improbable that machine learning methods can identify such need. Thus, with energy data and metadata on the property, can renovation needs be identified? This project may be in collaboration with customers.

2. Using statistical methods to identify building functions

Is it possible to identify a customer buildings function from its energy use by employing statistical methods? This project may involve interviews/collaborations.

3. Using statistical methods to optimize energy usage in properties

There is a strongly identified need to save energy to save money and reduce the carbon footprint. Using machine learning methods and analyzing, e.g., electricity, district- heating, and cooling use, and metadata on properties, how can these methods optimize energy use? It is not unlikely to see a combination of the above ideas. E.g., idea one and three.

About Mestro
Spend less energy with Mestro! We empower property owners to solve one of our time’s most important climate issues; how to make properties sustainable. With our cloud-based platform for energy usage management, property owners save time, money, and climate impact as they start to monitor their energy usage and make data-driven decisions.

Our platform collects, connects, analyzes, and visualizes energy data from a wide range of sources - may it be solar power or waste you want to measure? We can do it all. With the final reports and dashboards in the hands of the user, you can calculate CO2 emissions, forecast energy usage, create sustainability reports, set budgets for selected or all properties and share insights via engaging PDF reports.

We bring numbers to life – and give you a cleaner, easier way to access and act on your data. Fully cloud-based, fully automated.

Headline: Feasibility of pelvic floor muscle damage assessment using Shear Wave Elastography
Subject: Medical Engineering
Description:
We are looking for a motivated master’s degree student with a great interest in medical technology development and search to work in a research environment with concrete clinical application. This master’s thesis project would integrate an interesting PhD project on the safety assessment of the vacuum-assisted delivery (VAD) method at KTH in collaboration with KI.


Background:
In VAD, additional assistance is provided to the parturient woman because of complications during the vaginal delivery. VAD uses a vacuum cup placed on the scalp of the fetus with applied negative pressure. The clinician can then apply traction to the handle of the system to pull the fetus out and help the delivery.

VAD is a commonly used technique in clinics worldwide with an incidence reaching 6-8% in Europe, 5% in the USA and 9% in Sweden affecting a significant number of newborns and mothers. However, VAD has a higher prevalence of maternal pelvic floor trauma compared to natural vaginal delivery. The largest muscles of the pelvis are the levator ani muscles which have an important role to stabilize the pelvic organs and maintain urinary and fecal continence. Damage to these muscles during the delivery is often not surgically operable and leads to pelvic floor dysfunction later in life which affects up to 55% of all middle-aged women. Injuries of the levator ani muscles have been largely ignored while they decrease the quality of life of the mother including urinary and fecal incontinence or pelvic organ prolapse into the vagina. A suggested way to assess pelvic floor damage due to delivery is to measure the biomechanical properties of the levator ani muscles, assessing the stiffness and comparing the results before and after the delivery.

Shear wave electrography (SWE) is an innovative ultrasound imaging tool which evaluates soft-tissue elasticity. SWE is currently used in specific applications but deeper studies need to be done to apply this technique to levator ani muscles.


Scope:
The goal of the master’s thesis would be to
- Perform a literature review on studies investigating the dysfunction of pelvic floor muscles (particularly the levator ani muscles) after vaginal delivery.
- Investigate the feasibility of assessing biomechanical properties of the levator ani muscles using SWE.
- Implement a methodology and an experimental setting building a phantom of the levator ani muscles to test the mechanical properties of tissues with SWE.

Validate the assessment method by comparing the SWE measurements with mechanical test results.
Those tasks can be discussed and adapted depending on the student’s interest and the evolution of the project.


The ideal candidate would be a last-year Master’s degree student with some interest in ultrasound imaging and obstetrics, and passionate for the application of physical and mathematical principles in the medical field. A sufficient level of English is required and sufficient background in ultrasound physics and biomechanics is desired.

The project is expected to be run during the spring semester of 2023 with some flexibility.

If you have any questions about this project, you are warmly welcome to contact us!
Estelle Pitti (PhD student): pitti@kth.se
Matilda Larsson (Professor and head of the division of medical imaging): matil@kth.se

Headline: Would you like to work on developing Digital training for operators?

Description:

Background of the task

Our challenge is finding a workforce that possesses the skills we need in production. We aim to develop production skills in new employees that lack experience in the metal working industry. We need innovative and effective methods to train operators.

Headline: Thesis Project 30 credits – Shared Prediction of Vulnerable Road Users in Complex Urban Scenario using V2X Communication for Autonomous Driving
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
A thesis project at Scania is an excellent way of making contacts for your future working life. Many of our current employees started their careers with a thesis project.

Background:
In any complex urban scenario, connected and automated vehicle’s (CAV) sensors i.e. local sensors typically provide a limited understanding of the environment due to the occlusion of parked vehicles, other vehicles moving in the near vicinity, limited sensor range, etc. The objective of this project is to expand and enrich the perception and operation of CAVs by letting them systematically handle perception from local sensors and perception from V2X (vehicle-to-everything) communication.

To ensure that the autonomous vehicle has an understanding of all vulnerable road users’ state and motion prediction, the idea is to adopt deterministic methods to fuse perception from local sensors and perception from V2X communication. This information, in conjunction with the application of traffic rules, can then be used for tactical decision-making and for planning safe and efficient maneuvers.

As a master thesis student, you have the opportunity to interact and learn from engineers working with varies fields of autonomous driving. This project is part of an ongoing Industrial PhD project at Scania in collaboration with Division of Decision and Control Systems, KTH. More information about the Industrial PhD project can be referred in  [1].

Target:
The target is to design a framework that effectively and reliably can predict the set of states that can be occupied by perceived road users and provide safety guarantees. This framework should be able to support decision-making onboard autonomous vehicles.

Assignment:
The assignment is divided into four sub-tasks: 1. To investigate deterministic methods for estimation of road users; 2. To investigate how to combine these estimations and traffic rules to make the prediction more realistic; 3. To design and implement a framework that can be used for such; and 4. Test the work in simulation and/or in real experiments using research and prototype vehicles.

Education:
Master (civilingenjör) in computer science, robotics, engineering physics, electrical engineering, or applied mathematics, preferably with specialization in artificial intelligence algorithms, control theory, optimal control or optimization. Knowledge of programming, predictive modeling, and reinforcement learning are a plus.
Number of students: 1
Start date: January 2023
Estimated time needed: 20 weeks

Contact persons and supervisors:
Vandana Narri, Industrial PhD student in Situational Awareness, vandana.narri@scania.com.
Natalie Richardson, Manager, ATS Research, EARS, natalie.richardson@scania.com.

Application:
Enclose CV, cover letter and transcript of records.

Headline: Thesis project - 30 Credits – Multi-sensor data fusion for lane boundaries detection applied on ADAS
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Thesis project at Scania is an excellent way of making contacts for your future working life. Many of our current employees started their career with a thesis project.

Background:
Today's ADAS functions aims for level 2 autonomy. Typically, the functions act on internally fused tracks from “smart” in vehicle sensors.

Over time changed market demands and updated legislation will result in modified or new requirements on ADAS functions and improved performance is needed. Improving the internal data fusion is a mean to increase the ADAS functions performance.

A way to achieve better performance is to exploit data from additional sensors e.g. map based localization, onboard/offboard vehicles data, this together with new/improved algorithms.

As a student you are encouraged to delve into existing work in the domain, be inspired to experiment with the data and sensor setups to come up with innovative ideas.

Target/Scope:
Design, implement and evaluate a framework with multi-sensor data and algorithms applying data fusion for lane boundaries detection.

Assignment:

Focus will be:

Investigate novel algorithms and new data sources.

Collect data

Design, implement and evaluate in a fusion framework

Education/organisation:
Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Engineering Physics or similar education. Preferably with an interest and background in signal processing and sensor fusion.

Number of students: 1

Start date for the Thesis project: 2023 January

Estimated timescale: 20 weeks excluding public holidays

Contact persons and supervisors:
 Magnus Eriksson, Head of ADAS Sensors & Fusion, +46855389470, magnus_x.eriksson@scania.com
