 Enclose CV, personal letter and copies of grades.


Selections will be made throughout the application period.

Headline: Evaluation of grease formulations for micro-pitting performance using the novel RCF test rig
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Background:
In contacts typical of machine elements such as gear, bearings, and cams where conditions of rolling and sliding are prevalent, surface pitting is considered to be a prevailing failure. Micropitting is surface damage that occurs in high rolling systems due to cyclical contact and the plastic flux of the roughness. Even though micro-pitting as a failure mechanism is widely recognized, its mechanism is still debated in the scientific community. It becomes very important to understand the pitting mechanism, right from crack initiation till eventual material chipping, for different loading and motion conditions, materials, and lubricants.
For this purpose, a test rig for studying the effects of rolling contact fatigue (RCF test rig - Figure 1) has been developed at the System & Component Design division of the department of Machine Design at KTH. The test rig employs a 4- roller arrangement with a central test roller and three counter rollers. The top roller is loaded resulting in equal loading at all three contacts due to geometry (see Figure 2). This generates three loading cycles on the test roller per revolution resulting in accelerated testing of a rather long fatigue process. The outer discs and inner disc are independently controlled which allows for a range of slide-roll ratios and lubricant entrainment velocities. The test rig allows for performing experiments under various conditions. The test rig would be effective in studying the contact fatigue performance for different combinations of surfaces (materials, surface quality, etc.) and lubricants. This is particularly important considering the rapid development of alternate materials like powder metal, printed metal, etc.
Greases, being the most common lubricant material in bearings, form a very important set of lubricants for which extensive knowledge of fatigue failure is needed to possibly enhance the lifespan of bearings, and also for developing techniques for condition monitoring and active maintenance.
The proposed master thesis project deals with the study of micro-pitting performance for various greases, with a spectrum of base oils, thickeners, and additives.

Research question
How does the composition of grease lubricants (base oil, thickener, and additives) affect the micro pitting fatigue life of contacting steel surfaces?

The task
The major tasks would be:
1. Design and development of an add-on system to the RCF test rig, to allow grease testing. This would include the development of a setup for grease application and redistribution.
2. Initial testing would involve an extensive study of outputs from various sensors and correlate the observed occurrences to the different stages of the micro-pitting process. Through this, if possible, a real-time condition monitoring system could be set up for the test specimens, which would help evaluate the status and nature of the damage on the specimen without having to interrupt the test or remove the test specimens. The system should be able to capture the damage process from crack initiation to material removal.
3. Develop a test protocol for the study of greases.
4. Perform micro-pitting study on various grease formulations.

Project owners
• Johan Leckner, Group Technical Manager, Axel Christiernsson International AB
• Prof. Sergei Glavatskih, MMK SKD; segla@kth.se

Number of students: 1-2
Start date: January 2023

Application
Enclose your CV, cover letter, and your transcript of records.

Headline: Examensarbete på Saab Dynamics, 30 hp. Terminalballistiska kollisionsvillkor i stelkroppssimulering
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
Examensarbete för dig som har ett stort intresse för fysikalisk simulering.

Din framtida utmaning
Bakgrund
Explicit fysikalisk simulering av transienta förlopp är en beräkningsmässigt tung uppgift. Bland annat inom terminalballistik blir förloppen ofta extremt snabba och ger stora deformationer, vilket kräver mycket små tidssteg och fina meshar. Därför pågår ständiga arbeten med förenklingar av simuleringsuppställningar. Det finns en uppsjö av empiriska formler för att snabbt kunna beräkna sådana förlopp.

Beskrivning av examensarbetet
Det här examensarbetet skulle handla om att undersöka hur realistiska resultat man kan få genom att använda dem som kollisionsvillkor i stelkroppssimuleringar. Många branscher lägger idag ett stort fokus på snabba fysikaliska beräkningar. Både tillverkande industri, men speciellt spel- och filmbranschen. Inte minst så har Saab ett stort intresse av detta. Det här examensarbetet skulle ge dig en god erfarenhet att för vidare arbete både hos oss eller andra företag.

Den du är idag
Det här examensarbetet passar dig som har ett stort intresse för fysikalisk simulering. Innehållet i examensarbetet anpassas dock baserat på din bakgrund och styrkor så tveka inte att söka om du känner att detta verkar intressant!

Projektet är för dig som ska genomföra ett examensarbete på 30 hp på en civilingenjörs-, eller mastersutbildning. Vi lägger mindre vikt vid inriktning, men erfarenhet krävs inom någon form av fysikalisk simulering samt programmering.

Headline: Examensarbete på Saab Dynamics, 30 hp. Fysikalisk simulering med maskininlärning
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
Examensarbete för dig som har ett stort intresse för fysikalisk simulering och maskininlärning.

Din framtida utmaning
Bakgrund
Explicit fysikalisk simulering av transienta förlopp är en beräkningsmässigt tung uppgift. Speciellt inom explosivämnesmodellering blir förloppen ofta extremt snabba och med stora deformationer, vilket kräver mycket små tidssteg och fina meshar. Därför pågår ständiga arbeten med förenklingar av simuleringsuppställningar. Eftersom många av dessa förenklingar kan leda till mindre realistiska resultat har vi de senaste åren börjat titta på hur maskininlärning kan användas för att ge mer information från en bristfällig simulering.

Beskrivning av examensarbetet
I det här examensarbetet vill vi undersöka hur den senaste tidens genombrott inom "Physically Informed Neural Nets" och olika versioner av Neurala Operatorer kan användas för att göra snabbare simuleringar. Med det här examensarbetet som erfarenhet hamnar du i en mycket bra position för att arbeta med den allra senaste tekniken inom fysikalisk simulering. Intresse för den här sortens teknik finns på ett flertal avdelningar på Saab Dynamics. Oavsett vart du hamnar kommer du ha en unik kunskap som tänjer på gränsen för vad som idag är möjligt att utföra med simulering.      

Den du är idag
Det här examensarbetet passar dig som har ett stort intresse för fysikalisk simulering och maskininlärning. Innehållet i examensarbetet anpassas dock baserat på din bakgrund och styrkor så tveka inte att söka om du känner att detta verkar intressant!

Projektet är för dig som ska genomföra ett examensarbete på 30 hp på en civilingenjörs-, eller masterutbildning. Vi lägger mindre vikt vid inriktning, men erfarenhet krävs inom någon form av fysikalisk simulering, maskininlärning samt programmering i Python. Examensarbetet kan med fördel utföras av flera personer, där varje person då kan fokusera mer på en viss teknik.

Headline: Examensarbete på Saab Dynamics, 30 hp. Design av 3D objekt med generativ maskininlärning
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Examensarbete för dig som har ett stort intresse för maskininlärning, gärna blandat med ett intresse för form och design.

Din framtida utmaning
Bakgrund
Den senaste tidens framsteg inom generativ maskininlärning har lett till att teknik som GAN går att använda inom en stor mängd områden. För Saab Dynamics innebär detta bland en möjlighet att förbättra arbetet med produktdesign. Speciellt har tekniken för hur man beskriver objekt och scener i 3D gjort stora framsteg det senaste året. Mycket tack vare pådrivning från spel- och filmbranschen.

Beskrivning av examensarbetet
Till det här exjobbet behöver vi någon som kan utforska de olika state-of-the-art teknikerna inom representation av 3D objekt. Inriktningen skulle i så fall vara hur man kan använda tekniken för att generera objekt med till exempel VAE eller GAN. Vi ser gärna att arbetet innehåller exempel på hur väl dessa tekniker kan användas för att interpolera mellan existerande objekt, hur väl de kan generalisera, eller generera objekt som uppfyller givna villkor.

Det här arbetet kommer ge dig en erfarenhet som ligger i teknikens absoluta framkant och kommer ge dig värdefull kunskap som idag finns hos ytterst få företag. Du kommer ha en bra erfarenhet för fortsatt arbete inom maskininlärning, design eller datorgrafik. Andra branscher där det finns intresse för liknande teknik sträcker sig mellan allt från arkitektur till datorspel och film.

Den du är idag
Det här examensarbetet passar dig som har ett stort intresse för maskininlärning, gärna blandat med intresse för form och design. Innehållet i examensarbetet anpassas dock baserat på din bakgrund och styrkor så tveka inte att söka om du känner att detta verkar intressant!

Projektet är för dig som ska genomföra ett examensarbete på 30 hp på en civilingenjörs-, eller masterutbildning. Vi lägger mindre vikt vid inriktning, men erfarenhet inom maskininlärning samt programmering i Python krävs. Examensarbetet passar dig som är både analytisk och kreativ.

Examensarbetet kan utföras av en eller flera personer. Dessa kan i så fall fokusera på olika tekniker inom området.

Placeringsort är Karlskoga.

Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.

Headline: Examensarbete på Saab Dynamics, 30 hp. Modellering av upptändningsförlopp i explosivämnen med maskininlärning
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Examensarbete för dig som har ett stort intresse för matematisk modellering.

Din framtida utmaning
Bakgrund
Ett av de svårare problemen med detonativa sprängämnen är att modellera övergången från brand eller svag shock till full detonation. Forskning om detta har pågått i flera decennier. Men det saknas fortfarande en allmän modell med hög tillförlitlighet. Det finns dock vissa empiriska modeller som efter kalibrering ofta kan beskriva vissa väldefinierade scenarier.

Beskrivning av examensarbetet
Det här examensarbetet går ut på att ta fram en modell som bygger på maskininlärning istället för fysikaliska beskrivningar. En möjlighet är också att hitta en medelväg där en maskininlärningsmodell lär sig rätta en empirisk modell i de scenarier där den räknar fel. Det kan också vara möjligt att tekniken Physics Informed Neural Nets eller Fourier Neural Operators gör att man med begränsad data lära modellen räkna rätt. Det här examensarbetet kommer ge dig en kraftfull erfarenhet inom matematisk modellering av ett svårförklarat fysikaliskt fenomen. Oavsett vad du vill göra efter examen så kommer du kunna använda den tekniken du tar fram här till en stor mängd problem som annars är svåra eller omöjliga att lösa.

Den du är idag
Det här examensarbetet passar dig som har ett stort intresse för matematisk modellering. Innehållet i examensarbetet kan anpassas baserat på din bakgrund och dina styrkor så tveka inte att söka om du känner att detta verkar intressant!

Projektet är för dig som ska genomföra ett examensarbete på 30 hp på en civilingenjörs-, eller masterutbildning. Vi lägger mindre vikt vid inriktning, men vi värdesätter kurser och erfarenhet inom numeriska metoder, maskininlärning, fysikalisk simulering, samt programmering i Python.

Examensarbetet kan utföras av en till tre personer.

Placeringsort är Karlskoga.

Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.

Headline: Designing the future ship bridge for captains and nautical officers
Subject: Information and Communication Technology
Description:
Background

Modern ship bridges are complex socio-technical systems involving various roles of operators. To reach their overarching goal of maintaining vessel safety, operators rely on monitoring the surroundings and acting accordingly.

The bridge consists out of various systems that operators use to fulfill their roles. These range from monitoring equipment such as radars and electronic navigation charts, to maneuvering equipment such as levers or specialized equipment for specific purposes. These dynamic contexts put a large emphasis on design to address the challenges that officers face on modern ship bridges.

We are a team of researchers at the ABB research center in Västerås who currently focus on how these challenges can be addressed from a user perspective. We therefore look forward to working closely with you during your thesis.

Research questions

Using the fields study material gathered by us as a foundation to understand the bridge and operators’ task context, the following area is where the thesis can dive deeper:

Ergonomics for improved safety and efficiency. An ergonomic workplace is important for the health of a workforce, safety, and efficiency. A modern bridge does have dedicated working positions but is there any other bridge design concept that can bring improved efficiency and safety in the future? What are the ergonomic and interaction challenges on bridges today and how can we design a future ergonomic bridge system that support the operators’ information gather, processing, decision making in various navigational tasks?

Deliverables

Deliverables can come in different forms but are encouraged to include some form of representation of a future bridge by for example having a 3D prototype (preferred), VR/AR demos, a video, or renders showcasing the final design. In addition to this, learnings from your own work in the form of recommendations, guidelines or considerations will not only be beneficial for yourself and your thesis, but also for us at ABB.

Headline: Augmented surveyor as an interactive solution for safe and efficient surveying
Subject: Information and Communication Technology
Description:
In oil and gas fields there is always a risk of leakage. Surveyors are responsible to scan the area and detect potential leakage locations. To avoid severe accidents surveyor’s need to be efficient in their tasks. It demands a lot of mental effort from surveyors to maintain a safe environment and prevent from any leakage accidents.

Augmented technologies are being used in many different industries to improve efficiency, safety and upskilling worker’s abilities. We at ABB CRC Västerås, are interested to understand how and in what way augmented technology can be used for surveyors to improve their efficiency of work and lessen the mental workload.

RESEARCH QUESTION

Safe and efficient surveying: As the surveyor moves around in rough terrain aspects of safety, mental workload and efficient AR interface need to be researched and carefully designed to reach high performance HMI within industrial context. The candidate would have possibility to join project starting beginning of  2023 and focus on one or several research areas concerning:

Which AR devices are suitable for the outdoor surveying tasks?

Research and understand surveyors´ s context, user needs, challenges, requirements, and tasks with more. Analyze and utilize research insight to create novel user experiences in AR technologies. Most likely possibility for field studies will be available.

How should information be visualized and interacted with to ensure safety in rough terrain, information gathering, optimal workflow and smoots interaction utilizing AR technologies.

Validate design proposals with HCI or human factor perspective, for example measuring aspect of mental workload, user flow, usability, or safety.

DELIVERABLES

Deliverables can be vary depending on either Human Factors, HCI or Computer science background. Examples of desirable deliverable are; Research methods for AR to harvest inputs (needs, requirements), personas, user experience maps, AR demos / prototypes (coded is desirable), Interaction flows, Validation methods for AR technologies. Learnings from your work in form of recommendations or guidelines will also be beneficial for your Master’s thesis and for ABB.

Headline: Master thesis project: Electrolyte recycling processes for vanadium redox flow batteries
Subject: Chemical Science and Engineering
Description:
Integrating sustainable renewable energies with electrochemical energy storage systems is a promising solution to transforming into a climate-neutral economy. Furthermore, the transition from a linear to a circular economy will significantly impact achieving further sustainability in the energy storage field. Among electrochemical devices, redox flow batteries (RFBs) are promising technologies for renewable energy storage through integration with solar cells. Despite lithium-ion batteries, electrodes and electrolytes are stored separately in RFB systems and therefore, the power and energy can be scaled independently. Thus, the electrodes do not experience failures like phase transformations or morphology changes. The most studied, mature and commercially available RFB is the all-vanadium redox flow battery (VRFB), a liquid-based RFB developed in the 1980s and employs vanadium in different oxidation states at both half-cells.
The VRFB has the advantage of using the same element on both sides, which avoids the cross-contamination of the electrolytes. Little attention has been paid to recycling RFB in the last ten years. Recycling the electrolytes will decrease the environmental footprint, and critical and strategic resources can be recovered and reused. Furthermore, the high shipping costs of end-of-life vanadium electrolytes is a challenge. If the vanadium could be precipitated at sight and then shipped as a solid or be directly re-used, the costs would be significantly reduced.
The most common methods for recycling metal-based electrolytes are precipitation and solvent extraction. It is advantageous to use precipitation to recover electrolyte materials because it is generally a low-energy and low-cost process. Solvent extraction can also be applied to extract and purify vanadium prior to precipitation. The project is a collaboration between the Division of Applied Electrochemistry and the Division of Recovery in the department of chemical engineering.
The project is an experimental work and the candidate will investigate the methods mentioned above or maybe other methods based on the literature review. You are very welcome to apply for this project if you have a chemistry or chemical engineering background.

Headline: Optimization of comfort-related energy of Stockholm commuter trains (in collaboration with MTR)
Subject: Energy and Sustainable Development
Description:
Background
The commuter trains are one important part of public transport for both residents and travellers, which provides a cheap and time-efficient means of transport and helps to ease congestion and pollution in urban area. Even though the commuter trains are very energy-efficient and runs on green electricity, it is still consuming a great amount of energy in operation, which is mainly used by traction and comfort-related systems. With the implementation of modern trains, much information during train operation can be recorded for analysis. To meet a goal of 15% of electricity reduction for rail traffic and minimize the operational cost for the train operator, a research project on finding solutions for a more sustainable transport (financed by Vinnova InfraSweden2030) is conducted to set up a smart and cost-effective management plan for energy saving.

Scope
The objective of the master thesis focuses on the comfort-related energy of the Stockholm commuter train X60. There are many functions or systems which can be optimized, e.g.,  passenger-controlled door opening, demand-controlled ventilation, re-setting indoor temperature and thermal insulation of doors and walls, to reduce the total energy usage and ease the burden on the power supply of the infrastructure. Some of them have been implemented and recorded. Others have been proposed and are now under consideration.
In the present master thesis, a literature study on energy saving of comfort functions or systems of different means of transport will be conducted (with a focus on thermal issues). Based on the recorded sensor data and previous reports, the potential for energy saving will be analyzed and quantified. If necessary some fluid dynamic simulations can be performed to assist the study. In the end, some proposals for energy saving of the commuter train in daily operation will be given.

Tasks
The thesis work will consist of the following tasks:
• Literature study of:
- Comfort of passengers on the thermal aspect,
- Comfort-related functions or systems of passenger trains,
- Means of energy saving of comfort-related functions,
- Previous reports on this aspect
• Documentation of sensor data related to comfort energy.
• Analyzing the energy saving of different measures.
• Quantifying the potential of energy saving (simulation if necessary).
• Thesis writing and presenting results orally
These tasks might be updated while working on the project.

Contact:
KTH Zhendong Liu(zhendong@kth.se), Mats Berg(mabe@kth.se)
MTR Gerasimos Loutos(gerasimos.loutos@mtr.se), Joel Forsberg(joel.forsberg@mtr.se)
TF    Erik Dunkars (erik.dunkars@regionstockholm.se)

Headline: Modelling of Heat Transfer of Railway Switch Heating (in collaboration with TRV)
Subject: Energy and Sustainable Development
Description:
Background
Railway switch is a critical component for daily operations of trains by enabling trains to be guided from one track to another. A defective switch can lead to malfunction in the signalling system and can lead to train derailment/collision. In winter, snow/ice can block the movement of the frog point of the switch, which can lead to signalling error, train delays and loss of revenue. Therefore, a dedicated heating system is used to melt down snow/ice in the switch area. Currently, in Sweden there are thousands of switches equipped with electrical heating systems, which consume hundreds of millions of kWh of electricity each winter. It is neither an economical nor energy-efficient way to directly use electricity for heating purposes. It becomes necessary to find out practical solutions to minimize energy consumption while maintaining high system reliability.

Scope
The objective of the master thesis is to take forward the work of [1] and focuses on making an advanced (preferable 3D) CFD model of heat transfer rate from the Rail and to replicate the modeling methodology mentioned in [2]. Also, to further simulate the heat transfer rate by incorporating thermal insulation on Rail to reduce the heat loss.
The candidate is free to chose any CFD software of his/her choice like ANSYS Fluent/CFX/COMSOL/Openfoam. Prior knowledge of working on CFD problems will be an advantage.

Tasks
The thesis work will consist of the following tasks:
• Literature study of:
- Thermal Insulation and ways to adopt it in Rail
• CFD Modeling of heat transfer from Rail
• Comparison of 2D vs 3D simulation results
• Parametric study for heat source temperature & location, insulation thickness & location etc
• Thesis writing and presenting results orally

These tasks might be updated while working on the project.
Contact:
KTH      Zhendong Liu (zhendong@kth.se), Sidharth Kapoor (skapoor@kth.se)
TRV      Kristina Canow (kristina.canow@trafikverket.se)


[1]: Energy Usage in Wayside Object Heating http://urn.kb.se/resolve?urn=urn:nbn:se:kth:diva-317504

[2]: Glusberg 2020, Calculation of heat distribution of electric heating systems for turnouts -
   doi = {10.1007/978-3-030-19756-8_31}   isbn = {9783030197551}

Headline: Optimization of traction energy of Stockholm commuter trains (in collaboration with MTR)
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Background
The commuter trains are one important part of public transport for both residents and travelers, which provide a cheap and time-efficient means of transport and helps to ease congestion and pollution in urban area. Even though the commuter trains are very energy-efficient and runs on green electricity, they are still consuming a great amount of energy in operation, which is mainly used by traction and comfort-related systems. With the implementation of modern trains, much information during train operation can be recorded for analysis. To meet the goal of 15% of electricity reduction for rail traffic and minimize the operational cost for the train operator, a research project on finding solutions for a more sustainable transport (financed by Vinnova InfraSweden2030) is conducted to set up a smart and cost-effective management plan for energy saving.

Scope
The objective of the master thesis focuses on the traction-related energy of the Stockholm commuter train X60. There are many aspects which can be optimized, e.g., driving-style, timetable, train weight and operational points of the traction system, to reduce the total energy consumption and ease the burden on the power supply of the infrastructure. Some of them have been implemented and recorded. Others have been proposed and are now under consideration.
In the present master thesis, a literature study on energy usage of the traction system and the corresponding energy saving measures will be conducted. Based on the recorded sensor data and previous publications, the potential for energy saving will be analyzed and quantified by means of an energy simulation tool for rail vehicles. In the end, some proposals for energy saving of the commuter train in daily operation will be given.

Tasks
The thesis work will consist of the following tasks:
• Literature study of:
- Train traction system of passenger trains (with focus on X60),
- Means of energy saving of traction energy,
- Energy simulation of rail vehicles,
- Previous reports on this aspect
• Documentation of sensor data related to traction energy.
• Analyzing or simulating the energy saving of different measures.
• Quantifying the potential of energy saving.
• Thesis writing and presenting results orally.
These tasks might be updated while working on the project.

Contact:
KTH Zhendong Liu(zhendong@kth.se), Mats Berg(mabe@kth.se)
MTR Gerasimos Loutos(gerasimos.loutos@mtr.se), Joel Forsberg(joel.forsberg@mtr.se)
TF    Erik Dunkars (erik.dunkars@regionstockholm.se)

Headline: 30 hp - Dual sourcing under semiconductor supply disruption
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Thesis projects is a excellent way to get a closer contact with Scania and build relations for the future. Several of todays employees started their Scania career with a Thesis project.

Background
After the last couple of years of supply chain disruptions, we have internally made efforts of dual sourcing of components, and we see similar efforts from our suppliers. A big part of the supply chain issues has been the short supply of semiconductors, which has a shown need for fast evaluation of alternative ASICs and ICs for our components. An important part would be to be able to prove internally and to authorities that the sensor performance remains transparent.

Target/scope
Design a guideline with method for theoretical and practical evaluation of ASICs and ICs.

Description of the assignment
Study differences between electronic properties of ASICs and ICs and how to validate that parts are interchangeable. Find suitable test methods for evaluating and comparing performance of electric components.

The work will begin with a literature study to learn more about important properties of different types of electronic components. Once the theoretical part is done, a specific type of component is selected to perform the testing in order to determine if the methods could be applied in any of Scanias applications.

Education/line/direction
Assign education, line or direction: Electrical engineering or equivalent

Number of students: 1-2
Start date for the Thesis project: Early 2023
Estimated timescale: 20 wks

Contact person and supervisor
Karlotta Weijl, Development Engineer, +46765167370, karlotta.weijl@scania.com
Hanna Isaksson, Development Engineer, +46700814919, hanna.isaksson@scania.com

Application
Your application should contain CV, personal letter and copies of grades

Headline: Cross-chain settlement of blockchain assets
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
An exchange of assets on a blockchain is a secure and trusted way of determining ownership of digital assets. It’s simple to make an exchange of assets when transactions are performed on the same blockchain. However, when the exchange needs to be done between two different chains or a blockchain and a centralized system, a number of challenges arises, and if these even can be made securely. One example could be the exchange between an asset and the payment for that asset.

This thesis is about investigating these challenges and evaluating how to make safe atomic swaps between blockchains with Hashed Time-lock Contracts and other similar secure technologies, and see if these could be implemented in reality.

Centiglobe is a Swedish fintech, delivering a decentralized platform that allows Financial Service Providers to improve cross-border payments services for their clients.

Financial Service providers (FSP’s) can reduce the number of pre-funded accounts abroad and concentrate all liquidity into one digital account secured by collateral with a 3rd party global bank. In addition to reducing risk and capital costs it enables FSPs full flexibility in allocating liquidity based on customer demand and not size of the pre-funding. It gives a broader reach into new markets and enables smaller players to target B2B clients previously not within reach.

The improved dataset provided by the platform gives Financial Service Providers the possibility to resolve customers issues regarding transfer pricing, inefficient cash management due to cut-off times or on-behalf payments.

Headline: Sharing of financial data with privacy preservation
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
A challenge in the financial system today is transaction monitoring to find fraudulent and criminal behavior. The best way to detect fraud and criminal activity is to share data between organizations. However, this poses a challenge on how to protect the users privacy.

This thesis is about investigating, implementing and evaluating different technologies on how to share data between organizations, but at the same time preserving users' privacy. Technologies that can be used and investigated are for example, encryption, confidential computing and/or other privacy enhancing technologies.

Centiglobe is a Swedish fintech, delivering a decentralized platform that allows Financial Service Providers to improve cross-border payments services for their clients.

Financial Service providers (FSP’s) can reduce the number of pre-funded accounts abroad and concentrate all liquidity into one digital account secured by collateral with a 3rd party global bank. In addition to reducing risk and capital costs it enables FSPs full flexibility in allocating liquidity based on customer demand and not size of the pre-funding. It gives a broader reach into new markets and enables smaller players to target B2B clients previously not within reach.

The improved dataset provided by the platform gives Financial Service Providers the possibility to resolve customers issues regarding transfer pricing, inefficient cash management due to cut-off times or on-behalf payments.

Headline: Exjobb 30hp: Cooperative Autonomous Area Search with a Drone Swarm
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Your future role

Introduction
The effectiveness and success of a cooperative search task is highly dependent on the search strategy and the ability to cooperatively negotiate this strategy in the search swarm, and to fully exploit the capability of each individual drone. In this work, a drone swarm will cooperatively and systematically search an area according to the probability to find objects of interests.

Problem description
A drone swarm will search an area systematically according to the probability to find objects of interests. Some areas will be restricted where a drone is not allowed to fly. Object(s) of Interest will be randomly located in the area and a probability distribution of the area will be used to guide the search. If an object is found, the drone will make a visual announcement of the anomaly by a specific flying pattern and send the location to the other drones and other stakeholders. Also, probabilities of the area of interest will dynamically be updated and disseminated to other drones within the swarm during the search.

This work will include the following work packages:
- Study cooperative search strategies
- Implement and evaluate one or more cooperative search strategies in a simulator
- Demonstration of three drones performing a cooperative search mission
- Documentation
- Presentation of the work

Expected results
A writted report that documents the work and the work results:

- An investigation of state-of-the-art cooperative search strategies
- Identified solution
- Software/hardware that implements and demonstrates the search strategy

Tool suggestions
- Linux (Ubuntu)
- ROS/ROS2
- IDE
- HW if feasible in the scope of work

Limitations
The work will be based on open source solutions.
This thesis is based in Stockholm/Järfälla

Your profile
You are at the end of your master studies in engineering physics, electrical engineering or computer science. For a successful master thesis work, a strong background in mathematics and statistics is crucial. Programming experience and some basic knowledge in machine learning is also beneficial.

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.

What you will be part of
Aeronautics, a business area within Saab, offers aircraft systems and subsystems to both the defense and the civil market. In addition, unmanned systems, construction of aircraft parts and services are within its business. The department Future Programs consist of the areas Concept design and Next generation studies, and is responsible for the execution of studies, contract, and projects for future products. Headline: Master Thesis, 30 HP: Reducing feedback time in the continuous integration/delivery pipeline
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Reducing feedback time to developers in the continuous integration and delivery pipeline – shortening lead time from errors being made to actual corrections in software development.

Your role
Background
A large part of the focus in the continuous integration and delivery paradigm is on reduction of feed-back times to developers, so that they may become more productive and more effectively troubleshoot software errors. These efforts very often focus on the technical approach to rapidly provide e.g. test failure reports, but there is a large untapped potential in exploring the larger scope of not just finding the faults but going from feedback to actual corrections. How the organization is shaped, who does what, how the information is presented and when inquiries are started are examples of aspects to explore outside of traditional fault slip-through analyses and the technical continuous integration and delivery scope.


Description of the master thesis
This Master Thesis aims at investigating the main drivers of lead time from errors being made in software engineering until they are corrected, and identifying approaches to reducing the end-to-end lead time, including architectural, testing, organizational and/or information presentation approaches. Problem identification and proposed solutions are based on interviews and/or workshops with practitioners in relevant roles.


Your profile
This Master Thesis is suitable for one or two students, with interest in software development, continuous integration/delivery and testing.

You are at the end of your Master of Science in e.g. Computer Science and Engineering, Industrial Engineering and Management, or Information Technology and about to start your Master Thesis work for 300 HP.

This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.


What you will be a part of
The Aeronautics business area is an innovative supplier of world-class aircraft systems, advanced aerostructures, and a wide range of support solutions within civil and military aviation. The business area researches, develops, and produces military aviation systems. We are building for the future through research and studies into innovative flight systems and the further development of our products.

By joining Aeronautics, you will be a part of a diverse, collaborative and supportive organisation with an emphasis on professional growth and work-life balance. You will work in an innovative and vibrant workplace, while having the opportunity to develop a long-term, fulfilling career.

You will be part of the Engineering Management department in the Gripen Design organization. A department working with aircraft and weapon system integration and verification.

Headline: Master Thesis, 30 HP: System Testing of AI
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Testing safety-critical AI systems based on neural networks – development and demonstration of a working prototype.

Your role
Background
Current artificial intelligence techniques – particularly neural networks – pose unique challenges to testing. It is less than clear how to reliably test the correctness of a neural network, or what correctness even means. This problem becomes particularly salient when such neural networks are tightly integrated in an existing software system context.

Description of the master thesis
This Master Thesis aims at investigating how the correctness and efficacy of neural networks, integrated into a larger software system context with strict non-functional requirements on e.g. safety and reliability. A working prototype should be developed, showing how a system based on a neural network may be confidently tested as part of a continuous integration and delivery pipeline.

Your profile
This Master Thesis is suitable for one or two students, with interest in testing and artificial intelligence.

You are at the end of your Master of Science in e.g. Computer Science and Engineering, Industrial Engineering and Management, or Information Technology and about to start your Master Thesis work for 300 HP.

Headline: Examensarbete, 30 hp: Adaptiv styrning för optimerad landning till fpl 39 Gripen
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
Din framtida utmaning
Bakgrund
Landning med flygplan är en kritisk fas under flygning och dess system och hjälpmedel har den högsta säkerhetsnivån.

För landning inom civilt luftrum finns det flera olika procedurer, landningshjälpmedel som beror på dels infrastruktur på den givna landningsbanan, flygplanets certifieringar och pilots träning. Procedurerna har som mål att på ett säkert och förutsägbart sätt ansluta till en slutfas-styrning på väg ned mot banan där pilot själv, landar visuellt.

Procedurerna är designade och utformade att passa internationella standarder, är konservativa och erkänt säkra.

Problembeskrivning
"What comes up..."

Då landningsprocedurer behöver passa många olika typer av flygplan, både storlek och hastigheter, väder, vind och ljud mot omgivande miljö är inflygningen ofta generellt utformade.

Ett militärt flygplan operera ofta i områden utanför de civila flygkorridorer som idag används av civilt flyg. Därmed så finns ett behov av att kunna stödja pilot att ansluta till finalen av landningen på ett bättre, effektivare och fortsättningsvis ett säkert sätt.

Föreslaget Exjobb
Ta fram ett optimerat landingshjälpmedel som kan integreras i Human Machine Integration, HMI som tar hänsyn till (men utesluter inte övrigt)

Aktuell flygplansprestanda under landningen så som hastighet, höjd, yttre last m.m.
Aktuellt väder och vindförhållande
Minimera bränsleåtgång, buller et.c.
Pilots arbetsbelastning och komfort
Kunna fungera med autopilot/autonom flygning

Din profil
Du läser sista året på Teknisk Fysik eller motsvarande och har en god förståelse för modellering och reglering. Du bör även ha erfarenhet från Matlab/Simulink.

Arbetet är tänkt för 2 studenter.

Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.

Vad du blir en del av
Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 18 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare, mer hållbar och mer rättvis värld.

Affärsområdet Aeronautics är en innovativ leverantör av flygplanssystem i världsklass och har ett brett utbud av supportlösningar inom civil och militär luftfart. Inom affärsområdet bedrivs forskning, utveckling och produktion av militära flygplanssystem. Vi säkrar framtiden inom flygindustrin genom forskning och studier av innovativa flygsystem och vidareutveckling av våra produkter.

Arbetet är förlagt hos Saab Aeronautics, området Primärdata och Navigering, i Linköping.

Sista ansökningsdag
2022-11-31. Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och exjobbet kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

Headline: Examensarbete, 15 hp: Fasövergående material för passiv klimatkontroll
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Din framtida utmaning
Bakgrund

RBS15 är placerade inuti en hermetiskt försluten låda, benämnd kanister. Den intakta förslutningen fram till avskjutningstillfället säkerställer att roboten inte tar skada av yttre påverkan som till exempel vatten, salt, damm, etc.

Kanistern ger dock inte ett fullgott skydd mot omgärdande temperaturförändringar. För att möta denna utmaning så har den nuvarande installationen ett aktivt klimatsystem. Detta system är skrymmande och komplext.

Om kanisterns inre klimat istället kunde hållas inom designramarna med passiva insatser skulle det kunna leda till lägre energianvändning, högre tillgänglighet och mindre avtryck på bärande plattformar.

Beskrivning av examensarbetet

Examensarbetet syftar till att undersöka och sammanställa intressanta tekniker och metoder för passiv klimatkontroll av RBS15 inuti kanistern.

Vi på Saab Dynamics ser att det är tre delar av examensarbetet.

Först, undersöka och jämföra de metoder som används på marknaden idag. Undersöka material och konstruktioner. Samt undersöka eventuella egna lösningar som kan visa sig lovande.
Därefter, se hur en konstruktion av dessa metoder skulle kunna se ut, rent konceptuellt.
Analys ska genomföras, med fokus på att stödja konstruktionsarbetet.

Examensarbetet kommer inte att innefatta några verifierande tester då dessa inte bedöms rymmas inom tidsramen.

Arbetet kan påbörjas efter överenskommelse.

Den du är idag
Vi söker en eller två ingenjörer med intresse för konstruktion och ingenjörsnära analys. Din bakgrund är högskoleingenjör inom fält som Maskinteknik med fokus på konstruktion eller energisystem. Sökande bör ha vana vid CAD programvara, och viss vana vid beräkningsprogram inriktat mot värmeöverföring.

Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.

Vad du blir en del av
Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 18 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare, mer hållbar och mer rättvis värld. Läs mer om oss här.

På Dynamics delar alla medarbetare ett och samma uppdrag: att skapa förutsättningar för ett tryggt samhälle. Oavsett om det handlar om missilsystem, undervattensteknik, kamouflagelösningar, understödsvapen, träningssystem eller fältsjukhus är du som jobbar med oss en del av vår mission. Vi jobbar i nära samarbete med att utveckla, tillverka och underhålla våra världsledande produkter, system och lösningar till kunder över hela världen.

Sektionen du blir del av ingår i mekanikavdelningen inom utveckling på Saab Dynamics. Sektionen arbetar inom hela utvecklingskedjan från teknik- och produktstudier till färdig produkt och produktvård, främst mot våra produkter inom tunga missilsystem och undervattensfarkoster.

Ett av missilsystemen som sektionen utvecklar är RBS15 där vi är ansvariga för mekaniska delsystem i roboten samt kringsystem som kanistern.

På Saabs hemsida kan du läsa mer om robotsystem 15, se länk nedan.

https://www.saab.com/products/the-rbs15-family

Roger Schwarz, Sektionschef, Mekanik, Saab Dynamics

Headline: MSc Thesis project: Optimization of Data Routing and Transport on a Multi-core System
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Net Insight´s vision is to enable a live and interactive media experience for anyone on Earth. We want to lead a revolution in real time. Letting people engage with media and one another in perfect synchrony. Creating a global marketplace, where live content is exchanged in real time, and great content is rewarded every time.



ABOUT THE POSITION

We suspect that our current model used for threading and inter process communication is not utilizing the underlying hardware to its limits. It could be that we lose a lot of performance due to cache misses, or waste cpu cycles to unnecessary thread swapping, or maybe we have a bottleneck in our inter process communication.

You would present measurements and analysis of our current model used for threading and inter-process communication and determine if it is optimal for utilizing the underlying hardware to its limits. We expect your to propose one or more new models that could increase the performance on a given hardware configuration and implement a prototype of one of the new models and show the potential performance benefit.



YOUR BACKGROUND

Basic knowledge of networking technologies
Basic knowledge of virtualization technologies
Experience with Linux
Knowledge in C/C++ and Python
Knowledge of concurrency and multi-threaded programs
In addition to this we would like you to:

Have a passion for media
Be a quick learner and have an ability to plan and execute your work
For this project, we will emphasize personal fit. We value entrepreneurial and innovative individuals with real passion for technology.


WELCOME TO APPLY


We welcome 1-2 students to take on this project. Our nice office is located in Solna Business Park and you are welcome to work from there, or in a hybrid setup.

Apply with CV and a Cover Letter through our recruitment system or you could contact us with your own suggestion for a project within a relevant field.

For questions: eva.sanden.westberg@netinsight.net or fredrik.giden@netinsight.net.


ABOUT NET INSIGHT

Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) is defining new ways to deliver media, opening up opportunities for content owners, broadcasters, production companies, service providers and enterprises to produce and deliver the future of live sport, news and online content. The company is driving the transformation to IP, virtualization and cloud workflows and has built the market’s most open and cloud-ready media delivery platform for contribution, distribution, live production, and orchestration.

For over 20 years the world’s leading media brands have trusted Net Insight and the company is recognized for having set the benchmark for media transport. Now Net Insight is combining its broadcast heritage and R&D expertise with the deep IP knowledge gained from developing its own streaming solution to evolve Nimbra, its Emmy® Award winning video transport solution, for the new media era. With a strong vision for the future of IP and cloud, Net Insight is helping the world’s leading media brands to simply and cost-effectively produce and deliver content to viewers anywhere.

For more information, please visit netinsight.net

Twitter: @NetInsight, twitter.com/NetInsight

LinkedIn: @Net Insight, www.linkedin.com/company/net-insight/

Headline: MSc Thesis project: Transfer time over RIST protocol to become independent of NTP
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Net Insight´s vision is to enable a live and interactive media experience for anyone on Earth. We want to lead a revolution in real time. Letting people engage with media and one another in perfect synchrony. Creating a global marketplace, where live content is exchanged in real time, and great content is rewarded every time.


ABOUT THE POSITION

Currently NTP sync is mandatory to ensure synchronism across all nodes in a deployment of our Nimbra Edge product and to offer specific features such as output delay for synchronized playout delivery.

However, it’s quite complex for Edge customers and even harder for end-customers of theirs to keep the NTP requirement sync for all nodes across the deployment and it’s prone to misconfiguration.

You would investigate to transfer time over RIST protocol to become independent of NTP.

Headline: MSc Thesis project: Timing algorithm that combines low jitter with small drift
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Net Insight´s vision is to enable a live and interactive media experience for anyone on Earth. We want to lead a revolution in real time. Letting people engage with media and one another in perfect synchrony. Creating a global marketplace, where live content is exchanged in real time, and great content is rewarded every time.


ABOUT THE POSITION

We have implemented two different timing algorithms today where one has low jitter but it drifts badly, and the second one has low drift but is very jittery. We would like to know if it would be possible to come up with a single algorithm that combine these two, I.e. one that has low jitter and small drift.

Your mission would be to research if it is possible to combine the good characteristics of the current algorithms into one.


YOUR BACKGROUND

Basic knowledge of networking technologies
Basic knowledge of virtualization technologies
Experience with Linux
Knowledge in C/C++ and Python
Knowledge in automatic control
In addition to this we would like you to:

Have a passion for media

Headline: Enablers and blockers for Machine Learning in a SaaS scale up
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
About us:
Mobility46 is revolutionizing the way car parks are managed in the digital era. Our suite of SaaS products help property owners, parking operators and municipalities increase revenue from parking, reduce operational costs, and offer a superior parking and EV charging experience.
Our Products:
Park46 - the 360 operating system for digital parking management.
Charge46 - Hardware agnostic business system for EV charging, seamlessly integrated with your parking offering.
Park’n’Pay - Computer vision based solution for automated surveillance and parking fee collection.

Proposed subjects:
- Investigate preferred Machine Learning models and algorithms for providing data and supporting processes in the SaaS products
- Understand the key enablers and blockers for a SaaS scale up company to launch a Machine Learning initiative

Tasks:
- Design and implement Machine Learning workflow using Snowflake’s Snowpark and the Anaconda curated repository of data science and machine learning packages
- Analyze and suggest workflows that could be implemented with the existing data and present gap analysis for other potential workflows
- Analyze and present the key enablers and blockers for a SaaS scale up company to launch a Machine Learning initiative

Who you are:
- You want to use your passion for tech to help improve people’s lives.
- You are tech-savvy with an analytical mind.
- You are a quick and humble learner who is not afraid to ask for help when necessary.
- You continuously share your knowledge, thoughts, and ideas.
- You are an excellent communicator in written and spoken English.

What we expect from you:
- You will work remote or from our offices in central Stockholm.
- You will work part-time as a junior data scientist for at least 50% during your thesis work. This is paid work that will strengthen your understanding of the problem we’re trying to solve and will improve the quality of your thesis.

Reimbursement and future opportunities:
- We will reimburse the thesis work with 10 thousand SEK after a completed project in line with the initial vision and objectives.
- You will get the opportunity to learn from our skilled co-workers, both regarding your thesis work, but also regarding data engineering and analytics.
- The master thesis can be leading to a possible recruitment and career in the Mobility46 Group

Headline: 30 credits – Commissioning of a large-scale test rig to study the effect of fuel properties and operation on ash accumulation
Subject: Chemical Science and Engineering
Description:
A thesis project at Scania is an excellent way of applying knowledge for solving industrial challenges in the transportation sector and increasing your network for your future career. Many of our current employees started their careers with a thesis project at Scania.

Background
Energy efficiency, alternative fuels and electrification, and smart and safe transports are Scania’s three pillars of sustainability. Diesel engines have the advantages of being highly efficient and easily adapted to different types of renewable fuels. This gives the diesel engine an important role in the transition to a low-carbon future.

However, particulate emissions are a drawback of diesel engines, since they can cause deteriorated air quality and health issues. Scania’s vehicles have a world-leading exhaust after treatment system that lowers emissions well below the strictest regulations. Nevertheless, at Scania we keep working to maintain our leadership and develop even better and more durable systems to meet future challenges.

The thesis is part of a PhD project, focusing on particulate filters for biofuels, led by Scania R&D in cooperation with KTH Process Technology, KTH Internal Combustion Engines, an innovative company that produces lignin-based fuel from biomass, RenFuel, and one of the world’s largest catalyst suppliers, Johnson Matthey.

Target
Engine performance and DPF service interval are high priority areas for Scania in order to improve the environmental performance and lowering costs for both company and customer. Understanding the governing factors of ash distribution in DPFs is vital for this work.

Assignment
The work is centred on the commissioning of a new test rig to load DPFs with particulates and measure the performance of the filter. This is followed by characterization to correlate the ash deposition pattern to individual operational parameters.

You will work in a dedicated team of driven experts from many aspects of engines and exhaust aftertreatment technologies.

The work will be performed mainly at Scania Materials Technology in Södertälje.

Education
Master’s student in chemical engineering or equivalent. You should have an interest in experimental work and the ability to address technical challenges in the laboratory. The ability to work independently, interest in problem solving and a curious mindset are very valued qualities.

Time: 20 weeks (VT23)
Start date: January 2023
Credits: 30 ECTS

Contact persons and supervisors
Supervisor:                     Samuel af Ugglas, +46 (0) 70 0815876,  samuel.af.ugglas@scania.com
Group manager:             Nulifer Ipek, +46 (0) 8 55351583, nulifer.ipek@scania.com

Application
Your application should include CV, cover letter and transcript of records.

Headline: 30 credits – Impact of renewable fuels on particulate filters
Subject: Chemical Science and Engineering
Description:
A thesis project at Scania is an excellent way of applying knowledge for solving industrial challenges in the transportation sector and increasing your network for your future career. Many of our current employees started their careers with a thesis project at Scania.

Background
Energy efficiency, alternative fuels and electrification, and smart and safe transports are Scania’s three pillars of sustainability. Diesel engines have the advantages of being highly efficient and easily adapted to different types of renewable fuels. This gives the diesel engine an important role in the transition to a low-carbon future.

However, particulate emissions are a drawback of diesel engines, since they can cause deteriorated air quality and health issues. Scania’s vehicles have a world-leading exhaust aftertreatment system that lowers emissions well below the strictest regulations. Nevertheless, at Scania we keep working to maintain our leadership and develop even better and more durable systems to meet future challenges.

The thesis is part of a PhD project, focusing on particulate filters for biofuels, led by Scania R&D in cooperation with KTH Process Technology, KTH Internal Combustion Engines, an innovative company that produces lignin-based fuel from biomass, RenFuel, and one of the world’s largest catalyst suppliers, Johnson Matthey.

Target
The objective of this thesis is to investigate the ageing of diesel particulate filters (DPF) and how this correlates to the catalytic performance of the filters.

Assignment
The assignment will cover the whole process from developing a method for evaluating the ageing effects to applying the method to real truck DPF samples as well as correlating the performance with the properties of the DPF samples

The work will include both theoretical and hands-on work in the laboratory as well as the use of advanced characterization techniques. The assignment involves contacts with different experts both at Scania and KTH.

The work will be performed mainly at Process Technology, KTH but also at Scania Materials Technology in Södertälje.

Education
Master’s student in chemical engineering or equivalent. You should have an interest in experimental work and the ability to address technical challenges in the laboratory. The ability to work independently, interest in problem solving and a curious mindset are very valued qualities.

Time: 20 weeks
Start date: January 2023
Credits: 30 ECTS

Contact persons and supervisiors

                                    Moa Sundén, 08 553 704 25, moa.sunden@scania.com
Group Manager:          Nulifer Ipek, 08 553 515 83, nulifer.ipek@scania.com

Application
Your application should include CV, cover letter and transcript of records

Headline: Examensarbete, 30 hp: Beslutsstöd för piloter i komplexa felsituationer
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Utveckling av regelbaserat ramverk för att förenkla och förtydliga pilotåtgärder

Din framtida utmaning
Bakgrund
Dagens stridsflygplan har system för funktionsmonitorering som detekterar fel, hanterar larm och presenterar åtgärder från flygmanualen. Dessa åtgärder som måste vidtas av piloten är väldefinierade för varje enskillt felfall.

Problemet uppkommer när mer än ett oberoende fel inträffar samtidigt. I den situationen måste piloten alternera mellan sidor i flygmanualen och ta egna beslut om hur åtgärderna ska prioriteras och kombineras.

2022 genomfördes här ett examensarbete som definierade layout och presentation för kombinerade åtgärder. Detta var mycket lyckat och har ådragit sig stort intresse från våra piloter. Nu önskar vi fortsätta på det arbete genom att bygga på med regelverk för syntes av åtgärder.

Beskrivning av examensarbetet
Uppdraget inom detta examensarbete är att skapa ett regelbaserat generellt system för att kombinera aktioner från flera larm.

Reglerna ska bland annat omfatta:

Sekvensiering av i vilken ordning aktioner ska utföras

Gruppering av samhörande åtgärder

Prioritering, bortfiltrering av mindre viktiga aktioner

Filtrering av redundanta åtgärder

Hantering av överlapp eller partiella överlapp

Filtrering av omöjliga åtgärder, tex åtgärder som har beroende till ett annat system som är rapporterat trasigt

Hantering av konflikter mellan aktioner

Om möjligt även bortfiltrering/markering av redan utförda åtgärder

Åtgärderna i sig är definierade inom Gripen E projektet men kan behöva klassas för att möjliggöra automatisk sortering. För detta kan metoder inom artificiell intelligens vara av intresse at undersöka.

Saab kommer tillhandahålla en utvecklingsmiljö för utveckling, test och demonstration av arbetet.

Examensarbetet genomförs på Saabs område i Linköping Tannefors i samarbete med sytemingenjörer och piloter från Gripen E utvecklingen.

Den du är idag
Arbetet är lämpligt för 1-2  studenter med intresse för programmering, optimering, AI.

Du/ni är i slutet av er civilingenjörs- eller masterutbildning med inriktning datorsystem, programmering, analys, maskininlärning, artificiell intelligens eller liknande och ska påbörja ert 30 hp examensarbete.


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Vad du blir en del av
Affärsområdet Aeronautics är en innovativ leverantör av flygplanssystem i världsklass och har ett brett utbud av supportlösningar inom civil och militär luftfart. Inom affärsområdet bedrivs forskning, utveckling och produktion av militära flygplanssystem. Vi säkrar framtiden inom flygindustrin genom forskning och studier av innovativa flygsystem och vidareutveckling av våra produkter.

Som medarbetare på Aeronautics blir du en del av en organisation som präglas av mångfald, samarbete och supportande medarbetarskap, och där ständigt lärande och balans i livet värderas högt. Du får arbeta i en innovativ och kreativ arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att bygga en långsiktig och givande karriär.

Du kommer utföra examensarbetet på en sektion som ansvarar för inbyggda test, felisolering samt övervakning av larm på JAS 39 Gripen E.

Headline: Computer Vision enabled Web Page Segmentation
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
About Panprices

Panprices is a technology startup that enables consumers to buy hard-to-get home electronics or products much cheaper than in your local market. It also offers data analytics services for brands and manufacturers. The team has backgrounds from European startups, Silicon Valley startups, and some of Sweden’s largest e-commerce companies. As a startup, we offer a no-fuss, meeting-sparse culture with a high level of cross-functional collaboration. This lean approach allows us to move quickly, and we love to deploy many simple experiments before committing to developing a feature.

Background

In order to aggregate information from across the web, companies implement web scraping techniques. Most of the time these techniques are based on the structure of the web page, targeting specific HTML tags or CSS classes. This approach comes with the cost of developing such a scraper for each new source, plus the cost of maintaining existing scrapers. With the rapid development of front-end solutions, and the changes in taste across the internet, websites are incentivized to regularly update their appearance. This introduces the issue of detecting when such changes happen and address the modification as quickly as possible.
Instead of structural analysis, newer methods focus on extracting data through Visual Web Page Segmentation.

Task

In this project, you will use deep learning architectures (CNN, Transformers, etc.) to implement a segmentation technique that is able to grab relevant information from a given e-commerce web page.
Main objective: Automatically retrieving relevant information (price, title, description, images, etc.) from a completely new e-commerce website, for which no previous structure is available.
To get there we will have to complete the following milestones:
- Identifying when the structure of a known web page has changed
- Automatically adapting an existing scraper to the new structure of a previously known web page

The outcome of this project should be a DNN model that is able to perform the main task and / or the 2 milestones mentioned above. For a visual representation of what is expected, please check: https://storage.googleapis.com/panprices/other/Master%20Thesis%20Proposal%20Visual%20Explanation.png .

How we support you

We have close ties with KTH and keep in touch with many professors. We do this through collaborations, guest lecturing, and that we have multiple KTH alumni in our company. This means that we can help you find a suitable examiner and supervisor at KTH, as most of our thesis projects originate from discussions with professors. We understand the scientific process and can help you not only with the technical aspects of the project but also the research aspects.
We will provide you with a dedicated company supervisor at Panprices who will be a bouncing board for anything you need help with during the project and who has recently written a thesis themselves. We will also provide office space and access to all our internal tools you might need and any of our internal data necessary for the project.


Keywords: Computer Vision, Document Segmentation, Data Mining, Web Scraping, Deep Learning, Transformers

Headline: Simulation of charge transport dynamics in electrical insulation for HVDC cables
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
Electrically insulating polymers are important for the ongoing electrification of the society to more sustainable. Solar parks and wind farms are used as renewable energy sources; however, these are often located far from where the energy is needed. To transfer electrical energy long distance, high voltage direct current (HVDC) technology is used, where as high voltage as possible is preferred in order to limit the losses.
Increased state-of-the-art understanding of the underlying physical processes is important to push the efficiency, compactness, and reliability to a next level. This put high demands on the insulation material used. Even though HVDC cables can be long, 100-1000 kilometers, the high demands on the material goes down to properties at atomic and electronic structure level. Hence, models for the physics at this length scale become important.

Tasks
In this thesis we will use state of the art simulation methods to study charge transport in polyethylene which is the main insulation in HVDC cables. In particular different charge injection models will be evaluated, where both fundamental models as well as impact of chemical impurities will be investigated. Simulations will be done using the so called bipolar charge transport model. Numerically Finite Element Method (FEM) will be applied using Comsol Multiphysics software.

Your Background
We think you have an education and interest in theoretical physics, electrical engineering, applied mathematics or similar field. You have taken courses in solid state physics or strong interest to learn. An advantage is to have experience in working with FEM simulations in Comsol.

Contact and application
This thesis will be done at NKT HV Cables AB, Technology Consulting in Västerås, Sweden. The thesis correspond to 30 hp at full speed and is expected to be run from January 2023.
NKT is committed to fostering a diverse organization and a culture where people from different backgrounds can thrive and are inspired to perform at their best. We believe that a diverse organization enables sustainable performance, and that an inclusive and welcoming culture makes for a better place to work.
Apply with CV and personal letter via the link below, at latest 24th of November 2022.
Tests can occur in our recruitment processes.

If you have any questions regarding the position, you are very welcome to contact Recruiting Manager, Senior Principal Scientist Mikael Unge, mikael.unge@nkt.com or +46 730 40 30 35. Please note that due to the GDPR regulations we cannot accept any applications via e-mail.


Welcome with your application!

Headline: Examensarbete: Cobot-applikationer
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:

Din framtida utmaning
Montering av flygplansskrov är en personalintensiv verksamhet och utförs idag oftast manuellt. Produktionsvolymen är låg med något eller några tiotals flygplan per år. Varje flygplan innehåller 1000-tals fästelement vilket ändå ger en hög repetition av enskilda monteringsmoment. Att försöka automatisera dessa moment är mycket utmanande och kräver flexibla lösningar i befintlig verkstads-layout där roboten kommer till produkten istället för produkten till roboten. Drivande för att föra in automation är förbättrad arbetsmiljö, kvalitet och förbättrad lönsamhet.

Beskrivning av examensarbetet

Examensarbetet syftar till att ge rekommendationer för framtida applikationer av kollaborativa robotar, cobots på SAAB Aeronautics. För att kunna göra det innehåller examensarbetet bland annat följande:

- Kort praktik i verkstäder för att bekanta sig med de arbetsmoment som förekommer vid montering av skrov.

- Referensstudier av tekniska lösningar med cobots, deras möjligheter och begränsningar.

- Uppbyggnad av testinstallation med en befintlig cobot

- Utprovning av prestanda hos cobot med vision avseende banföljning och positioneringsnoggrannhet

- Utveckling av koncept för flexibel/mobil cobot-installation för att betjäna befintliga arbetsstationer

Affärsområdet Aeronautics är en innovativ leverantör av flygplanssystem i världsklass och har ett brett utbud av supportlösningar inom civil och militär luftfart. Headline: Estimating IR-drop in power grids with ML
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Estimating IR-drop in power grids with ML

Background

One of the most important challenges in Integrated Circuit (IC) design, relates to Current-Resistance(IR) drop (sometimes called voltage drop), which is the deviation of a specified supply value due to power grid non-ideal physical limitations. It must be restricted for a circuit to meet its timing target and function properly. As wires get smaller and layouts get denser, obtaining an accurate estimation of IR drop through simulation-based commercial tools is very time consuming, while fixing IR drop violations further leads to longer design cycles. Therefore, fast and accurate IR drop estimation becomes essential for reducing the time needed between design cycles. Recently several Machine-Learning-based IR drop estimators have been introduced, claiming orders-of-magnitude acceleration compared with simulations-based solutions. Early-stage design analysis can be used in conjunction with machine learning algorithms to estimate IR-drop faster with the overarching goal of producing optimized component and wire configuration recommendations, more resilient to IR drop.

Thesis Description

This thesis is divided into several steps and goals: to survey the literature for ML techniques suitable for estimating IR-drop, extract design configurations from provided circuits to form the IR-drop dataset, develop and evaluate this dataset against the agreed ML algorithm(s) and present the results in a technical report as well as an oral presentation at Ericsson Research.

Qualifications

This project aims at students in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning  or similar. Background in IC design and machine learning is preferred.

Application

Your application should include the following documents: CV, Cover letter, Transcripts of studies (both B.Sc. and up-to-date M.Sc.).

Keywords: Voltage Drop, IC Design, Machine Learning

Headline: Artificial intelligence-driven condition monitoring and anomaly detection
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
-- Background
The industrial sector has been revolutionized by the recent technological advances in digitalization.
Leveraging data analytics has now enabled the collection of deep insights into the performance and, as a result, the optimization of assets.
Next generation industrial embedded systems are now capable of running machine learning models on the edge or extracting and transmitting post-processed signals to cloud computing services.
The questions to be answered are to what extent the above points can be implemented in modern industrial systems and how effectively such models can perform.

-- Purpose of the placement
The purpose of this placement is to explore the capabilities of machine learning models for monitoring the condition of the next-generation industrial embedded systems and optimizing their performance. Developing and implementing ML models on edge devices or cloud services are also part of this placement.

-- Requirements/skills
Intrinsically motivated, ambitious and possible to work independently (desirable)
Willing to build or improve programming skills in Python
Prior knowledge of machine learning or electric drives is not a requirement, but a plus
An existing ML model can be used as the foundation/starting point of this activity
Motor, and power electronics will be the focus initially

-- Tasks
Explore machine learning (ML) models for anomaly detection (e.g., temperature) and condition monitoring
Design a neural network structure and identify the required inputs and parameters
Develop and train an ML model – get access to a high-performance computing device
Implement the model in commercially available devices or ABB products
Be involved in lab testing for acquiring the training data and validating the model performance
Investigate transfer learning methods and ways of generalizing the model
Possibly publish the results of the work

-- How many students you are looking for
Currently, only one student is being sought

-- Start date and if there is some flexibility with the start date
Flexible start date (better between January/February)

-- Description of the physical work environment / compensation
Flexible timeline without hard deadlines
A physical workplace in Västerås will be provided - remote work is also possible by agreement
Accommodation in student apartments (Västerås) or compensation for train tickets (if elsewhere) is possible to be offered along with a stipend/grant

-- Literature references and scientific anchoring
[1] B. K. Bose, “Artificial Intelligence Techniques: How Can it Solve Problems in Power Electronics?: An Advancing Frontier,” IEEE Power Electron. Mag., vol. 7, no. 4, pp. 19–27, Dec. 2020, doi: 10.1109/MPEL.2020.3033607.
[2] W. Kirchgassner, O. Wallscheid, and J. Bocker, “Estimating Electric Motor Temperatures with Deep Residual Machine Learning,” IEEE Trans. Power Electron., vol. 36, no. 7, pp. 7480–7488, Jul. 2021, doi: 10.1109/TPEL.2020.3045596.

Headline: Examensarbete på Saab Dynamics, 30 hp: Avståndsmätare baserad på fotonräknande detektorer
Subject: Electrical Engineering
Description:
Bakgrund
Bakgrunden till examensarbetet är framtidsbilder om ökad måldetekterings- och målutvärderingsförmåga, reducerad formfaktor och lägre tillverkningskostnad i såväl befintliga som i kommande produkter.

Beskrivning av examensarbetet
I bland annat fordonsindustrin pågår utveckling inom LiDAR där så kallade fotonräknande detektorer används för att uppnå högre signal-brusförhållande och längre mätavstånd utan rörliga delar (sk. flash LiDAR). En intressant detektortyp för detta är kiselfotomultiplikatorn (även kallad SiPM, MPPC, m.m), vilken är uppbyggd av en matris av samverkande, över genombrottsspänningen, backspända lavinfotodioder. Det som kännetecknar SiPM är hög förstärkning men tyvärr också begränsad dynamik, vilket kräver åtgärder för att klara höga bakgrundsljusnivåer. Typiska prestandabehov är att klara diffust reflekterat solljus, höga mätfrekvenser  och stort temperaturområde.

Examensarbetet syftar till att öka vår kunskap inom området. Exempel på arbetsuppgifter kan vara framtagning av matematisk modell för prestanda-estimering, förändra eller föreslå förändringar för en given konstruktion med mål att närma sig önskad prestanda. Arbetet omfattar elektronik, optik och laser upp till klass 3B. Som grundkonstruktion används förslagsvis Onsemi:s SECO-RANGEFINDER-GEVK SiPM dToF LIDAR.

Examensarbetets tyngdpunkt mellan litteraturstudier och experiment kan anpassas utifrån vad som passar dig.

Arbetet ska dokumenteras i en skriftlig rapport och presenteras muntligt.

Den du är idag
Arbetet är lämpligt för en till två studenter med intresse för elektronik och optik.
Du/ni är i slutet av er civilingenjörs-utbildning eller motsvarande och ska påbörja ert 30 hp examensarbete. Kunskap om optik är en fördel, men inget krav.

Oavsett om det handlar om missilsystem, undervattensteknik, kamouflagelösningar, understödsvapen, träningssystem eller fältsjukhus är du som jobbar med oss en del av vår mission. Vi jobbar i nära samarbete med att utveckla, tillverka och underhålla våra världsledande produkter, system och lösningar till kunder över hela världen.

Elektroniksektionen är en del av utvecklingsavdelningen inom affärsområdet Dynamics och består av ett hundratal medarbetare. Vi arbetar med elektronikutveckling från koncept till layout, test och verifiering. För mer info om Saab och affärsområde Dynamics se www.saabgroup.com.
