We are looking for highly motivated students with background in chemistry, biochemistry, biotechnology, or medical engineering. We may be able to offer interested students from Sweden or abroad internships in these fields with flexible start dates and duration (20 - 40 weeks). Our group is very dynamic and international that collaborates with industries, create start-ups, and work on exchanges with prominent universities from all over the world. For foreign students, KTH may be able to offer help to find accommodation and get settled.

Submit your CV to gacp@kth.se indicating your experience, and research you would like to pursue. We will start revising applications immediately.
Do not hesitate to contact us for further details.
https://cuartero-research.com

Gaston Crespo
Maria Cuartero
---------------

Chemical Sensing Group är ett stort initiativ placerat på KTH centrala campus. Vi är en multidisciplinär forskargrupp med mer än 20 forskare. Vårt mål är att designa elektroanalytiska och optiska avkänningskoncept med stor inverkan på sport och sjukvård.

Vi går från mycket grundläggande aspekter av elektrokemi och optoder till fler applikationsdomäner som bärbara sensorer och mikronålssensorer. Du kan titta närmare på webbsidan
https://cuartero-research.com

Vi söker mycket motiverade studenter med bakgrund inom kemi, biokemi, bioteknik eller medicinteknik. Vi kanske kan erbjuda intresserade studenter från Sverige eller utomlands praktik inom dessa områden med flexibla startdatum och längd (20 - 40 veckor). Vår grupp är mycket dynamisk och internationell som samarbetar med industrier, skapar nystartade företag och arbetar på utbyten med framstående universitet från hela världen. För utländska studenter kan KTH kanske erbjuda hjälp att hitta boende och bosätta sig.

Skicka in ditt CV till gacp@kth.se och anger din erfarenhet och forskning du vill bedriva. Vi kommer att börja revidera ansökningar omedelbart.
Tveka inte att kontakta oss för mer information.
https://cuartero-research.com

Gaston Crespo
Maria Cuartero

Headline: M.Sc. Thesis project at Product & Production Quality, Husqvarna Group
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Are you studying a master's degree in business development or market research and searching for a thesis project? Then this might be the one for you!

Husqvarna Group is a world-leading producer of outdoor power products for garden, park and forest care. Products include chainsaws, trimmers, robotic lawn mowers and ride-on lawn mowers.

The Group is also the European leader in garden watering products and a world leader in cutting equipment and diamond tools for the construction and stone industries. The Group’s products and solutions are sold under the main brands Husqvarna & Gardena that serve professionals in more than 140 countries. Net sales in 2021 amounted to SEK 47 billion and the Group has around 14,000 employees in 40 countries.

About us:
A brand-new business unit was formed at the start of 2022. To be more focused and customer centric Husqvarna decided to split Residential consumers from Professional customers, not only in product management, but also in customer research, understanding customer needs and adapting the products and service offer accordingly.

To do this, we will need to conduct qualitative research directly with our professional customers and first need to understand what incentive formats will benefit them the most and help them decide to take part in our research activities.

The objective:
Comparative study on effectiveness of incentive formats when conducting qualitative research.

Conduct a qualitative customer research study to compare several different incentive formats offers which we provide for customers in return for their contribution to our research activities. After the study is complete, we need to be able to determine which of the incentive formats compared performed the best and led to most customer engagement.

Proper area of education:
Business development/Market research.

The thesis will include work such as:
Conduct initial research to create a pre study with proposals on points such as:
- required customer sample size
- research format, questions and goals
- industry specific incentive alternatives
- comparison method
- timeline and other resource requirements.

You will need to establish communication with a decided number of selected professional customers, conduct the research, and finally be able to consolidate the findings and present them with firm conclusions and recommendations.

How to apply: 
Please send in your application with CV and cover letter no later than November 11th. Start date of the thesis project is in the beginning of 2023, Q1.

For questions regarding the thesis project please contact: 
Mariana Primorac, mariana.primorac@husqvarnagroup.com

Read about Husqvarna Group here: 
https://www.husqvarnagroup.com/

Headline: Android Runtime Shader Performance Analysis
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
Shaders are programs written in a shader language that run as part of a rendering pipeline, optimally on the GPU directly. There are various types of shaders and applications thereof, but as an example you may use a shader to provide the per-pixel color on a polygon, allowing for smooth shading from light to dark based on the calculated light level (hence the name shader).

In 2D mobile applications, shaders can still be a powerful tool to provide custom effects or to optimize rendering of common patterns (e.g. shadows or textured surfaces).

Android uses the open-source 2D graphics engine Skia to perform its rendering. Skia allows for customization of the rendering pipeline including shaders written in SkSL (a variant of GLSL), also called AGSL (Android Graphics Shading Language) in the Android documentation. Starting from Android API 33 (Android 13) application developers can easily write and use their own shaders in their applications with RuntimeShader.

Task
In this thesis project, you will examine the use of RuntimeShader and compare using custom shaders versus standard Canvas drawing or Android UI components. An analysis could be made regarding the ease of use, performance, feature parity, code complexity/length, etc. The comparison could be made against an already existing UI component, screen, animation, etc, written with standard Android UI components in one of our Android apps, and compared to your custom shader implementation recreation.

The central question would be to see in what circumstances a custom shader should be considered, what the expected gains are, and perhaps highlight some capabilities that would be infeasible without the use of a shader.

This thesis project may suit you if...
You are interested in graphics, mathematics, and low-level programming.
You enjoy visual results and focusing on the details.
You don’t mind trailblazing with new APIs and are passionate about learning new things.

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions about the topic or want to know more about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Evaluating WebAssembly (Wasm)
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
WebAssembly (or Wasm) is a binary instruction format that is used as a compilation target, enabling deployment in a web browser or on the backend. That is, you can write your code in C++, Rust, Java, Swift, Kotlin or pretty much any language you like, compile it to WebAssembly, and run it in a web browser. Wasm is still a new technology, is developed at a rapid pace and a lot can happen in a short time. By 2022, it’s starting to look like an established technology.

Task
Depending on your interests or previous experience, a lot of different specific tasks could be conceived around Wasm, many of them having to do with performance. You could for example compare the performance of:

Wasm compiled from different source languages
any source language compiled to Wasm vs. native machine code
Wasm compiled with or without support for SIMD instructions
the same Wasm code running in different browsers
compiled Wasm vs. Javascript

This thesis may suit you if:
You care about performance optimisation
You enjoy working with tech on the bleeding edge
You’re interested in the future of the web

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions about the topic or want to know more about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Evaluating HTTP 2 and 3 for use in Mobile Apps
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
Many mobile apps use HTTP/1.1 to communicate with backend REST APIs. It’s a well-understood protocol and many backends have been deployed with only support for HTTP/1.1 in mind. However, both Android and iOS support both HTTP/2 and HTTP/3, and using them instead of HTTP/1.1 could result in significant gains, in terms of e.g. performance and battery life, depending on the network usage pattern of the app and its corresponding backend API.

Task
In this thesis project, you will describe and measure the various potential gains made by using HTTP/2 and HTTP/3 instead of HTTP/1.1. You will examine various typical app usage patterns and assess in what situations making an effort to switch to a newer version of HTTP would be beneficial.

Also interesting would be to consider how the newer HTTP versions behave with multipath networking.

You will also evaluate other pros and cons, such as tool support, backend platform support, reliability, and debuggability.

As this topic hasn’t really received the type of attention it deserves in the mobile app development community, you would have an opportunity to make an impact.

This thesis project may suit you if...
You are interested in learning more about modern network communication.
You enjoy the challenge of real world scenarios where everything is a trade-off.
You want to make an impact.

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions about the topic or want to know more about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Integrating Generative Models within the UX/UI Design Process
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
New Deep Learning models are capable of generating highly detailed images based on a text prompt, and they are about to revolutionize creative fields and beyond.

Architectures like Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) have been used to synthesize photorealistic images since 2014, but recent development on diffusion models have reached a new state-of-the-art. In addition, the progress on large language models based on transformers (like GPT-3) has pushed forward the field of Natural Language Processing tremendously.

Combining these advancements in Deep Language Understanding with diffusion models has yielded models like OpenAI’s DALL-E 2 and Google’s Imagen; these are capable of producing unique synthetic images that closely match a text prompt given as input.

These remarkable models can also be used for “text-guided image-to-image translation”, or in other words, converting an input image into another with the help of a text prompt; for instance, one could sketch out a drawing of a landscape, describe it in a sentence or two, and obtain a photorealistic image back from the model.

Task
This thesis is quite open-ended, but the main goal should be investigating how these generative models can be integrated within the UX/UI design process. A tool like this could be used to quickly generate images that could inspire a designer, stimulate the ideation process, or perhaps simplify prototyping; it could be used side-by-side to applications like Sketch or Figma, or even integrated as a plug-in. You will have complete freedom to choose the direction you prefer, as well as access to all necessary resources (a workstation equipped with a powerful GPU, software licenses, and of course, guidance from our designers and developers at Bontouch).

This thesis project may suit you if...
You are excited about state-of-the-art Deep Learning methods
You are familiar with Python and frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow
You are interested in design and the design process

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions about the topic or want to know more about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Analyzing and Comparing Concurrent, Convergent Replicated Data Synchronization Methods
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
Modern software solutions are typically built on the idea of mobility, being able to access data regardless of your physical location or device, which necessitates that the data not only be accessible and modifiable from anywhere (i.e. hosted in the cloud) but also by multiple devices at the same time, or even without an internet connection. When multiple devices/users are modifying the data at the same time, it is also desirable that changes are seen in real time.

This introduces the problem of synchronization – changes I make locally should be seen by others (perhaps at a later time, if I am offline right now). There are many different ways to handle syncing data, but a common problem is handling conflicts between two data sets – if user A makes changes to the same data at the same time as user B, we need to somehow resolve this conflict by automatically merging the two, picking one of them, or asking the user to manually merge the conflict or pick a version to keep.

CRDTs (Conflict-free Replicated Data Types) with Hybrid Logical Clocks provide one way to enable distributed systems to pass changes around safely, without risk for conflicts and without the need for synchronized clocks or constant connection between nodes. There is also Operational Transform, a technology with similar guarantees and use cases as CRDTs. Differential Synchronization is another method for syncing changes from multiple users to the same text in a way that is robust and relatively simple. There are probably many others.

Task
This is an open-ended thesis suggestion. The idea is to compare different methods for concurrent, convergent replicated data synchronization, from both a theoretical and practical standpoint. Points of comparison may be made with regards to:

Theoretical guarantees and features, perhaps around overhead, convergence, conflict resolution, and more.
Existing implementations and complexity of writing your own, including for multiple disparate platforms.
Practical implementation consequences including performance, requirements, and restrictions on the environment or interactions with data.
Requirements on architecture or system design e.g. client-server, peer-to-peer, load balancing, replication, sharing, etc.
Offline support, robustness to network issues and latency, incorrect clocks, memory corruption, malicious clients, and other errors.
Or any other interesting avenues of research and verification that you come across.

This thesis project may suit you if...
You are interested in algorithmic design and mathematical theory.
You’re interested in both the backend and cloud side as well as the client side of things, in order to build the best product.
You already have ideas for directions you might take your thesis based on what you’ve just read.

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions about the topic or want to know more about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Performance Analysis of SwiftUI on iOS
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
SwiftUI is a declarative framework for creating user interfaces across multiple platforms such as iOS, macOS, tvOS and watchOS. SwiftUI was introduced by Apple in 2019 and ever since, it has been evolving at a rapid pace. Apple make yearly releases with new features of SwiftUI, creating a more and more competent framework.

Performance is an important part of a great user experience. An app with bad performance can affect the user experience by taking too long time to launch, responding slowly to input or appearing to the users as if it’s not working. With SwiftUI constantly growing and being adopted across the industry, it is important to assess its performance, to see what benefits or pitfalls SwiftUI might have compared to other UI frameworks.

Task
Compare performance between SwiftUI and an older UI framework, such as UIKit. A performance analysis can be carried out where accuracy, efficiency or speed of execution are metrics to investigate.

Parts of SwiftUI that could be interesting to research are:

Shapes vs. Canvas vs. Metal
Complex rows in lists
Live updating surfaces

This thesis project may suit you if…
You would like to try out Swift and working with software development for Apple platforms.
You care about low level details of programming languages.
You are interested in the shift from imperative to declarative programming.

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions about the topic or want to know more about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Improving Train Positioning using Track Data from Trafikverket
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
In the current version of the SJ mobile app, train route visualisation is done without any exact data on where the tracks actually are. The current method uses linear interpolation between train stops instead of the actual train route, which can result in “interesting” routes. The most obvious ones being routes crossing several of Sweden’s biggest lakes. No, there are no tunnels.

Trafikverket keep detailed plans of every track the Swedish trains use, and despite not being in the easily accessible format, it should make it possible to improve the visualisation.

Task
Create a route estimation tool using track data from Trafikverket.

Investigate if the data set can be reduced to fit into a mobile app.

Find out if the algorithm be optimised to run in real time on a mobile device.

This thesis project may suit you if:
You enjoy data processing
You enjoy working with and develop new algorithms
You have an interest in mobile development

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions or concerns about the topic "Improving Train Positioning using Track Data from Trafikverket", want to know more about other topics we offer or about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Jetpack Compose Performance Evaluation
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
Jetpack Compose is a new declarative UI framework for Android (and other platforms), which allows you to write your UI as a set of functions with inputs. Whenever a state changes, any function depending on its value will be called again to emit a new UI.

With Compose growing more popular and adoption across the industry on the rise, more and more complex views and interaction patterns will be implemented in Compose. How does this impact overall app performance? Are there certain kinds of views Compose still isn't well suited for? How does it stack up to the old tried and true UI framework?

Task
Evaluate performance between Compose and the old UI Framework. You could measure a number of things, such as:
Layout/measure time
Drawing time per frame, or dropped frames
Drawing time during certain operations (such as scroll)
Time to first frame
Memory usage
GPU, CPU, and battery usage
Effects on app size
etc.

Some areas worth investigating are:
Layout process
Lists using LazyColumns vs RecyclerView
Animations
Complex views
Images/bitmaps
Canvas operations
Touch interaction
Of course, you will likely find many others to investigate.

This thesis project may suit you if:
You are curious about declarative UI
You are interested in the Android platform
You care about performance and buttery smooth UIs

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions about the topic or want to know more about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Evaluating Performance of Kotlin Multiplatform in non-JVM Environments
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
Native app development can provide an app with high performance and an intuitive user experience, which is harder to achieve using cross-platform frameworks. Poor performance has long been considered to be one of the main disadvantages of applications developed with a non-native approach (also known as multiplatform).

Kotlin Multiplatform is a framework that allows the same code to be compiled for Android, iOS, web and other platforms. Kotlin/Native compiles to native code on supported platforms, such as iOS. There is also Kotlin/JS that transpiles to JS, and Kotlin/Native can also compile to WebAssembly.

For an iOS app, this should theoretically provide the same performance as building it natively in Swift or Objective-C. This should make cross-platform a more viable option than other alternatives, even when native performance is needed.

Task
For this task you can choose to evaluate the memory and runtime performance of Kotlin code running in a browser or an iOS app, as compared to the equivalent code in JS or Swift. It could be interesting to evaluate different types of code/algorithms including

Memory-heavy code
Multithreaded code
CPU-intensive code
Extended load
IO-heavy code
Time-constrained operations such as audio/video or UI code
You can use different metrics such as garbage collection overhead, memory consumption, execution time, CPU utilization, battery consumption, IO usage, etc.

This thesis project may suit you if...
You are interested in iOS development, web development and/or Kotlin.
You care about low-level details of execution and performance.
You enjoy learning new languages and platforms.

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions about the topic or want to know more about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Saliency Analysis for Extracting Key Frames from a Video Clip
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Background
In recent years, there has been a remarkable surge of video content shared on social media; new platforms like TikTok are built around it, while older ones like Instagram are shifting towards this format.

The rise in popularity of video content comes hand in hand with the rapid development of automated systems for labeling, moderating, and otherwise analyzing such content as fast as it is uploaded and shared.

One interesting problem in particular is about extracting one or a few “interesting” — or salient — frames from a video clip; these frames could be used in a number of ways, for instance:

We might want to use a representative frame as a thumbnail for the video clip
We might want to highlight certain moments of the video to the user, for example, a moment where people are smiling
We might want to identify products, and perform further analysis on those frames
How we define “interesting” here depends on the application, but regardless of what we are looking for, we typically want the selected frames to be as clear as possible, minimizing motion blur, noise, incorrect exposure, etc.

Task
For this thesis project, you will investigate automated solutions for identifying and extracting salient frames from video clips. Your implementation should be able to take a short video as input, and return one or more clear frames containing certain objects. You will be free to choose any method you would like to experiment with, including old-school Computer Vision techniques, and Deep Learning. You will also get to decide between building a solution for a workstation or a cloud container, or experimenting with efficient methods that can run locally on a mobile device.

This thesis project may suit you if...
You are interested in Computer Vision and Deep Learning.
You are familiar with one or more frameworks for Machine Learning (such as PyTorch, TensorFlow).
You are curious about Deep Learning on mobile devices.

You are welcome to contact us at students@bontouch.com, if you have any questions about the topic or want to know more about our thesis program at Bontouch.

Headline: Master Thesis -
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Part commercial enterprise, part revolutionary movement, Einride leads the transition to a zero-emission transportation system, based on autonomous, all-electric vehicles, coordinated by an intelligent routing software — making the journey from A to B as efficient as possible.

Headline: Developing a background-controlling immunoassays for precision medicin
Subject: Biotechnology
Description:
Multiplexed bead-based immunoassays are becoming increasingly popular for detecting hundreds of proteins simultaneously in a few microliters of serum or plasma. Today, multiplexed sandwich immunoassays on beads are commercially available for quantifying panels of cytokines, cardiac disease biomarkers, or obesity biomarkers, among others. As with most analytical methods, unwanted technical variation gets introduced into the data during sample handling and assay preparation. This technical variation can be large in methods that use very small pipet volumes, especially in the hands of unexperienced users, and sometime ends up masking interesting biological variation. To tackle these technical variations, multiplexed data needs to be normalized before analysis. Despite this, normalization relies heavily on assumptions of your data that may not always hold true and accurately compensating for technical variation without removing biological variation is complex.

Commonly, bead-based immunoassays are performed by coating color coded microparticles with antibodies towards your target protein of interest, then mix these particles with serum (or plasma). Ideally, only your target protein of interest will bind to the antibody and all other proteins removed through washing. However, this is rarely the case, and instead some serum proteins bind unspecific to the beads or antibody scaffold. The total amount of bond protein is then detected either by adding a fluorophore to biotin that has been randomly incorporated into the blood sample, by using a detection antibody or a known amount of spiked-in labelled target protein.

In this project, you will search for proteins that could be used as internal standards for measuring sample background. You will then attempt to develop a new type of multiplexed, bead-based immunoassay for a preselected number or proteins in serum, that relies on one or several of these proteins as an internal standard for normalizing against technical variation. You will investigate if this method can be used to, in an easy way, isolate and compensate for technical variation after an assay has been run. You will need to design experiments to establish a mathematical relationship between signal, added sample volume and target protein.

Headline: Intership 2022/2023
Subject: Real Estate Development and Financial Services
Description:
Part-time Private Equity Internship Fall/Spring 2022/23 – Stockholm
Norvestor is looking for last year bachelor- and master students to join our Stockholm team part- or full-time, for an internship with a six to twelve months duration. We offer a unique opportunity to experience the private equity industry firsthand and develop skills to pursue a career in investments or entrepreneurship. You will take an integral role in our investment team, taking on a significant amount of responsibility assisting us in acquiring and developing fast-growing Nordic companies.
The internship is a great opportunity to learn private equity, work closely with, and be coached by, the Norvestor team and attend the Norvestor Academy sessions.

Key Responsibilities
• Prepare research and analysis for deal sourcing and development of our portfolio companies
• Financial modelling
• Preparation of external and internal presentations and other material
• Attend meetings and discussions with various external advisors, entrepreneurs as well as with existing and prospects portfolio companies
• Assist deal teams with internal processes
• Take part in Norvestor Academy sessions

Candidate Profile
Candidates with analytical, commercial, and creative capabilities, who are willing to work hard and diligently in a team-oriented environment
• Third-year Bachelor or Master students within business/economics or engineering with strong academic record
• Previous experience from relevant internships and extracurricular activities
• Commercially oriented with distinct and interest for investments
• Microsoft Office proficiency
• Fluent in English and Swedish or Norwegian



About Norvestor
Norvestor is a leading private equity firm that has partnered with Nordic businesses for nearly three decades. We have a total of 2.1 billion EUR in committed capital investing in medium-sized Nordic companies, with revenues in the range of €25–250 million. We typically invest in companies providing services, often where digitalisation and available technology can be utilised to make sustainable efficiency gains and create real value for clients and society.
Sustainability is a key aspect of Norvestor’s investment philosophy. We are convinced that businesses that contribute positively to society and have sustainable business models will build long-term value. We want our contribution to be positive – not just because we believe acting responsibly leads to superior investment results and allow us to attract the best talent, but also because we are convinced it is the right thing to do.
The team comprises 40 professionals based in Oslo, Helsinki, Stockholm, Copenhagen, and Luxembourg. Our Stockholm office opened in 2016 and comprises 6 full-time employees.
If you have any further questions regarding the internship, please feel free to contact us. Please send your application including CV, cover letter, and grades to reception.se@norvestor.com

(Subject: Norvestor investment internship Stockholm – your full name).
We will go through the applications on an ongoing basis, and as such we highly advise you to send in yours as soon as possible.

Headline: Altitude Estimation Filter for HydroFoiling Craft
Subject: Engineering
Description:
Electric hydrofoiling craft are gaining increasingly attention. Modern design requires advanced and reliable fly-by-wire ride-control systems.

Successful control feedback of the vehicle ride altitude requires both a good estimation of ride height over mean water level and but at the same time not reacting to every single wave encounter. The challenges are mainly:
That the altimeter:
     - Sometimes get no reading,
     - Sometimes reads N*true distance,
     - Damping out waves (low pass) makes for a too slow filter

The solution would be a combined filter that
     - Classifies wave conditions (but not reacts to every wave encounter)
     - Estimates altitude of board over calm water level as control state.

If you are interested in this topic just give me a calla or email and we can discuss further :-)

/Jakob Kuttenkeuler, professor
070-346 4240
jakob@kth.se

Headline: Kundkommunikatörer till idrottsintresserat finansbolag och padelbolag
Subject: Real Estate Development and Financial Services
Description:
Kundkommunikatörer till idrottsintresserat finansbolag och padelbolag

Verdana Fond & Försäkring arbetar sedan 2003 med finansiell rådgivning/kapitalförvaltning. Bolaget riktar sig mot privatpersoner, företagare, utlandssvenskar samt fotbollsspelare.
Vi har kontor i centrala Stockholm, Båstad och Åre.

I Verdana koncernen ingår även Verdana padel AB som äger den nya exklusiva padel anläggningen på Långholmen (6 st utomhusbanor) samt även en privat medlemsklubb i Spånga (X10 AB).

Verdana är auktoriserade rådgivare under finansinspektionens tillsyn och ombud till ett värdepappersbolag och har därför möjlighet att erbjuda våra klienter ett brett utbud av finansiella produkter. På Verdana arbetar engagerade och välutbildade investeringsrådgivare där klienten sätts i fokus. Vi tror på långsiktiga relationer och individanpassade lösningar.

Arbetsuppgiften är att boka upp befintliga klienter på möten samt övrig kundkommunikation.
Du ska vara kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och driven.

Denna tjänst motsvarar 10–20 timmar per vecka uppdelat på cirka 2-3 tillfällen. Tjänsten skulle kunna delas av två personer/studenter.

Vill du arbeta i ett entreprenörsdrivet företag där egna initiativ och nytänkande välkomnas tror vi att du kommer att trivas på Verdana. Vi kan erbjuda dig ett självständigt arbete på en dynamisk arbetsplats med trevliga arbetskollegor där det finns ett starkt idrottsintresse. Vill du arbeta som finansiell rådgivare framöver så finns goda möjligheter till detta.

Skicka CV och en kort presentation om dig själv och varför du skulle vilja arbeta hos Verdana Fond & Försäkring till inbjudan@verdana.se. Rubrik ”Kundkommunikatör”.

Tillträde omgående
10-20 h/vecka
Individuell fast timlön

Headline: Examensarbete inom mekanisk beräkning på kompositstolpar
Subject: Engineering physics
Description:
BAKGRUND
I takt med att elförbrukningen i Sverige ökar behöver elnätet byggas ut. På de högre spänningsnivåerna används främst luftledningar med olika typer av stolpkonstruktioner. Konstruktion och materiel utformas efter respektive stolpplats förutsättningar; laster, vinklar, höjdskillnader till angränsande stolpar, korsande ledningar och omgivning.

I dagsläget används trästolpar som standard på regionnätsnivå och stålstolpar på transmissionsnätsnivå, men vid särskilda omständigheter används även kompositstolpar. Kompositstolpar har blivit allt vanligare och används bland annat då det finns risk att impregneringsmedel kan läcka ut i vatten eller vid korsningar som kräver högre stolpar än vad som normalt går att få tag på för trästolpar. Vid stolpkonstruktion är det viktigt att stolpen klarar av alla mekaniska laster och krav som finns enligt svensk standard. För att dimensioneringen av kompositstolparna ska bli korrekt behöver lastträd för olika punkter på stolpen tas fram.

UPPDRAGSBESKRIVNING
Examensarbetet syftar till att ge en fördjupad kunskap inom konstruktion och dimensionering av kompositstolpar. I examensarbetet ingår dels grundläggande principer och materialval vid konstruktion av kompositstolpar samt att ta fram ett program för beräkning av mekaniska laster på kompositstolpar. Output från programmet ska som minst vara ett lastträd (tabell) med laster för olika punkter i stolpkonstruktionen vid olika lastfall, men får gärna även ge en grafisk skiss över konstruktionen och vilka punkter som lastträdet avser. Programmet ska vara tillämpbart för att räkna på nya konstruktioner och ej enbart en stolpkonstruktion. I examensarbetet ingår även en beskrivande del av arbetet som gjorts och hur programmet ska användas.

Examensarbetet kan till viss mån anpassas efter student för att uppfylla de krav som ställs från skolan. För att uppfylla dessa krav kan till exempel ett specifikt case lösas av studenten med hjälp av programmet.

PLACERING OCH STARTDATUM
Placeringsort för examensarbetet är Stockholm. Vi ser gärna att större delen av arbetet görs på vårt kontor. Egen plats för studenten kommer finnas på NEKTABs kontor på Löfströms allé i Sundbyberg.

Examensarbetet planeras utföras våren 2023. Startdatum för examensarbetet kan anpassas efter student.

VI SÖKER
Vi söker dig som går sista året på en civilingenjörsutbildning och har följande bakgrund:
• Goda kunskaper inom mekanik och hållfasthetsteknik
• Grundläggande programmeringskunskaper (octave/matlab) alternativt goda kunskaper i excel

NEKTAB är ett familjärt företag och vi som jobbar här värnar om varandra. Vi söker dig som är lyhörd, driven och pålitlig. Du är noggrann och självgående men inte rädd för att göra fel eller be om hjälp, en lagkamrat som vill vara en del av gruppen och gillar att samarbeta för att lösa problem.

OM FÖRETAGET
NEKTAB bildades 2007 av ett antal etablerade konsulter inom energiområdet. Företaget antog redan då den unika formen av ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag och ägs fortsatt till hundra procent av de anställda. Vi är det familjära bolaget som erbjuder expertkunskap och helhetslösningar för att i nära samarbete med våra uppdragsgivare och partners utveckla kostnadseffektiva och hållbara elnät i hela Sverige.

Som examensarbetare kommer du tillhöra NEKTABs transmissions- och regionnätsgrupp. Vi arbetar mot samtliga stora nätbolag, bland annat Svenska Kraftnät, Vattenfall och Ellevio samt mindre bolag som Jämtkraft och Skellefteå Kraft. Vi är specialiserade inom projektering och samarbetar med andra teknikområden så som GIS, skog- och markåtkomst och tillståndshantering för att kunna erbjuda helhetsåttaganden mot våra kunder. Exempel på projekt som vi utför är projektering av ledningar till nya vindkraftparker.

ANSÖKAN OCH KONTAKT
Om examensarbetet låter intressant skicka in personligt brev, CV och lista på tagna kurser till linnea.sjoholm@nektab.se. Vid frågor kontakta Linnea via mail eller på 08-401 22 76.

Headline: Emulating Actors in a Self-Learning Security Environment
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
We offer a master thesis project in the area of autonomous network security. In this line of research, we develop systems capable of autonomous security management. Towards this goal, a key challenge is to develop realistic environments that can be used to collect data and to evaluate such systems. In our previous work, we have developed a testbed for that emulates complex IT infrastructures and cyber attacks (see the references at the end of this document). Using this testbed, we are able to study the effect of different security mechanisms in a realistic environment.

In this master thesis project, the goal is to extend our testbed (the testbed is available at csle.dev and a video demonstration is available at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=18P7MjPKNDg) and to develop a framework for emulating client populations. The framework will primarily be used to emulate different client behavior but may also be used to emulate certain types of attacks. It should be configurable and allow to generate specific types of IP traffic and application traffic. Moreover, the framework should be able to generate clients according to different load patterns (e.g. periodic, spikes, and constant). The design of the generator will be based on a combination of classical models from the network performance modeling literature (e.g based on stochastic modeling) and new theoretical models developed for our specific use case (e.g. based on empirical studies of cyber attacks and ideas from game theory).

Tasks:

- Perform a background study on network emulation, stochastic modeling, client generators, and intrusion prevention.
- Design and formalize the client generator using stochastic modeling. We will start the formalization using existing theory from the network performance modeling literature and then we will extend the model to fit our use case.
- Implement and analyze the client generator. The generator will be evaluated based on scalability, fidelity, and flexibility. It will be analyzed theoretically and compared to other client generators and traffic generators proposed in the literature.

Qualifications:

- Experience in network and systems engineering.
- Experience in stochastic modeling.
- Strong background in programming.
- Experience in cyber security.

Specifics:

- Project Start: Decided together with applicant.
- Supervisor: Kim Hammar EECS/NSE.
- Examiner: Prof. Rolf Stadler EECS/NSE.
- Location: Remote and at Division of Network and Systems Engineering (NSE), KTH school of electrical engineering and computer science.

To apply: Email kimham@kth.se and stadler@kth.se with your CV and a short description of why this project interests you and why it suits your background.

References:

- Kim Hammar and Rolf Stadler. “Learning Security Strategies through Game Play and Optimal Stopping”. In: Proceedings of the ML4Cyber workshop, ICML 2022, Baltimore, USA, July 17-23, 2022. https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.14694. PMLR, 2022

- Kim Hammar and Rolf Stadler. “Intrusion Prevention through Optimal Stopping”. In: IEEE Transactions on Network and Service Management (2022). https : / / ieeexplore . ieee . org / document/9779345, pp. 1–1. doi: 10.1109/TNSM.2022.3176781

Headline: Algorithms for Self-Learning Security Systems
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
We offer a master thesis project in the area of "self-learning systems for cyber security". In this line of research, the goal is to develop autonomous systems that learn to manage their own security using data generated by the system itself. Traditional approaches to network security use static rules for detection of attacks and selection of response actions.  Their main drawback lies in the need for domain experts to configure the rule sets. As a consequence, much research effort has been devoted to developing methods for managing network security in an automatic and dynamic way. This research uses concepts and methods from various areas, most notably from reinforcement learning, game-theory, and evolutionary methods.

This master thesis project will focus on the reinforcement learning approach. In the last years, reinforcement learning has achieved super-human performance in games such as Go, Chess, and Atari. A central concept behind these successes is rollouts. In this project, we want to apply this concept to a cyber security context and to study the trade-offs between rollout-based and rollout-free reinforcement learning algorithms; which algorithm gives the best performance? which algorithm is the most efficient? which algorithm is the most applicable to a cyber security context?

Tasks:

- Perform a background study on reinforcement learning, Markov decision theory, and intrusion prevention.
- Implement reinforcement learning algorithms (minimum 2 algorithms). The student should implement at least one rollout-based reinforcement learning algorithm and one rollout-free reinforcement learning algorithm.
- Analyze theoretical properties of the implemented algorithms. The student should analyze and compare the implemented algorithms theoretically and reason about their applicability in a cyber security context.
- Empirically compare the implemented algorithms. The student should run extensive simulations to empirically compare the implemented algorithms and their suitability for the cyber security use case. Properties that will be looked at in the evaluation are: sample complexity, convergence rate, computational complexity, and robustness to random factors. The student will have access to a cyber security simulation environment to evaluate algorithms and a GPU server to to run experiments.

Qualifications:

- Experience in machine learning and reinforcement learning.
- Experience with Python programming.
- It is not required but a plus if you have an interest in computer networking and/or network security.

Specifics:

- Project Start: Decided together with applicant.
- Supervisor: Kim Hammar EECS/NSE.
- Examiner: Prof. Rolf Stadler EECS/NSE.
- Location: Remote and at Division of Network and Systems Engineering (NSE), KTH school of electrical engineering and computer science.

To apply:

Email kimham@kth.se and stadler@kth.se with your CV and a short description of why this project interests you and why it suits your background.

References:

- Kim Hammar and Rolf Stadler. “Learning Security Strategies through Game Play and Optimal Stopping”. In: Proceedings of the ML4Cyber workshop, ICML 2022, Baltimore, USA, July 17-23, 2022. https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.14694. PMLR, 2022

- Kim Hammar and Rolf Stadler. “Intrusion Prevention through Optimal Stopping”. In: IEEE Transactions on Network and Service Management (2022). https : / / ieeexplore . ieee . org / document/9779345, pp. 1–1. doi: 10.1109/TNSM.2022.3176781

Headline: Thesis project at Pro Sales, Husqvarna Group
Subject: Industrial Management
Description:
Are you a bachelor or master student within business development or management? Then this might be the one for you!

A brand new business unit was formed at the start of 2022. To be more focused and customer centric Husqvarna decided to split Residential consumers from Professional customers, not only in product management, now also in all front end operation, i.e. sales. One of the key target consumer segments are sport and in particular golf. We need a deeper understanding of the resources need to penetrate this very special segment in our market.

The objective
We are set to disrupt the professional turf care markets. We think we have the product and solution to make that happen. But to understand what we need in terms of: staff, time and aftermarket capabilities and other resources, we want to dig deep in the Golf segment in our market. The assigned person need to cover all topics and look into and understand every aspects of presales, installation, handover and aftermarket. We will use the outcome of the report to ask for right resources to meet the set targets and to deliver on customers’ expectations.

Proper area of education
Business development, business management.

The thesis will include work such as
Evaluate and give firm advice on how to structure sales and supporting organization to fulfill customers expectation. We are set to be “The trusted partner”, and we need to understand every aspect of what I takes to be that one.

How to apply 
Please send in your application with CV and cover letter no later than November 11th. Start date of the thesis project is as soon as possible or by agreement.

For questions regarding the thesis project please contact: 
Magnus Sandberg, magnus.sandberg@husqvarnagroup.com

Read about Husqvarna Group here: 
https://www.husqvarnagroup.com/

Headline: Automated molecular biology labs: computational infrastructure
Subject: Biotechnology
Description:
We are looking for highly motivated students who would like to contribute to a vibrant academic lab working on single-cell genomics and its applications to understand human genome regulation and disease. The group consist of a diverse group of researchers in molecular biology and computational biology.

This position in particular focus on building an efficient software infrastructure for the automated lab where we use robot arms to control how plates are moved from different instruments to automatically perform whole day workflows. Currently, we have integrated a robotic arm (Dorna2), with thermal cyclers, nanodispensers, centrigues, scanners, liquid pipetting robots, and more, into being remotely controlled through various types of software (mostly Python, C#, soap servers) and using emerging standards (e.g. SILA2) when possible. Needed is highly efficient main controller software that both handles each integrated device more efficiently (e.g. as spawned background processes using asyncio in Python). It would also be desirable to interactively optimise workflows to identify the most efficient moving of the experimental plates (10-20) through tens of steps over the course of a day.

In essence, you would program robotic arms to perform cutting-edge molecular biology and learn the future of how automated lab will be designed.

If you are interested, please don't hesitate to contact me to obtain more information.

Headline: AI-based image classifications for molecular biology labs
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
We are looking for a highly motivated student who would like to contribute to a vibrant academic lab working on single-cell genomics and its applications to understand human genome regulation and disease. The group consist of a diverse group of researchers in molecular biology and computational biology.

We are currently developing the infrastructure for an automated lab where we robotic arms control how plates are moved from different instruments to automatically perform whole day workflows. Currently, we have integrated a robotic arm (Dorna2), with thermal cyclers, nanodispensers, centrigues, scanners, liquid pipetting robots, and more, into being remotely controlled through various types of software (mostly Python, C#, soap servers) and using emerging standards (e.g. SILA2) when possible.

This project aims to develop AI-based classification of microwell plates positioned in integrated instruments to automatically detect problems with loading plates into instruments. Small Rasperry pi cameras will be placed in vicinity of each device and or on the robotic arms in order to catch images of microwell plate movements from and to instruments. Before starting instruments, the AI-based image classification would confirm that the plate is well placed - or alert the operator that the plate seem misplaced - before the instruments throws errors.

In principle any AI-based package could be used although PyTorch, Tensorflow or similar would be preferred. The developed packages could have broad utility as no such packages are available worldwide.

This project could be an "examensarbete" or suitable for students keen on working extra on a fun academic project while studying.

Headline: MEP Design Engineer
Subject: Mechanical engineering
Description:
Northvolt has an exciting intern position for a MEP Design Engineer to join the Blueprint Team in Stockholm.

In joining us, you will play an important part of the development and growth of the Northvolt’s Construction blueprint. You will deal with Mechanical, Electrical and Plumbing disciplines, and support both new and ongoing projects of our battery factories.

Your responsibilities will be to assist in the development of Northvolt's MEP design philosophy and design implementation, as well as support with producing and reviewing drawings, calculations and requirements.

The person we are looking for is a great communicator, detail-oriented, flexible, and friendly. You should enjoy a multicultural, collaborative and high-paced work environment. This is a 6 month internship with start date as soon as possible.

Northvolt is an equal opportunity employer. We're a diverse group of individuals, united by a common mission, who recognize that while our actions have a role to play in driving Northvolt towards its goals, we always seek to move forward as a team. We offer you an open and welcoming atmosphere where we win as a team – and fail as a team. Northvolt is growing at the speed of light and we are a strong believer in internal career development.

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Review and clarify the relevant heating, cooling, ventilation, and other utility requirements for the different end users for their designated area, and where necessary translate them into a set of functional requirements to be used as a basis of design.
Resolve technical queries, continually assure the quality of the design and review of design documentation.
Collaborate with other engineering disciplines to facilitate a fully integrated, optimized design that meets all functional requirements.
Provide technical support to the rest of the Blueprint and other construction teams.
You are flexible, hardworking, open minded, got a lot of grit and of course a sense of humor.
Apply with CV and your complete LinkedIn profile.

Full time internship employment, fixed salary.
Planned starting date is asap.

Skills & Requirements
We believe that you have:

- Bachelor degree in Mechanical or Electrical engineering fields.
- Excellent English written and oral skills.
- Strong conceptual and design talent.
- Fundamental understanding of the design process.
- Experience using drawing and BIM softwares, preferably AutoCAD and Revit, as well as with MS Excel.

Headline: Stryktålighet hos sandwichfartyg
Subject: Marine technology
Description:
Marinen förfogar över ett flertal korvetter av Visby-klass. Dessa är byggda i kolfiberkomposit med en sandwichstruktur. Fartygen sjösattes from 2000 och har sedan dess varit i kontinuerlig drift. En frågeställning som levt under hela utvecklings- och konstruktionsfasen är kompositer och sandwichstrukturers skadetålighet (aka stryktålighet).
Under år i drift har det (givetvis) skett tillbud som resulterat i skador på skrovet. Dessa tillbud är till exempel kajstuds, hård tilläggning, grundstötning, påkörning av flytande objekt, tappad utrustning på däck, etc. Det finns flera andra typer av händelser som resulterat i skador på skrov eller överbyggnad. Dessa skador har antingen reparerats omgående eller vid nästa planerade service, allt beroende på skadans omfattning och var i fartyget skadan skett. Marinen har en rutin för att rapportera dessa tillbud. Det saknas idag en sammanställning av dessa tillbuds omfattning och konsekvens.

I arbetet ingår att
- från skaderapporter sammanställa tillbud och hitta en modell för att om möjligt kategorisera dem.
- uppskatta kraften/energin islaget utifrån rapporterat händelseförlopp och skadeutbredning, skadans omfattning.
- identifiera relevanta modeller, med hänsyn till Visbys material och dimensioner, och därefter göra en jämförelse mellan dokumenterade skador, uppskattade belastningar och identifierade modeller.

I litteraturen finns flera analytiska modeller som försöker beskriva hur kompositmaterial och sandwichstrukturer skadas vi olika typer av slag. Dessa modeller har i vissa fall verifierats med experiment, oftast i labbmiljö.

Syftet med examensarbetet är att skapa förståelse för vilken typ av belastningar som är kritiska samt förbättra rapporteringsunderlaget.

Arbetet utgör bidrag till FMV:s teknikutveckling, framtida forskning och plattformsutformning.

Exjobbet utförs i samarbete mellan KTH och FMV.

Headline: Kompositstruktur för verkansdämpning
Subject: Marine technology
Description:
Exjobbstart enligt överenskommelse, ansökan mottages löpande.

FMV tillsammans med samarbetspartners utvecklar strukturkoncept för att begränsa effekter av explosioner ombord på fartyg. Konceptet bygger på att väggar i utrymmen är byggda av sandwichpaneler som konstrueras för att samverka, absorbera och styra effekterna av explosioner så att skador kan minskas.

Studien ska sammanfatta resultat och slutsatser från tidigare arbeten som utförts. De tidigare analyserna har efterföljts av fullskaletester och arbetet ska återkoppla de experimentella resultaten till de tidigare studierna för att verifiera analysernas giltighet och identifiera eventuella brister och ytterligare behov. Målet med arbetet är att reda ut den tekniska mognadsgraden hos konceptet i termer av vad som är (be)visat och känt, vad som återstår att reda ut och besvara för att eventuellt driva det vidare mot implementering i full skala i ett fartyg.

Frågor att besvara för att ta ställning till om konceptet kan/bör implementeras i full skala:
- Vilka för- och nackdelar finns?
- Vad återstår att reda ut?
- Vilka är de största praktiska utmaningarna?
- Vilka villkor ställer användandet av konceptet på övrig utformning/konstruktion av fartyget?

Arbetsbeskrivning
- Litteraturstudie och analys av tidigare dokumentation
- Uppdatering av beräkningsmodeller/-metodik
- Utvärdering av konceptets potential och realiserbarhet
- Upprättande av färdplan för implementering i verkligt fartyg

Arbetet utgör bidrag till FMV:s teknikutveckling, framtida forskning och plattformsutformning.

Exjobbet utförs i samarbete mellan KTH och FMV.

Headline: Fartygsstrukturer av enkellaminat
Subject: Marine technology
Description:
Exjobbstart enligt överenskommelse, ansökan mottages löpande

Svenska Marinens större kompositfartyg är sedan lång tid designade och byggda som sandwichstrukturer.

En rad nya applikationer, krav och förutsättningar gör att det finns anledning att analysera och utvärdera material- eller konfigurationsalternativ för fartygsstrukturen, däribland enkellaminat. Några potentiella problem med sandwich som motiverar utredning är bl.a., men inte begränsat till:

- Ökade krav på kostnadseffektivitet i produktion, förutom fartygets drift- och underhållskostnad.
- Stora fartyg och höga farter gör potentiellt sandwichkonceptet mindre effektivt, med tjocka och dyra kärnmaterial samt relativt tätt mellan förstyvningarna.
- Dimensionerande globalstyrka gör sandwichstrukturen mindre lokalt optimerbar.
- För deplacerande framfart är behovet av extremt lätta strukturer inte avgörande.
- Förändrade riskbedömningar avseende potentiella skador.

Potential med enkellaminat (kontra sandwich):
- Effektivare produktion
- Färre ingående materialtyper
- Bibehållna positiva egenskaper relaterade till komposit (kontra metall)

Det övergripande målet är att generera alternativa strukturkonfigurationer och material för framtida fartyg, som kan förbättra ekonomi och/eller prestanda.

Studiesyftet är att utröna realiserbarhet (primärt konstruktion samt hållfasthet) och lämplighet (primärt materialkostnad samt strukturvikt) för användning av enkellaminat i bottenstruktur och bordläggning ombord framtida fartyg.

Jämförelser och utvärdering ska framför allt vara med relevanta/aktuella strukturlösningar av GRP- och CFRP-sandwichtyp.

Arbetet utgör bidrag till FMV:s teknikutveckling, framtida forskning och plattformsutformning.

Exjobbet utförs i samarbete mellan KTH och FMV.

Headline: Akterspegelsinverkan på fartygsprestanda
Subject: Marine technology
Description:
Akterspegelsinverkan på fartygsprestanda hos höghastighetsfartyg i lågfartsregistret

Exjobbstart enligt överenskommelse, ansökan mottages löpande.

Snabba fartyg utformas ofta med fokus på maxfartsbehov och -prestanda. Svenska Marinens snabba fartyg har en driftprofil som skiljer sig mycket från kommersiella fartyg, t.ex. nyttjar svenska korvetter hela fartregistret men en merpart av drifttiden ligger under halva maxfarten. Om fartyget är optimerat mot maxfart leder det potentiellt till att energiförbrukning över tid inte är optimal.

Snabba fartyg är ofta halvplanande med skarp akterspegel. Är fartyget dessutom utrustat med vattenjet tenderar akterspegeln att bli mycket djup, vilket har en negativ inverkan på energieffektiviteten i lägre farter. Ett uppenbart problem är att effektbehovet för att uppnå maxfart ökar till opraktiska nivåer ju effektivare fartyget är i lägre, deplacerande farter.

- Hur kan akterspegelns motståndsbidrag beräknas och modelleras på ett adekvat och effektivt sätt?

- Hur mycket bidrar ett akterskepp/en akterspegel optimerad för halvplaning till motståndet i olika farter?

- Hur kan akterspegel/akterskepp på ett enkelskrovsfartyg med högt maxfartsbehov utformas för att minska den totala energiförbrukningen över tid för en driftprofil som huvudsakligen utgörs av lågfartsdrift?

Arbetet utförs med utgångspunkt från svenska Marinens existerande fartyg och utgör bidrag till FMV:s teknikutveckling, framtida forskning och plattformsutformning.

Exjobbet utförs i samarbete mellan KTH och FMV.

Headline: Slanka fartygsskrov (Very Slender Vessel, VSV)
Subject: Marine technology
Description:
Exjobbstart enligt överenskommelse, ansökan mottages löpande.

Konceptet Very Slender Vessel VSV är inte väldefinierat men sammanfattar fartygsdesigner där slanka skrovs fördelaktiga vågbildningsmotstånd tas till vara för att nå god energiekonomi för relativt hög fart. Slanka skrov har låg formstabilitet och används därför ofta i katamaran- och trimaran-konfigurationer.

Slanka skrov beskrivs ibland som wave piercing, det vill säga att de skär genom sjö med relativt lugn gång med begränsade accelerations stötar. Låg vågbildning betyder god energihushållning och innebär också låg inverkan på omgivningen vilket kan vara fördelaktigt ur signaturperspektiv (ofta ett värde i militära eller polisiära sammanhang), och för den lokala miljön med minskad risk för erosion eller störningar för djurlivet.

Examensarbetet ska:
- Inventera, beskriva och eventuellt definiera VSV konceptet.
- Visa under vilka förutsättningar VSV är ett lämpligt val, dvs för vilka typer av operationer och under vilka sjöförhållanden VSV kan vara ett alternativ.

Arbetet bör innehålla teknisk analys av motstånd och sjöegenskaper hos slanka enskrovsfartyg, katamaraner och trimaraner samt värdering av hur dessa påverkar fartygens uthållighet, besättningens arbetsförhållanden och möjlighet för dem att utföra sina uppgifter och därmed fartyget att fungera i sin roll.

Arbetet utgör bidrag till FMV:s teknikutveckling, framtida forskning och plattformsutformning.

Exjobbet utförs i samarbete mellan KTH och FMV.

Headline: Fartygsrörelser
Subject: Marine technology
Description:
Exjobbstart enligt överenskommelse, ansökan mottages löpande.

Livslängden på en fartygskonstruktion är typiskt i storleksordningen 30 å,r men många gånger ännu längre. Det är ett skäl till att det är ganska vanligt att fartyg eller flytande konstruktioner konverteras för att utföra nya uppgifter. Vanligt är också att de börjar användas i geografiska områden med andra förhållanden än de, de ursprungligen konstruerades för.

Examensarbetet syftar till att studera, utveckla metodik och föreslå metoder att prediktera fartygs faktiska användbarhet. Det handlar om såväl systemfunktioner, dvs fartygets uppgift att patrullera, fiska, hydrografisk mätning, farledsunderhåll etc, som arbetsmiljö, t.ex. risk att ramla vid arbete på däck, svårigheter att koncentrera sig vid arbete framför datorskärm eller förhöjda risker vid arbete med kran, bogsering eller annan utrusningsassisterad verksamhet. Man skulle kunna se det som en omvänd sjöegenskapsanalys där man utgår från fartyget gensvar i sjö och sedan definierar vad det är möjligt att använda fartyget till.

En uppenbar svårighet i arbetet är hur man sätter mått på när användning är möjlig. Hur beskriver man när arbete på däck är säkert att utföra eller när rörelseinducerad kognitiv påverkan ökar risken för att fatta dåliga beslut?

Arbetet omfattar traditionell sjöegenskapsanalys och inblick i dagsaktuell forskning kring sjöegenskapskriterier.

Arbetet utgör bidrag till FMV:s teknikutveckling, framtida forskning och plattformsutformning.

Exjobbet utförs i samarbete mellan KTH och FMV.

Headline: Fasseparation av vätskeprov i olika fraktioner- Examensarbete, Ringhals
Subject: Chemical Science and Engineering
Description:
Power Climate Smarter living – det är vårt syfte. Vi är på jakt efter talangfulla studenter som vill hjälpa oss på vår resa mot ett fossilfritt liv. Genom att skriva ett examensarbete på Vattenfall får du en unik möjlighet att bidra till vårt syfte. Det enda vi begär av dig är att du frigör dina superkrafter och delar din energi med oss.

Om examensarbetet
Kemienheten har som huvuduppgift att övervaka och optimera kemiprocessen i kärnkraftverkens system. Detta görs genom analys, utvärdering och trenduppföljning av kemin i processvatten och luft från primär- och sekundärsystemen.

Ämnesområde/Uppdrag
Korrosionsprodukter analyseras regelbundet i olika systemvatten på Ringhals för att övervaka att ingen accelererad korrosion pågår på insidan av systemen. Korrosionsprodukterna koncentreras upp på filter avsedda för partikulära och jonogena föroreningar. Dessa filter löses sedan upp på kemilaboratoriet och analyseras med ICP-OES (Inductively Coupled Plasma - Optical Emission Spectrometer). Processen för uppslutning av prover tar relativt lång tid och Ringhals kemiavdelning tittar på möjligheterna att effektivisera provtagning och analysförfarandet.

Mål/Syfte
Syftet med arbetet är att undersöka möjligheten att fasseparera vätskeprov från reaktorvattnet i olika fraktioner med tonvikt på jonogena och partikulära korrosionsprodukter med hjälp av en statisk magnet samt ”chelat”-massa.

Målet är att redovisa vilka möjligheter som finns med ovanstående teknik att separera, koncentrera upp samt analysera partikulära och jonogena metallföroreningar i systemvatten.

Detta uppdrag är för 1 student

Din profil
Vi letar efter student/studenter som vill arbeta mot ett fossilfritt liv inom en generation och som snart tar examen från dina akademiska studier. Du är även någon som identifierar dig med våra principer: Aktiv, Öppen, Positiv och Säkerhet

• Utbildning – Kandidatexamen med inriktning mot kemi
• Omfattning - 15 hp
• Svenska: Mycket goda kunskaper i tal och skrift
• Engelska: Goda kunskaper i tal och skrift

Ytterligare information
• Uppdraget startar: under våren 2023 eller vid överenskommelse
• Placeringsort: Ringhals AB
• Ansökan – en kombinerad fil med ditt CV och personliga brev, samt en kopia av dina betyg.
• Sista ansökningsdag är 2022-11-30
• Kontaktperson och handledare på Vattenfall:
för- och efternamn: Jimmy Hägg
e-mail: jimmy.hagg@vattenfall.com
telefon: 072-5603386

Mångfald och inkludering – i allt vi gör
Vi är övertygade om att heterogena team kan överträffa homogena team. Men vi kan bara frigöra och använda kraften av mångfald när alla känner sig inkluderade. Läs mer om vårt viktiga arbete med mångfald och inkludering https://careers.vattenfall.com/se/jobba-med-oss/mangfald-inkludering/

Om Vattenfall
Vi på vattenfall har bestämt oss för att göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt inom en generation. För att lyckas måste vi, som ett av Europas största energibolag, först bli helt fossilfria själva. Men det räcker inte. För att bidra till ett fossilfritt samhälle måste vi göra mer än att enbart fokusera på hållbar energiproduktion.

För vi är övertygade om att om vi ska göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt inom en generation måste vi nämligen se på utmaningen ur ett bredare perspektiv än att enbart producera energi på ett hållbart sätt.

Följ med oss på vägen mot ett fossilfritt liv.

Vill du veta mer om oss? Besök www.vattenfall.se

Eftersom Vattenfall är en del av den svenska kritiska infrastrukturen är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Det innebär, om denna position är säkerhetsklassad, att slutkandidaterna kan vara föremål för en särskild säkerhetsprövning som är i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.

Headline: Hydrofoiling craft
Subject: Vehicle Engineering
Description:
Hydrofoiling craft is gaining attraction, both in commercial shipping applications as well as in measure craft. The electrification trend naturally puts new focus on hydrofoiling, although much of the underlying basics was explored in the 1960:s. At the division of Naval Architecture and Maritime Robotics we
- study the mechanics of hydrofoiling
- develop analytical tools for the flight dynamics
- develop control strategies for foiling craft (including e-foils)
- develop experimental platforms for experimental verification.

To work in our group, you need to be solution focused, curious, like to work in a team and understand the coupling between theoretical analysis and reality. We typically want to verity all our ideas experimentally. We think that we can challenge you both in terms of theoretical topics, implementation into usable code and if you like, in experimental verification.

if you are interested in any of these topics, feel free to contact professor Jakob Kuttenkeuler, jakob@kth.se, +46 70 3464240.

Headline: Stable Visualization of Intermediate Program Transformations
Subject: Computer Science and Engineering
Description:
Summary:
This thesis studies the feasibility, efficiency, and effectiveness of using stable graph layout algorithms to visualize the transformations performed by a JIT compiler.

Description:
Modern optimizing compilers are designed around a well-specified representation of the code under compilation: an Intermediate Representation (IR). They are typically arranged as a sequence of phases that transform gradually the initial IR into a semantically equivalent, optimized IR.

To understand, improve, and debug optimizing compilers, it is useful to represent the IR as a graph and the compilation process as a sequence of graphs. Different tools exist to support visualizing and stepping through IR graph sequences. Common to these tools is the use of unstable graph layout algorithms that depict a single graph without takinginto account its context. An example of two very similar graphs drawn using unstable graph layout algorithms is available at [1]. While ignoring context improves the quality of individual graphs, it makes it difficult to answer a basic question when stepping through a graph sequence: what changes from one step to the next one?

This thesis proposes investigating the feasibility, efficiency, and effectiveness of applying contextual, stable graph layout algorithms such as that of North and Woodhull [2] that balance the quality of individual graphs with the ease of identifying changes visually when stepping through the graph sequence. An example of the same graphs from [1] drawn using stable graph layout algorithms is available at [3].

The study will be conducted on the Ideal Graph Visualizer [4,5], an open-source tool that is part of OpenJDK [6], the reference Java implementation. A successful conduction of this study has the potential of improving the ability of compiler engineers to understand, improve, and debug the main JIT compiler for a programming language that is used by millions of developers.

Desired skills: Java, basic graph theory, basic data structure and algorithms theory (required); compiler theory (desired but not strictly required).

[1] https://robcasloz.github.io/blog/assets/unstable.png
[2] Online Hierarchical Graph Drawing, North and Woodhull, International Symposium on Graph Drawing, 2001.
[3] https://robcasloz.github.io/blog/assets/stable.png
[4] https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/tree/master/src/utils/IdealGraphVisualizer
[5] https://robcasloz.github.io/blog/2021/04/22/improving-the-ideal-graph-visualizer.html
[6] https://openjdk.java.net/
